title: Senior Data Analyst - Compliance
desc: OverviewSMBC is looking for an a Data Analyst to join the Compliance team. This person will be reporting to the Director of Analytics and Regulatory Innovation in the Compliance Department, Americas Division, the AML Analytics Analyst performs detailed analytics work in support of the AML Analytics group‚Äôs goals and objectives. This person will perform the collection, aggregation, analysis and visualization of customer, product, and transaction data. They will develop reports for use by SMBC Americas Division and Head Office stakeholders and performs analysis in support of the design, implementation, and enhancement of BSA/AML tools and systems, including AML transaction monitoring and sanctions screening systems.Responsibilities¬∑ Collect, aggregate, analyze, and visualize customer, product, and transaction data to identify trends and evaluate changes of customer, product, and transactional risk exposure.¬∑ Develop MIS reports for submission to senior Branch management.¬∑ Apply data from BSA/AML Compliance Department stakeholders to translate qualitative risk factors into responsive risk models that leverage new technology.¬∑ Work with Japan Research Institute-America partners to develop and test tools and systems in line with policy and regulatory expectations.¬∑ Apply economic, quantitative, and statistical skills in the development of tools and systems.¬∑ Develop knowledge of new analytical techniques and data sources that provide ongoing risk mitigation, and how emerging data and technology issues may impact the achievement of BSA/AML Compliance Department‚Äôs objectives.Qualifications¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in relevant discipline (e.g., Information Technology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or other related field).¬∑ BSA/AML compliance experience, particularly with data, platforms, and data management. ¬∑ Experience with some or all of the following technologies to build analysis and drive insights from data:o Database: Oracle (PL/SQL), Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL)o Analytics tools: R, Pythono Reporting tools: PowerBI, Tableau, Excelo Azure¬∑ Experience with SharePoint and Microsoft Office suite.¬∑ Strong reasoning ability and analytical skills.¬∑ Maintains high level of confidentiality; unquestionable character, integrity and professionalism.¬∑ Knowledge of vendor BSA/AML transaction monitoring and sanctions screening systems (e.g., Actimize, Fircosoft, Fortent) is a plus.¬∑ Familiarity with regtech is a plus.¬∑ ACAMS certified or other equivalent industry certification is a plus.

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc: If you have a minimum of 5 years experience in database reporting application development and you live and breathe data, our client has a fantastic work from home opportunity for you. This shop is the leading innovator in email monetization, dynamic subscriber engagement and real-time personalization. They enable publishers and brands to deliver the person-to-person experience subscribers expect at any scale, with a simple yet sophisticated platform that is easy to use, nimble and efficient. This established firm needs a disciplined, self-motivated database pro with Advanced R, Python, and SQL skills, as well as experience with BI Tools, to build reporting dashboards from the ground up, automate reporting for the entire company, and grow a data management team. Primary Responsibilities: Act as team lead for data management; analyze existing data storehouses and available reporting mechanisms to design, develop and implement reporting dashboards for all data-dependent company departments  Gather, document and refine requirements from stakeholders, iterate mock-ups and prototypes based on feedback from stakeholders  Develop and deploy automated reporting mechanisms based on stakeholder requirements  Assist in the selection and growth of data management team members to support reporting application development, deployment and ongoing support work  Consistently deliver against project milestones and deadlines, with regular progress reporting to management Required Experience, Skills and Traits 5+ years experience developing database and/or reporting applications, ideally with team leadership experience  Proven success managing software development projects and leading development teams  Advanced R, Python, SQL and BI Tools expertise  Experience working at a small company  Proven ability to work effectively under minimal supervision, from a shared workspace or home  Experience managing people is strongly preferred, but not a strict requirement  Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills

title: Office of the CAO | Reference Data, Technical Operations Analyst | Chicago/
desc: Job DescriptionThe Team:We are looking for leaders and problem solvers who are passionate about data and data management.The purpose of the Reference Data Product Management group is to manage daily operations of enterprise reference data systems and associated businesses processes. The role requires effective management of tactical, BAU activity, as well as longer term, more strategic projects to introduce product and process improvements.A successful candidate will be an analyst with a strong technical and operations background who communicates and collaborates effectively, taking ownership and accountability for a wide range of projects. Scope of projects will range from data design and analysis, to workflow design and automated report generation, to leveraging self-service tools and scripting in support of daily production operations. The candidate will demonstrate a track record of success in a technical operations role, with the ability to contribute meaningfully to superior analysis, tooling, and data-driven process improvements over time. The ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders; front office customers, project managers, business analysts, and technologists is highly valued.Primary Responsibilities:Reporting to the Project Management and Business Analysis (PM/BA) Lead, the Technical Operations Analyst will be responsible for supporting robust reference data operations, with a focus on instrument master data, but also including other types of reference data such as party and end of day pricing data.Design and help implement process automation and workflow tools (e.g. Jira).Support data design, collection, analysis, and automated report generation for change and incident management, as well as global operations.Design and configure functions within reference data (e.g. data quality checks), via GUI or SQL / scripting.Perform ad hoc data analysis, using a variety of tools as well as scripting.Work with technologists, project managers, and business analysts to deliver reference data system upgrades.Required SkillsQualifications:3 or more years of professional experience in financial services, with working knowledge of financial products and instruments.Proficient in SQL and at least one language (e.g. Python).Experience with workflow tools (e.g. Jira) and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau) preferred.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with multiple stakeholders.Very strong attention to detail, with an interest in process design and automation.Strong analytical skills.Education: BA/BS Bachelor‚Äôs Degree (STEM degree preferred)About CitadelCitadel is a global investment firm built around world-class talent, sound risk management, and innovative leading-edge technology. For a quarter of a century, Citadel‚Äôs hedge funds have delivered meaningful and measurable results to top-tier investors around the world, including sovereign wealth funds, public institutions, corporate pensions, endowments and foundations.  With an unparalleled ability to identify and execute on great ideas, Citadel‚Äôs team of more than 675 investment professionals, operating from offices including Chicago, New York, San Francisco, London, Hong Kong and Shanghai, deploy capital across all major asset classes, in all major financial markets.

title: Sr Data Analyst
desc: ABOUT US Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We're a data-first marketing platform startup, and we approach our work seriously; we tackle problems in a scrappy and disruptive fashion, yet we build for scale to support our clients at big data volume.  We are the first and only enterprise customer data platform with a fully-integrated marketing cloud. Moving beyond the limitations of both categories, Simon's platform empowers businesses to leverage enterprise-scale big data and machine learning to power customer communications in any channel. Simon's unique approach allows brands to develop incredible personalization capabilities without needing to build and maintain massive bespoke data infrastructure.  Our culture is rooted in organizational transparency, empowering individuals, and an attitude of getting things done. If you want to be a valuable contributor on a team that cultivates these core values we would love to hear from you. The Role: As a Data Analyst at Simon, you will work across the organization to generate the data and analysis needed to make the best decisions as we grow and innovate. You'll be responsible for pushing the business forward based on insights derived from your deep understanding of our data and operations. You'll have exposure to our executives with the opportunity to learn from their industry leading experience.  You are someone who's curious and passionate about establishing and measuring metrics/KPIs and using data to answer a hypothesis instead of "gut-feel". You care deeply about your work and always seek to grow your knowledge and skills. WHAT YOU'LL DOAnalyze and transform data in order to derive meaningful insights for internal stakeholdersDevelop and maintain Looker dashboards, looks and models to deliver insightsBuild out dbt and Looker models to incorporate new data fields or sourcesPartner with data engineering to ingest new data sources and maintain current data pipesAssist in building out training program for Lookers for end users to be self-sufficientQUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in a quantitative fieldStrong analytical skillsFluency in SQL (LookML is a plus)Experience with Snowflake, Looker, and dbt is a plus.Excellent communication of insights and concepts to technical and non-technical audiencesGrowth mindset: you seek out learning opportunities for yourself and the teamVisa sponsorship for this role is currently not available.Diversity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Sr Data Analyst- Population Health
desc: NYU School of Medicine is one of the nation‚Äôs top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Position Summary: We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Sr Data Analyst  In this role, the successful candidate The successful applicant will join DataCore, an innovative team within NYU Langone Health‚Äôs Medical Center Information Technology department that utilizes state-of-the-art technology and informatics products to meet the clinical research and analytics needs of a prestigious institution. S/he will primarily support the Center for Healthcare Innovation and Delivery Science (CHIDS). CHIDS is a locus for collaboration among clinicians, researchers, educators, and administrators, who are working together in accelerating the transformation to a learning healthcare system and to improve patient outcomes. S/he will collaborate closely with faculty, clinicians, fellow data analysts, and biostatisticians to advance research and practice in healthcare implementation science, quality of care, and patient safety. In particular, s/he will perform a key role in organizing databases, creating and aggregating datasets, and contributing to analyses for studies in the areas of outcomes-related research, chronic disease management, standard care pathways evaluation, and patient care quality and safety. S/he will also be a key contributor to a federally-funded grant to create a Patient Imaging Quality and Safety Laboratory. Applicants are required to have strong programming and data management skills, including but not limited to proficiency in SAS, R, and SQL and experience in retrieving and analyzing data from clinical and claims databases. Job Responsibilities:Optimize utilization of patient-generated data for research and care; develop rapid-cycle analytic processes with associated feedback to drive improvements in quality, efficiency, and financial performance.Extract, analyze, and present insights from clinical, administrative, and operational data; manage and improve existing databases; develop programs, methodologies, and source files for data analysis and presentation.Provide clinical data for research projects and operational improvement initiatives; perform data analysis in support of ad-hoc requests; collaborate with researchers and administrators in refining query parameters of clinical data extraction/analytical support requests.Combine disparate data sources into an integrated database or dataset.Develop data extraction programs/routines for data transfer to authorized agencies or individuals.Support DataCore clinical research projects in programming tables, listings, and figures (TLFs) using SAS (e.g. for DSMC, QA/QC, etc.).Minimum Qualifications: To qualify you must have a Typically requires 4 or more years of experience and BA/BS degree or equivalent. Preferred Qualifications: SAS Certification preferred, Experience with Population Health information and Clinical Trials Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. NYU School of Medicine provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you‚Äôll feel good about devoting your time and your talents. title: Data Analyst
desc: The Oneida ESC Group is a family of companies owned by the Oneida Nation of Wisconsin that delivers customer-focused engineering, science, and construction services worldwide.  Our family of companies include: Oneida ESC Group (OESC), Oneida Total Integrated Enterprises (OTIE), Mission Support Services (MS2), Sustainment & Restoration Services (SRS) and Oneida Engineering Solutions (OES). We integrate our staff for dedicated, cooperative, and business-like delivery of services to enhance our customers missions.  Sustainment & Restoration Services (SRS) is an 8(a) firm that provides engineering, science, construction, munitions, and specialized professional services solutions for customers nationwide.  SRS has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst the United States Military Academy, West Point.  The Office of Economic and Manpower Analysis (OEMA) and the Economics Department at The United States Military Academy, West Point welcomes applications for one open Data Analyst position in direct support of our mission of conducting policy analysis for senior leaders in the Department of Defense. Data Analysts in OEMA work alongside PhD economists conducting empirical research on topics in labor and public economic fields using administrative data from government, non-profit and private sources. These include, for example, data from the Army, Department of Defense, Veterans Affairs, Social Security Administration, credit bureaus, and the National Student Clearinghouse. Successful analysts are those who have demonstrated the ability to work with large datasets, have an appreciation for and experience with genuine empirical research, and have an interest in pursuing economics or policy research at the graduate level in the future. A completed B.S. in Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related degree is required at the time of appointment.  EOE- Minorities/Females/Disabled/VeteransSDL2017

title: Data Analyst -Policy Analytics
desc: Job DescriptionAbout TLC. The New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission (TLC) is the nation‚Äôs largest for-hire transportation agency, licensing and regulating the City‚Äôs yellow and green taxicabs, for-hire vehicles (including apps like Uber, Lyft, Via and Juno), commuter vans, and luxury limousines. TLC develops and enforces rules to promote safety, transparency, as well as consumer and driver protection for a vital mode of transport in New York City. The vehicles, businesses, and drivers licensed and regulated by the agency move over one million people a day. With the introduction of new apps and technologies, TLC is on the front lines of a changing mobility landscape in New York City. TLC collaborates with renowned universities on data analysis, builds partnerships with leaders around the globe on the future of transportation, and works to streamline agency operations to meet the demands of a changing industry. TLC is a committed partner of the Mayor‚Äôs Vision Zero initiative to promote safe driving and a leader in city-wide initiatives, including open data and the growth of the City‚Äôs wheelchair accessible taxi and for-hire vehicle fleets.  About the Policy Analytics team. The Policy Analytics team provides policy guidance, liaises with a variety of external stakeholders, and spearheads new and exciting projects and initiatives within the TLC, with a focus on leveraging big data to produce actionable insights and policy recommendations. The Team works closely with the Office of the Commissioner to ensure the agency fulfills its mission while monitoring current events in the industry, both in New York City and other cities and countries. The team manages and conducts large research projects, KPI tracking and rapid prototyping of innovative data technologies, often liaising with other city organizations to work on multi-agency initiatives. Policy research and analytics focuses on the core areas of TLC‚Äôs regulatory power‚Äîensuring safety, accessibility, and accountability‚Äîutilizing big data including taxi and for-hire vehicle trip data (including expanded data from the new category of High-Volume For-Hire Services including Uber, Lyft, Via, and Juno) and administrative data on drivers and vehicles. This position will focus on monitoring impacts of policies related to congestion and driver pay.  Under the supervision of the Policy Analytics Manager, the Data Analyst will:  ‚Ä¢ Build out new metrics and KPIs to track congestion impacts of for-hire services.  ‚Ä¢ Wrangle, review and analyze trip, income, and vehicle data to monitor compliance and inform decisions, produce reports, and generate policy recommendations using SQL, Python, R, Excel, Access, and GIS software.  ‚Ä¢ Prepare data for analysis by cleaning and removing outliers, work with team to develop scripts to clean data automatically, document data and analyses.  ‚Ä¢ Manage driver pay research projects, developing work plans and timelines, identifying milestones, completing tasks, and managing projects to completion  ‚Ä¢ Coordinate with staff from other divisions at TLC and from other City agencies and with external consultants on projects  ‚Ä¢ Participate in policy planning and problem-solving sessions, work with key staff and stakeholders to seek feedback on policy ideas, and develop requirements  ‚Ä¢ Write and edit reports and policy memos  ‚Ä¢ Prepare and present slide decks to the Commission, senior staff, licensees, and members of the general publicMinimum Qual Requirements1. A master's degree from an accredited college or university in economics, statistics, finance, management, business administration, public administration, public policy or related field; or A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by 24 semester credits in one or more of the course areas of economics, statistics, finance, management, mathematics, business administration, public administration, and public policy, 12 semester credits of which must have been in economics; and one year of satisfactory full-time experience in one or more of the  fields of finance; economic, fiscal or statistical research; policy analysis; or quantitative, business, market or financial analysis. Graduate semester credits in any of the areas described in "1" above may be substituted for the undergraduate  semester credits on the basis that each 3 graduate semester credits may be substituted for 6 of the required undergraduate semester credits.  Special Note  To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II individuals must have, in addition to meeting the minimum requirements, at least one additional year of full-time experience listed in "2" above. title: Data Science Systems Programmer Analyst
desc: At Brown Brothers Harriman, we believe no job is too big or small for any of us to handle if it helps our clients. We value passionate, committed people who enjoy collaborating with others to find new solutions to complex business challenges. We are looking for the type of person who speaks their mind, truly listens and steps outside their role to add value wherever they can. Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all, we seek someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in protecting and enhancing our client's financial well-being.  If you are looking for an entrepreneurial environment where you can learn and thrive, Brown Brothers Harriman is the right place for you  The Data Science Programmer Analyst for Compliance Systems Division will be primarily responsible for aggregating and analyzing data to create actionable insights to drive the results. Use advanced statistical techniques to provide deeper understanding of data behavior and actions and collaborates with business partners to recommend improvements across the application. title: Senior Product Data Analyst
desc: The Senior Analyst, Product is responsible for providing the analytical support to the Product team to develop, assist in execution, and continuously improve upon a market growth strategy that supports profitable growth across the entire Product portfolio including Medicaid, Medicare, Complete Care, HARP, CHP, and Essential Plan.  This position would perform ad hoc and drilldown analyses ad hoc and drilldown analyses on product trends and concerns as well as work with other Healthfirst departments on data and reporting designs. The Senior Analyst, Product will draw insights from data, identify areas of opportunities for membership growth and medical cost savings, communicating this information concisely to Product leads, and help translate these opportunities into actionable items.  The incumbent will interact and collaborate with various subject matter experts from departments across the organization and provide analytical support to product leads and must be comfortable presenting reports to all levels of management internally/externally.Duties/Responsibilities:Work collaboratively with finance analysis, sales, and marketing to support market growth and retention plans to achieve membership objectivesRegularly partner with Strategic Alliances to review PPS project status and identify areas of opportunityidentify initiatives to improve healthcare effectiveness and develop metrics to track progressUnderstand program changes and the impact established metricsPrepare materials needed for various meetings, assuring that all information is validated and accurateCompile information from multiple sources to prepare and distribute time-sensitive and accurate reporting for internal and external audiencesAnalyze the financial performance of products, identify favorable and unfavorable trends, develop recommendations to improve trends, communicate recommendations to managementDesign, create, modify, support and maintain monthly competitive reportsPrepare ad-hoc reporting as required by senior management and external partnersCreate models to forecast growth and retention performance and financial outcomesEffectively manage projects by setting clear project milestones and deliverables; clearly communicating goals, objectives and responsibilities. Lead and/or participate in meetings to gather and specify departmental requirements for such projectsDevelop applications and reports using SAS/SQL, Microsoft Excel, and other pertinent databasesMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs Degree from accredited institutionExperience in a similar roleAdvance skills with SAS and/or SQL and ability to query, compile, and manipulate large datasetsAdvance skills in Microsoft ExcelUnderstand and translate highly complex concepts to a wide range of audienceExperience in analyzing membership growth and retention trends and identifying driversAbility to efficiently validate data and analyses to identify potential errors in final resultsHighly analytical person who can demonstrates problem solving and critical thinking skillsTeam player who contributes to creating a positive work environmentAgility and flexibility to adjust to the evolving healthcare program this position supportsPreferred Qualifications:Experience working in a health care delivery system or a health insurance companyKnowledge of Medicare and Medicaid programs, health care, and managed care5 years of experience in a similar roleWE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. title: Tapia Data Science, Data Analytics, Technical Business Analyst (Lead Data Analyst)
desc: For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart.  We are delivering an integrated set of solutions for highly complex financial issues. Our expertise and infrastructure make us critical to the evolving global markets. Strength, stability, and safety are at our core. We are investing wisely for the future to bolster growth, improve returns and deepen client relationships. We always strive to provide a consistent high-quality experience and aim to deliver consistent performance for every client, every time, every day.  The Role  As a Technical Business Analyst/Lead Data Analyst, you will designs and create highly complex logical/physical data models, and data dictionaries that cater to the specific business and functional requirements of applications. You will consult with businesses to identify needs and translates those needs into data architecture solutions. You will develop comprehensive data/technical specifications that bridge business/product needs with system design/deliverables. You'll perform data extracts and create complex data reports to analyze user metrics Key responsibilities include:Under moderate guidance, works with internal and external datasets and client reference data and provides analysis.Provides analytical support and prepares drafts of standard and ad hoc reports for assigned area at the request of managers and/or other leaders.Presents complex data in a concise and meaningful manner leveraging Excel, BI tools, SQL, data integrity tools, and data presentation tools. Lead Data Analyst->> Analyzes application requirements and develops conceptual, logical and first-cut physical database designs (data models). Creates associated data model documentation such as entity and attribute definitions and formats. Assists in logical data designs to deliver stable and flexible high performance data solutions. Investigates and corrects data discrepancies by reconciling faulty codes. Provides data element naming consistent with standards and conventions and ensures that data dictionaries are maintained across multiple database environments (mainframe, distributed systems). Ensures data content/quality by planning and conducting moderately complex data warehouse system tests, monitoring test results and taking required corrective action. Acts as a liaison to data owners to establish necessary data stewardship responsibilities (accountability for a particular data element/verifying accuracy of the data element before loading it into the database) and procedures. Analyzes and designs data models, logical databases and relational database definitions using both forward and backward engineering techniques. Seeks opportunities to promote data sharing, and to reduce redundant data processes within the corporation by identifying common structures across application areas. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. QualificationsBachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required.Four to six (4-6) years of experience in data modeling, data warehousing, data entity analysis, logical and relational database design, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience is required.Data Analysis skills.Strong Excel skills (including Pivot Tables).Experience with one of more Data Analysis / BI tools.Experience with a programming / scripting language.Candidate will ideally have experience in one or more of the following:Excel Macros'Data' languages such as Python, R, etc.BI tools such as Tableau, QlikView, Power BISQLData Governance tools such as CollibraAI / Machine Learning tools / techniques such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forecasts, etc.Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, NumPy, MatLab, etc.Applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.  Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.  Primary Location: United States-New York-New York  Internal Jobcode: 45092  Job: Information Technology  Organization: Office of CIO-HR18027  Requisition Number: 1912087SDL2017

title: Senior Financial Data & Business System Analyst
desc: The Senior Financial Data & Business System Analyst reporting to the Controller with dotted line to Associate Director of Budget oversees the development and delivery of Adaptive budgeting tool, and business intelligence solutions, reporting and data analytics.  The Senior Analyst is responsible for maintaining and improving operational reports (budget requests, dashboards and ad hoc reporting requests) and analytics that inform users on institutional and departmental results. The Senior Analyst will work closely with Institutional Research and IT teams to increase automation and improve reporting. The Senior Analyst is also responsible to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the various other reporting deliverables. Job Duties:Monitor the budget planning process from the start to final budget implementation.Analyzes business and technical information and provides analytical support to business decisions making.Collaborates with internal customers to understand business needs and opportunities.Provides intermediate to complex analysis, supporting the planning and implementation of systems and upgrades, and process changes.Assist in monitoring department budget requests and produce various ad-hoc reports to help identify budgetary trends and to calculate various projections.Manage budgeting system tool (Adaptive Planning) including system design, deployment, data integration with legacy systems and providing continuous improvement efforts for enhancements.Utilize data from variety of sources to develop reusable reports to transform operation data into actionable business intelligence and to assist management in accessing data for content and meaning.Assist with planning and evaluation of financial information systems including defining Institute specific requirements and accessing their compatibility with daily accounting and budgeting processes.Maintain user access and controls in Adaptive budgeting and business intelligence tools.Manage financial reporting in Business Objects including existing reports maintenance, enhancements and new report development.Development and deployment of various monthly reports to identify misclassified transactions and overspending to assist department managers in taking timely remedial actions.Identify pain points within existing financial information systems, provide solutions and establish best practices to minimize redundant workflow and data fragmentation.Partake in special projects and various Institute initiatives to improve data quality, reduce data processing time and to streamline accounting and budgeting processes.Work with business users, and enterprise data architect to refine/adapt/maintain data mappings as business user needs change or the data environment changes.Other special projects as assigned.Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree required preferribly in computer science or business, MBA a plus. Experience:At least 5 years of experience using SAP Business Objects including both creating and maintaining complex queries, views and stored procedures. Experience in Adaptive budget tool preferred.Strong business and systems analysis skills, test planning and testing skills, troubleshooting skills and experience with numerous environments and architectures.Experience in higher education or complex non-profit preferred.Advanced skills in MS Excel (ability to create and use pivot tables, macros, lookups,etc), Access, and PowerPoint.The ideal candidate must be highly organized with an attention to details. The ability to adapt to and lead change in a business environment is also critical.Must be an independent and creative thinker.Must be able to work with and communicate with individuals at all levels within the Institution.Must be able to present ideas clearly and concisely to all audiences verbally and in writing.Proven analytical, problem solving, time management and organizational skillsPlease submit your cover letter and resume. If you are selected for an interview, please be prepared to provide at least 5 References via our on-line reference tool system. At least 2 of your References must be, or have been, your direct managers.

title: Data Analyst - Insurance - XDuce
desc: Lead Data Analyst ‚Äì Insurance  Loc: NYC  Term: 12 Months  Lead Data Analyst resource on a large project supporting our Programs business. The business unit writes P&C insurance through about 40 Managing General Agents (MGAs). The project will revise the way that we bring the policy, claim and cash remittance data from external parties into QBE and how we validate, report on, and feed downstream systems like the general ledger and reinsurance systems within QBE.  We have an immediate need for the requirements phase of this project:  Ideally the resources would work out of our NY office, with the potential for infrequent paid travel to other vendor locations in the US.  The DA resource should have a strong understanding of insurance data including the ability to define and document data models. In this project, most of their role will be on helping define the data intake and output requirements, helping collect and document data validation rules, and perform data mapping between source and target models.  Both resources should have strong P&C insurance domain knowledge. We need people with some combination of knowledge in the P&C industry across policy administration, claims administration, and / or insurance accounting.

title: Master Data Analyst
desc: Site Name: USA - New Jersey - Warren Posted Date: Oct 24 2019Master Data Analyst  This role is responsible for master data set up and maintenance in the North America Supply and Demand Planning Department, ensuring that end to end new SKU set up and ongoing parameter maintenance is performed timely and accurately in relevant planning systems for both supply and demand planning.  The job holder will be the primary point of contact for all data related queries from both internal and external customers and will have a leading role into driving the importance of data quality and system integrity. The role has a process and system dimension, participating in process improvement capability initiatives and new system implementation.  This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following: Data Management Collect from key stakeholders, create and Maintain Master data and key parameters in Supply planning and demand forecasting systems in line with systems role profile under the responsibility of Supply and Demand Planning function (e.g. GMM/ECC/SNP APO/APO DP)Review reports on data quality as per monthly standard work (in terms of completeness, Integrity, Accuracy, Consistency). Correct or co-ordinate correction of data and issue resolution as a part of Data Quality Review.Participate and support the NPI process ensuring that all data is entered prior to launch date to maximise customer service levels. Complete any other NPI activities linked to SKU set up as appropriate (e.g. PIR, Source list, SID form, CVC setup)Ensure appropriate life cycle management of SKUsResponsible for UPC Creation, One World Sync and Integration between DCS and CERPS, as applicable to North AmericaProcesses, Failure Free and Improvement Perform Root Cause Analysis on any issues identified on master data quality and process and drive continuous improvement on process, systems and people capabilityRaise process improvement opportunities, standardise and simplify Ways of working, in collaboration with capability and operational planning teams and key stakeholders (e.g. Customer Service, Sites, other regional planning teams) ensuring a consistent approach to data management.Systems & Projects support Participate and support the Master data process development and data verification in the hub, as a result of CERPS / MERPS Implementation.Support system developments (e.g. GMM) by identifying and raising opportunities for process improvementLiaise with the wider business and keep up to date with latest developments that impact Master Data systems and processes and ensure integration of new ways of working in the Supply planning HubDocumentation Responsible to keep the Planning Teams SOPs on Master Data up to dateWhy you?Basic Qualifications:We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Graduate with a degree in science, IT, engineering or business3+ years of experience in supply chain preferable in a master data maintenance roleGood technical knowledge of the IT systems (GMM, SAP ECC and APO)Good knowledge of master data relevant to supply and demand planning systems and their impact on planning processesExperience on process improvement and system developmentGood analytical skillsGood problem-solving skillsGood process documentation skillsDisciplined in approach to tasks and good attention to detail.Interpersonal skillsPreferred Qualifications:If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus: MBA in science, IT, engineering or businessWhy GSK?Our values and expectationsare at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.  These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities: Operating at pace and agile decision-making using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning.Sustaining energy and well-being.Building strong relationships and collaboration, honest and open conversations.Budgeting and cost-consciousness. title: SAS Programmer Analyst / Healthcare Claims Data
desc: Position Details: Our client, a world leading Pharmaceutical Company in New Brunswick, NJ is currently looking for a SAS Programmer Analyst / Healthcare Claims Data join their expanding team  Job Title: SAS Programmer Analyst / Healthcare Claims Data  Duration: 09 months contract, extendable up to 24 months  Location: New Brunswick, NJ 08901 Note: Client has the right-to-hire you as a permanent employee at any time during or after the end of contract.  You may participate in the company group medical insurance plan Description: The Senior Analyst will partner closely with colleagues from the broader organization to extract raw data from servers, create analytical data files, and execute statistical analyses based on protocol specifications. The successful candidate's responsibilities will include overseeing and implementing analyses against in-house observational data resources, including administrative healthcare claims, surveys, and electronic health records, as well as consultation and support to evaluate data external. The position will be primarily responsible for developing code sets for team approval, creating data specification files and analytical files by writing and executing programs across our available observational databases, executing statistical analyses conducting quality assurance and code validation, reviewing programming code and data, drafting analysis reports, and supporting the final publication/presentation of results as part of an overall observational study.  The analysts will also be expected to explore the implementation of new approaches for working with "big data in healthcare. Some tasks may include exploratory visualization, development of macros and tools, and machine learning algorithms. Participation in the activities of the larger Epidemiology Department and the office of Chief Medical Officer will also be encouraged.  An advanced degree in Biostatistics, Public Health, Epidemiology, Informatics, Computer Science or other related field is required.  At least 5 years of experience in statistical programming (e.g. R, SAS), and/or database programming (e.g. SQL) is required.  At least 5 years of experience in programming against large healthcare datasets is required.  At least 2 years of relevant prior work experience in the healthcare industry within a pharmaceutical or device company, insurer, or within a health system is required.  In-depth knowledge of the structure and caveats of healthcare claims databases, electronic medical records and/or hospital billing data is required  Knowledge in epidemiologic and statistical concepts such as confounding, bias, cumulative incidence, incidence rate, regression models, survival analyses  Strong written and verbal communication skills

title: US Data Quality and Governance Business Analyst
desc: Your RoleAre you organized? Are you forward thinking? Are you part project manager, part strategist, and part relationship manager? Are you a financial professional with a strong experience managing data governance and data quality? If so, we would like to discuss an opportunity with you because we are looking for someone like you to support our US-based data quality and data governance organization.  Data Management has emerged across the financial services industry and beyond as one of the key-most enablers of efficient and effective processing, and of high quality outputs. As an industry leader in the space, UBS is continually evolving and enhancing its data management practices and is currently looking for the right individual to support the design and deployment of the next evolution of its data quality framework (i.e. DQ profiling, monitoring, rules, control, metrics, and DQ issue management) across its US-based operations. We're essentially looking for the right individual, with the drive and talent to help us deliver on our vision of building the most efficient, effective, sustainable, and trusted data environment possible.Join usWe're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.Disclaimer / Policy StatementsUBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.Your teamYou will be working in the Group Operations Data Management Office (DMO). This specific role sits within the Combined US-Operations (CUSO) Execution team (an arm of the DMO organization). The CUSO Execution team is responsible for working directly with CUSO front and back-office subject matter experts to improve data governance and data quality for the CUSO organization. The DMO is responsible for leading the definition of the firm's enterprise-wide data strategy and proactively challenging the way the firm works with data. The DMO is comprised of over 100 professionals located across the United States, London, Zurich, and India.

title: Analyst, Advanced Data Modeler
desc: Media Storm (A Division of Water Cooler Group) New York, NY (SOHO)Analyst, Advanced Data Modeler The Analyst, Advanced Data Modeler will leverage technology and advanced analytical methods to organize, analyze, evaluate and discover new insights hidden in large scales of data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. title: Senior Data Analyst
desc: The ChallengeWe work with thousands of partners, hundreds of thousands of paying customers, millions of resumes, and billions of data points. We're profitable and have scaled fast on our current architecture, but need someone smart to read between the lines and use data to take us to 10x and beyond.The RoleWe have a rapidly growing cloud-based infrastructure, and you'll work closely and liaise with all departments: Engineering, Marketing, Business Development, Ops, and Finance, and most importantly, Product. You'll be a part of the Product team because we want you to help dictate what and how we should be building. It'll be a critical role on a critical team. We're looking for someone who thrives on looking at multiple disparate sets of data and diving in to tell us something we don't know. You should want to tell us what would help the business, and spec out resources and requirements to do so. You will be encouraged to "hack" a lot of one-off reports and visualizations. We expect a great candidate to have a lot of upward mobility in our burgeoning business intelligence unit.Skills & RequirementsYou have a passionate relationship with big data and/or data mining.You have data manipulation skills and the ability to navigate relational databases via SQL, NoSQL architectures, and flat log files alike.You have expert knowledge of data presentation and visualization and experience in one or more of Excel, Tableau, Periscope Data, Looker, D3, Highcharts, or other data viz platforms.Your "tool of choice" is actually a hybrid of tools, anything from R to command line scripting to something analog and offline. You're interested in what have data achieves.You're authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.You, If We're LuckyYou have an advanced degree in a quantitative field.You're conflicted about wanting to be a Product Manager or a Data Engineer.You have exposure to scripting or MVC languages in a team environment.We're a team full of tech polyglots and that excites you instead of terrifying you.You've scaled something weird and strange before.You've had quant and data analysts as direct reports.You have a great one-week-of-work-saved-my-company-millions story.You have startup experience!What Makes Us DifferentWe operate with the agility of a startup, but have the stability of a well-established organizationWe value work-life balanceWe offer competitive pay + optionsEmployees can pick the computer setup of their choosing. Whatever helps you work better, it's yours At Talent, Inc. we believe culture and thought diversity lead to better teams and stronger companies. We seek talented, qualified employees regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Talent, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Come join our team. Together we'll help others tell their career stories and land their dream jobs.

title: Senior Metrics and Reporting Analyst - Data Governance and Management
desc: Senior Metrics and Reporting Analyst - Data Governance and Management  Apply Now  Start apply with LinkedIn  Start  Please wait...  Date: Oct 18, 2019  Location: Lebanon, NJ, US  Company: New York Life Insurance Co  A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It's a career journey you can be proud of, and you'll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation. It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses Be Good At Life. To learn more, please visit LinkedIn, our Newsroom and the Careers page of *******************.  The New York Life Security Organization is looking for an individual to provide data management and governance functions in support of the services we deliver. We are looking for a skilled professional to work with the data owners across numerous sources to facilitate ingestion for our reporting programs. This person will also be responsible for building processes to ensure that the data is complete and accurate. Data accuracy is a critical function for our organization as it will support multiple programs and reporting thereof that will be delivered to oversight committees, audit teams, regulatory requests, and management up to and possibly including the Board of Trustees.  Role and Responsibilities  Work with data owners to develop and improve delivery methods to support our metrics and reporting needs  Develop and improve data accuracy and assurance processes  Ensure providing complete, accurate, and timely metrics information to stakeholders  Ensure a standard process is used throughout the security organization for data collection, preparation and quality  Work with the dashboarding team to ensure data preparation meets the metric requirements  Actively solicit input from stakeholders and provide feedback to the leadership and program managers  Assist periodic refinement of standards-based and best practices compliant security metrics  Meet with area managers and governance teams to understand their metric and reporting needs  Provide project estimations for build and run of new and updated dashboards  Work with system owners to improve data ingestion (automation, direct connectors, etc)  Manage any 3rd party consultants employed to support data management and governance  Ensure the security of the data within the databases/data-hubs/and other storage locations used therein  Follow best practices for secure code development  Follow NYL TDLC and other process and standards Qualifications Experience in managing/developing data preparation workflows (e.g., Alteryx, Trifacta, Tableau Prep)  Experience in developing and executing change management around data-sources, including training and awareness, stakeholder communication, issue resolution and escalation protocols  Understanding and experience in data management, including ETL processes, database principles, data security and stewardship  Experience in software development life-cycle and methodologies (e.g., Agile development)  Preferred Experience in supporting programming/ development tools (such as R, Python, VBA) for ad-hoc advanced insights and reporting  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Ability to tailor communication style to audience at hand and to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical resources.  Self-directed, works with minimal guidance, and recognizes when guidance needed.  Ability to manage multiple tasks  Ability to gather and document requirements and translate to technical plans  Technical background, with an ability to think outside the box and propose original solutions.  Prefer an understanding of the following technologies is required:  Tableau  Trifacta  SQL Integration Services  SQL Management Studio  SQL Reporting Services R Python  Possess a willingness to learn innovative approaches and tools in a fast-paced environment. General Experience, Education and Professional Certifications: Minimum 3-5 years of experience in data management and governance related roles  BA/BS Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience in technology roles SF: LI-CC1EOE M/F/D/V If you have difficulty using or interacting with any portions of this Web site due to incompatibility with an Assistive Technology, if you need the information in an alternative format, or if you have suggestions on how we can make this site more accessible, please contact us at: **************. title: Fraud Data Analyst

title: Marketing Data Analyst
desc: What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, youll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. Were the worlds leading research and advisory company, achieving consistent double-digit growth by steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they cant find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development as well as unlimited growth opportunities. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.Title:Marketing Analyst - Digital Markets - Stamford, CT About Gartner Digital Markets: Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology decisions and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three leading brandsCapterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming. Job Brief: This position reports to the Senior Manager, Marketing Analytics. You will help lead digital marketing analysis and reporting efforts to guide and advance marketing initiatives and strategies for Gartner Digital Markets. You will collaborate closely with other stakeholders to provide them with comprehensive customer behavioral insights, as well as build reports, dashboards, and new KPIs to measure business health. In an analytic capacity, this position will leverage data from a variety of disparate sources to deliver actionable insights for business decision making and monitoring.  The ideal candidate will enjoy working in a fast-paced but highly collaborative environment with white space opportunity to make an impact. You will collaborate with A+ colleagues and work directly with leaders at every level. You also subscribe to our philosophy of Team first, always. What You Will Do:Develop quantitative analyses, build dashboards, and support ad hoc reporting to provide insight into performance of marketing channels and identify opportunities to drive growth in user engagement and revenue.Assist with the automation of reporting and dashboards, currently maintained by the analytics team as well as reporting owned by stakeholders across a variety of teams within the marketing organization.Maintain weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports used to measure the effectiveness/health of marketing channels. Make the necessary changes and enhancements to these reports as needed by the business.Maintain the accuracy/integrity of data across multiple technologies and tools, and promote database health through validation, testing, and routine audits. Lead the effort to implement exception reporting, and ensure the right checks and balances are in place to promote accurate reporting.Extract and manipulate data from multiple data sources including web, marketing, and transactional databases to create integrated views that give analyses a holistic perspective.Work with engineering teams to resolve data issues that impact data accuracy, and ensure data infrastructure exists to provide purpose and quality to end users.Collaborate with technical resources to ensure database integrations with other tools are properly implemented and integrated for marketing and reporting purposesProactively identify meaningful trends or patterns that impact strategic decisions and future marketing investments and regularly share results with marketing stakeholders.Who You Are:Youre curious youre always trying to understand the why, and youre confident in wrestling the underlying data in order to get there.Youre flexible you understand priorities change, requiring you to shift focus when needed, while also working on multiple projects in parallel.Youre collaborative and you genuinely like working with people you have emotional and professional maturity, and you thrive in environments where you can partner and work closely with a variety of teams in many different locations.Youre positive you love data and you understand it can sometimes be challenging, but that doesnt keep you from staying positive and enthusiastic day in and day out.You are an effective communicator - you possess the verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills that are essential to translating quant-based analyses into digestible, actionable insights.What You Will Need:Bachelor or MS in quantitative marketing or a related field with a strong interest in digital marketing, and 3+ years related experienceProficiency with table creation and querying using SQL, strong understanding of relational databasesProficiency with generating big data visualization using Tableau or Microsoft Power BIProficiency with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Omniture, CoremetricsComfortable working with all Microsoft applicationsPPC platform experience a plus (AdWords and Bing)Brings a highly creative approach to quantitative analysis and problem solving and is able to comfortably think outside the traditional methodologies to analyze data and render findingsExceptional analytical skills. Ability to draw conclusions and actionable recommendations based on insights derived from analysis, while presenting results with easily understood and meaningful charts and tables.Must be able to make intelligent business decisions in a timely manner, while working under tight deadlines on multiple projects and be comfortable working with data derived from a variety of data sources.Ability to learn quickly and utilize new tools for data exploration and analysis.Who We Are:Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen.Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. Were humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development.Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually.What We Offer:Limitless growth and learning opportunities.A collaborative and positive culture Your team will be as smart and driven as youOutstanding compensation Plus competitive benefits and generous time offA chance to make an impact Your work will contribute directly to our strategy #DigitalMarkets  Job Requisition ID:41378  By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.  Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

title: Deloitte Consulting ‚Äì Specialist Analyst Data Scientist - North Carolina State University (NCSU)
desc: While analytics  isn't new, we're experiencing a renaissance in the science, technology, and  application of business analytics. Many business leaders need to know how best  to quickly understand what their analytics can actually deliver. Our InsightStudio  team works with clients to discover new insights by transforming data into  intuitive, interactive visualizations‚Äîsuch as maps, charts, and dashboards‚Äîthat  can help leaders see and explore their data in new ways. We need someone with  creative problem solving skills to tackle the challenges our clients present across  a broad range of industry domains. Work  you‚Äôll do We are looking for  people who relish the opportunity to think creatively and outside the box and  enjoy working in collaborative teams. As a Data Scientist, you‚Äôll take part in  building the next generation of InsightStudio solutions and prototypes using  advanced analytics and statistical modeling techniques. You will work in a  cross-functional environment with designers, developers, and business domain  specialists in applying advanced analytics techniques and algorithms, and you  will implement your ideas in real-world solutions and have the chance to  tangibly evaluate and validate your improvements and see the impact on our  clients. In addition to experience and familiarity with core data science  programming, the ideal candidate is someone who thrives on collaborative teams,  understands data science‚Äôs impact on business, and can help demystify it to our  clients. This person should have hands-on project/research experience with  machine learning techniques, good understanding of machine learning theory, and  a very high attention to detail. The  team InsightStudio brings the best of Deloitte Consulting‚Äôs analytics  assets, solutions, and talent into one, easy to engage, creative environment.  In order to jumpstart  efforts and rapidly deliver impacts that build our clients‚Äô analytics maturity.  The InsightStudio can help grow a client‚Äôs analytics maturity whether they are  just starting to explore the possibilities of analytics efforts, beginning to  develop customizable solutions for certain divisions, or scaling capabilities  enterprise-wide. Our product offerings fit together, and complement one  another, to provide clients a pathway towards becoming an Insight Driven  Organization. The team serves as a global center of excellence for data  analytics and visualization. Learn  more about the InsightStudio. Qualifications ‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree completed by Summer 2020 in one of the following disciplines: computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, or a closely related field  ‚Ä¢ Limited immigration sponsorship may be available  ‚Ä¢ Strong academic track record (preferred GPA of 3.5 or higher)  ‚Ä¢ Programming experience, ideally in Python, or another high-level programming/ scripting language  ‚Ä¢ Experience with R, database design, and SQL  ‚Ä¢ Ability to travel up to 50% How  you‚Äôll grow The two most important tools in today‚Äôs  business world are experience and education. At Deloitte, you‚Äôll find plenty of  both. Your first years will provide you with education, experience, and  opportunities that can help you to build your future. Our learning programs are  designed to develop your skills in four key areas ‚Äî technical, professional,  industry, and leadership. You‚Äôll also have access to a career roadmap that can  help you fully leverage the opportunities you need to succeed. Our teams  deliver engaging learning and networking opportunities virtually, in your local  office, and at Deloitte University. Along the way, you‚Äôll have access to  mentoring, counseling, and training opportunities to help foster and accelerate  your development of new skills and capabilities. Learn more about  Deloitte University. Benefits At Deloitte, we know  that great people make a great company. We value our people and offer employees  a broad range of benefits. Learn  more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. Deloitte‚Äôs culture At Deloitte, our culture values leadership and innovation. We  celebrate the value each individual is able to bring to our clients and our  culture. We believe that collaboration is a key to opportunity and  success. We empower and support our  people in the daily choices they must make to be healthy, confident and  centered. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. Corporate citizenship Ours is a culture of purpose. At Deloitte,  we believe that business has the power to inspire, transform, and drive change.  We focus on education, community outreach, and skill-based volunteerism. Learn more about Deloitte‚Äôs impact on  community.Recruiter tips At Deloitte, we want our potential candidates to  feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that  you do your research: know some background about the company and the business  area you‚Äôre applying to. We also suggest that you brush up on your behavioral  and case interviewing skills and practice discussing your experience and job  history with a family member, friend, or mentor. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals to  help you prepare.As used in this posting, ‚ÄúDeloitte‚Äù means Deloitte Consulting LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. title: Defined Benefit Functional Data Analyst

title: Data Steward - (Siebel, SQL, Data Analyst)
desc: Data Steward( Service Business Analyst )Location: 71 Hanover Road, Florham Park, NJ 07932 Capsule: 1 to 3 years of experience with Siebel, Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Management, SQL. ADP is hiring a Service Business Analyst. In this position you will be responsible for developing business requirements for the business unit's initiatives and/or projects. Service Management department members are responsible for participating on project teams to implement SBS projects to ensure business goals and objectives are accomplished within designated timeframes. Based on a strong level of knowledge of ADP products, regional functions, regional operating systems and procedures, the Business Analyst positions participates as a key contributor in the development and implementation of new or revised ADP products, programs, operating systems and procedures among all Employer Services regional offices. Effective communication skills are required since this position serves as a liaison between and among regional and group staff departments to gather, document and analyze business requirements, participate in the development of project plans and implement new programs and products At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.RESPONSIBILITIES: Researches, gathers and documents user requirements. Seeks input for requested projects by conducting interviews of subject matter experts (SMEs), including clients and ADP associates from the regions or other business units. Identifies business needs and participates as key contributor in the implementation of new or revised ADP products, programs and operating systems/procedures. Serves as a liaison between the business, product, development and cross functional teams to gather, analyze and develop business requirements and implement new or revised business models, products, systems, and procedures. Collaborates with the business to analyze and identify field business needs and participates in the development of plans, programs, operating systems and procedures to address them. Post implementation of project, may be required to analyze success of rollout and monitor progress of initiatives. Maintains a strong knowledge of applicable products, regional operating systems and procedures by participating in focus groups, product committees and business conferences, as well as visiting regional offices. The Business Analyst is responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements for assigned projects. Playing a key contributor role to implement projects to ensure business goals and objectives are accomplished within designated timeframes. The Business Analyst monitors and reports to Project Manager or manager the status of assigned projects including identifying any issues which might delay final results or deliverable. Elaborates with IT on the approved requirements as IT creates Functional Specs and test scripts. Ensures that test plans are tied back to all requirements and that deliverables fully satisfy all client requirements. Participates in developing the success criteria for the projects. This position receives limited management supervision. Performs other related duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:BA / BS Degree or equivalent in education and experience. Minimum of 1-3 years' experience in Client Services, Implementation and / or Operations at a Senior CSR, SR. IS, TSS or Manager level in service center and / or group staff functions Minimum of 1-3 years of Business Analyst experiencePREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:  Basic knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL), to create basic scripts and validate data Good working knowledge of all functions in the regions and all Small Business Services (SBS) products Good working knowledge of service and operations workflow methods, procedures, and operating systems and support tools both internally and externally Effective analytical and PC skills are essential Effective written and oral / presentation skills are required Ability to create flowcharts, presentations and/or use flowcharting software (VISIO, etc.) Demonstrated experience in gathering, documenting business requirements_________________req 184119#LITECHWe're designing a better way to work, so you can achieve what you're working for. Consistently named one of the 'Most Admired Companies' by FORTUNE¬Æ Magazine, and recognized by DiversityInc¬Æ as one of the 'Top 50 Companies for Diversity,' ADP works with more than 740,000 organizations across the globe to help their people work smarter, embrace new challenges, and unleash their talent. "Always Designing for People" means we're creating platforms that will transform how great work gets done, so together we can unlock a world of opportunity.  At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

title: Data Warehouse Analyst; Adolescent Health
desc: Strength Through  Diversity  Ground breaking science.  Advancing medicine. Healing made personal. Roles &  Responsibilities: The Data Warehouse Developer/Analyst designs,  tests, implements, and maintains the Mount Sinai Adolescent Health Centers  Data Warehouse, with the overarching goal of improving clinical care and accelerating  translational research.  The incumbent will develop databases across multiple  platforms, technologies (e.g., physical, relational and object oriented) and  computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server)  for Sinai-specific and NIH-funded national resources and projects. The  incumbent will design, develop and manage these resources in a data warehousing  environment, utilizing a thorough understanding of available technology, tools  and best practices. Duties and Responsibilities:Designs, tests, implements, and maintains Mount Sinai Adolescent Health Centers Data Warehouse, and other associated Research  Databases for researchers, clinicians and staff. Works closely with technical management and researcher-clients to design and implement databases and database support tools  in support of complex business application development requirements and  processes (e.g., diverse development platforms, technological environments,  software, hardware, tools, etc.). Approaches all relationships with a world-class customer service approach. Maintains a customer-focused approach  with users to provide solutions that are science/research-driven. Supports, designs and manages upgrades to Microsoft SQL Server Management studio and job scheduler. Expertise in Tableau and creation of dashboards/stories using complex sql logic is required. Monitors transaction activities and assists in the utilization of databases. Strong MS SQL analysis skills required.Work with other IT professionals through Mount Sinai effectively. Comply with the Institutional Review Board and HIPAA  to follow all applicable policies and procedures. Assists in the development of standards and procedures affecting database management, design and maintenance. Establishes and maintains databases for user tests and production purposes including designing databases and creating indexes. Performance Tuning of SQL, and related scripts. Trains user groups on procedures and standards. Must have flexibility to learn and embrace a dynamic environment, which could include other database and pipeline  technologies (e.g. EPIC Caboodle, EPIC Clarity, SQL Server, various ETL tools,  cloud database services, Oracle databases.) and other coding/scripting  languages. May act as a project leader.Performs related duties as assigned or requested. Requirements: ‚Ä¢ Five years minimum experience in the design and  administration of logical and relational databases and Data Warehouses in  diverse technological environments.  ‚Ä¢ Strong SQL analysis skills required (Microsoft SQL Server  is required).  ‚Ä¢ Tableau experience is required.  ‚Ä¢ ETL development experience is a plus  ‚Ä¢ Healthcare data experience is required (familiarity with  Epic is a strong plus).  ‚Ä¢ Scripting and automation experience (Shell, Python, PERL,  or similar) is a plus.  ‚Ä¢ HL7 Interface knowledge is a plus.  ‚Ä¢ Crystal Reports is a plus  ‚Ä¢ Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) is a plus.  ‚Ä¢ Must understand the systems development process and have a  solid understanding of business processes. Requires excellent analytical  ability, consultative and communication skills, strong judgment and the ability  to work effectively with clients and other IT management and staff.  Education:  Bachelors degree or equivalent education/work experience.  Masters degree in relevant field of study preferred Strength Through  Diversity The Mount Sinai Health  System believes that diversity and inclusion is a driver for excellence. desc: Strength Through  DiversityGround breaking science.  Advancing medicine. Healing made personal. As part of the World Trade Center Health Program,  the General Responder Data Center (DC) is charged with the oversight and  coordination of the data management activities of five clinical centers of  excellence (CCEs), which provide examinations and clinical assessments of the  WTC Responders. The data gathered by the CCEs are centrally managed by the GRDC  which is responsible for quality assurance, monitoring and coordination of the  data collection, and analyses of the data. The DC also plays an integral role in  analyzing these data. The Senior Data Analyst oversees activities related to  data integrity, security and enhancement of the value of the data including  data cleaning and manipulation, query tracking, and implementing policies and  procedures. The Senior Data Analyst may direct the movement of data across  multiple systems, oversee data validation and organization, and make certain  that the data are available to appropriate people and systems.
