title: Senior Financial Analyst/Data Analyst - Decision Support
desc:
LocationNew York, New YorkShift:Day (United States of America)Description:Experience the Pride of a Mission-Driven Career

Join the patient-inspired team at NewYork-Presbyterian, and bring new meaning to your career. See how finance plays an active role in world-class care and caring. Thrive as a valued member of the team at New Yorks #1-ranked hospital (U.S. News & World Report), and feel the pride of mission-driven achievement.

Senior Financial Analyst/Data Analyst - Decision Support

Step into the #1-ranked hospital in New York (U.S.News & World Report) in the mission-critical and growing Decision Support department. As Sr. Financial Analyst, you will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary finance team to design, develop, analyze, and present detailed profit and loss analyses to the NYP Enterprise. Using your knowledge of finance and your training on our cost accounting system (EPSi), you will build and maintain revenue and cost models which support senior leadership decision-making on strategic, capital and service line investments. Serve as a liaison between Decision Support and local hospital operational and service line leadership to foster continuous improvement to costing and revenue methodologies so that the best, most accurate and reliable information is reflected in the profit and loss reports. Under guidance from a designated project leader, assume responsibility for aspects of data management and end-user training, and collaborate with Information Technology and Analytics partners. Thrive in a culture that rewards innovation and creativity. Join our enthusiastic team, and feel the pride of supporting world-class patient care.

Preferred Criteria

Proficient in EPSi, EPIC, LawsonProven proficiency in cost accounting design/methodology and previous experience in healthcare preferred but not requiredKnowledgeable in maintaining health care decision support systems or SQL databases

Required Criteria

Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerpointBachelors DegreeMinimum of 3 years of related experienceStrong data and analytical skills.Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Join a hospital where employee engagement is at an all-time high. Enjoy competitive compensation along with benefits such as tuition reimbursement, hospital retirement contributions, and financial planning assistance. Start your life-changing journey today.

__________________

#1 in New York, "America's Best Hospitals 2019-2020." - U.S.News & World Report2019 "Best Places to Work: Employee's Choice." - Glassdoor2019 "Employees' Choice: Top CEOs" - Glassdoor2019 "America's Best Employers in New York State" - Forbes2019 "150 Top Places to Work in Healthcare." - Becker's Healthcare2018 "Top-Rated Work Places: Best Hospitals" - Indeed

Discover why we're #1 in New York and a best employer at: nyp.org/careers

NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Quality Analyst
desc:
Role: Global Spread Products is seeking an experienced Data Quality Analyst. Reporting through the COO line, this person will work closely with the front office and technology on multiple fronts to help execute strategic goals. This team sits at the intersection of sales, trading, structuring, capital markets origination and technology and is responsible for implementing process improvements and realizing senior management's vision. Our team oversees a wide array of front office systems including pricing and risk, trade capture, inventory management, origination, securitization, sales dashboards, management reporting, electronic trading and database management.

Background:  Global Spread Products is the primary source of capital for corporations, governments, and non-profits, providing liquidity and innovative solutions globally across the credit, municipal, and securitized markets.

Job Responsibilities:

Become familiar with all market, reference and application data sources within Global Spread Products and across the firm. Act as a subject matter expert when data needs or questions ariseTroubleshoot root cause of data quality issues as they arise and work with technology partners to correctIdentify problems with data quality by running regular checksProvide transparency to upstream data consumers on data owners, permissions, and accessibility. Help end-users to navigate the data landscapeDevelop quality checks for ongoing data ingestion and standard calculation conventionsWork with Citi partners and vendors to define data needsTest and verify data acquisition and changesWork with technology and vendors to resolve issuesRespond to ad-hoc data requests and provide reporting as needed

 Required Skills and Qualifications

Candidate is required to have a BA/BS3+ years experience in data analysis, data quality, or systems architecture.Ability to work in a dynamic environment under tight deadlines with changing prioritiesExperience with Oracle, KDB, Clojure, and Google Cloud is preferredSQL, VBA, Python, Qlikview, Cognos or other BI/data visualization tools is preferred


Strong data querying, MS Excel and quantitative skills required


Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to multi-task under tight deadlines


Must have strong attention to detail, be self-motivated and inquisitive with an interest in financial markets


Experience with Fixed Income or other Capital Markets a plus

title: Senior Data Analyst - New York City
desc:
Compass is a technology-driven real estate platform that provides comprehensive brokerage services, combining exceptional agents with thoughtfully crafted digital products to make the process of buying, selling, or renting a home intelligent, deliberate, and seamless.

You'll work in a fast-paced environment in our Engineering team, contributing to large-scale initiatives that impact multiple functions and teams, including our Leadership Team, Strategic Growth, Agent Success, Marketing, Finance, and Regional Leadership. You'll help define key business metrics and build the right analytical datasets, facilitate their use across the organization, and champion the need for strategic data collection and analysis across all of our business processes.

Responsibilities


Guide the company in becoming the leading source of real estate information by working with internal stakeholders to analyze and interpret intricate datasets that will drive business decisions
Aid in our data-driven design approach by mining our operational data for key, game-changing insights
Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure the right KPIs are being tracked, and that the right data is being used to measure them
Develop and own our data governance strategy, including data collection and analysis policies and procedures
Oversee the deployment of data to our data warehouse, and ensure that it is optimized for analytics and operational reporting
Lead the charge in ultimately empowering our users to derive their own insights and make informed decisions, by enabling self-service reporting & analytics capabilities
Own end-to-end product analytics workflow including formulating success metrics, socializing them across the organization, and creating dashboards/reports
Work with the finance/operations team to identify business opportunities, measure KPIs to craft compelling stories, make data-driven recommendations, and drive informed actions

Minimum Qualifications


B.S. in Software Engineering, similar formal technical education (Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, etc) or equivalent practical experience
5+ years experience working in business intelligence, data modeling, data analytics or related roles
5+ experience working with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, and MicroStrategy, etc.
Proficiency in manipulating large raw datasets using tools/techniques such as SQL, pivot tables, lookups, etc. 

Proficiency in querying Amazon Redshift, PostgreSQL, MySQL and/or Snowflake

Preferred Qualifications


Experience with R or Python language is a bonus
M.S. in Computer or Software Engineering
Certifications with BI tools highly preferred

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

title: Asset Management - Global Equities - Data Science - Analyst/Associate
desc:
JPMorgan Chase & Co. is a leading global financial services firm with assets of more than $2.7 trillion, over 240,000 employees and operations in over 60 countries. It operates across four business segments including Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate and Investment Banking, Commercial Banking and Consumer and Community Banking.J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits.Asset ManagementAsset Management is a leading investment manager of choice for institutions, financial intermediaries and individual investors, worldwide. With a heritage of more than two centuries, a broad range of core and alternative strategies, and investment professionals operating in every major world market, we offer investment experience and insight that few other firms can match. Job DescriptionThe Equity Data Science team is a recently formed function within Global Equities. We are tasked with using modern machine learning techniques to enrich our investment process. This can range from problems in portfolio construction, to signal generation, to projects for fundamental research. Given this mandate, a non-financial background would be acceptable if the candidate had a strong data science skillset and was willing to learn. The successful candidate will sit in the front office working with portfolio managers and research analysts.ResponsibilitiesMembers of the team are expected to work on projects along the full data science spectrum. From data acquisition and wrangling, to model selection to presentation and data visualization. They should be able to take an unstructured alternative dataset and uncover the alpha within. The role requires the successful candidate to work as a part of a globally distributed data science team. They will work with stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand problems then find innovative, practical solutions.






Qualifications


A demonstrable practical interest in data science (Kaggle, GitHub etc)An understanding of the state of the art in data science and the ability to explain core principals and approachesA highly logical, methodical working patternThe ability to interpret data and succinctly present conclusionsExperience in a statistical programming language (Python 3.x preferred)

title: Data Analyst, Digital
desc:
Data Analyst, Essence Digital

Essence Communications is in the midst of the next phase of its digital transformation and is building out our Analytics and Data operation to support our media, experiential, and new platform digital businesses with data sources coming from our digital properties (Essence.com & Naturally Curly), ad management and serving platforms, emerging digital platforms, mobile apps and physical sensors in real world environmental contexts. We are putting sensors across all fronts of the business and this will be an exciting journey for someone seeking to do innovative work with applied data to maximize growth and long-term value for the business.

What you will be bringing:


3+ years of professional experience in a data analyst or analytics-focused role
The ability to improve our portfolio of reports, dashboard, and ongoing data analysis workflows
Reviewing our analytics toolkits to ensure that we are getting accurate and systematic measurement coverage of all key business drivers within each functional domain
Deep familiarity with Google Analytics, Google Ad Manager and cloud-based data warehousing and visualization tools like Looker, Klipfolio, and emerging tools.
Passion for statistics, probability & optimization.
Master proficiency in Excel, and adept in pulling data via SQL syntax, with the ability to write complex optimized data queries by hand
Ability to transform data into insight derivatives or views that can prompt action and drive results.
A willingness to get your hands dirty in pulling data from disparate sources, normalizing and automating analytics views for repeatable consumption.
The ability to ask the right questions.
Passion to the work

Qualifications


3+ years working with Google Analytics, Google Site Optimizer, Google Ad Manager, and a range of other social monitoring tools
3+ years analyzing large datasets and writing SQL queries in a cloud data warehouse environment
3+ years using Python or R for statistical data analysis and data prep
3+ years accessing and merging data via a range of API access points
2+ years with configuring and creating dashboards in data visualization/dashboarding tools
Prior experience using a CRM tool (such as Salesforce) is preferred
Strong team collaborator; always solutions driven, and able to identify signals within the data
Ability to work independently; self-discipline to effectively juggle multiple deliverables, proactive attitude to quickly identify issues, and a drive to exceed client expectations

Required Education and Experience


BS/MS degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Statistics, Quantitative Economics) or foreign equivalent
3+ years prior experience in a data analyst role

title: New York - Junior Data / Business Intelligence Analyst New York
desc:
FDM creates and inspires exciting careers that shape our digital future. Through our Careers Program, we recruit and train those aspiring to become IT and business professionals before deploying them on to client sites worldwide. With centers across Europe, North America and APAC, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.

We are currently seeking candidates interested in building a career in Data Analysis / Business Intelligence.

Data Analysis and Business Intelligence roles often involve access to business areas in major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and high profile projects, and gaining first-hand exposure to the trade lifecycle. The role is crucial in helping organizations with the accuracy and timely presentation of data, in line with internal process, governance, and regulatory requirements. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.

Prior to working with our clients, your training will take place at one of FDM’s US centers. Successful candidates will receive intense technical and professional training (average 10-16 weeks) through our award-winning FDM Academy. You become an FDM employee from day one and are paid during the training period before placement onsite with our clients in the US. Travel assistance for relocation may be available depending on location and circumstances.

Fast-track career progression is a key focus of FDM, and our program will put you on a pathway that could grow into leadership roles working within multinational organizations.

We accept applications on a rolling basis; suitable candidates are encouraged to apply immediately.

There is no better way to launch your career than with FDM!

Essential Criteria:

Bachelor’s degrees (preferably in Finance, Business, Management, or a STEM related field)Excellent communication and interpersonal skills A desire to work at a large financial firm and ability to increase your financial knowledgeAn analytical approach and problem solving abilitiesProven ability to work under pressure and in fast-paced environmentsExcellent attention to detail and strong organizational and time management abilitiesFlexible for national client placements in the USAble to commit to the two-year consultant program with FDM following completion of trainingLegally authorized to work in the US 

FDM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.

title: Data Analyst, Customer Success
desc:
We are a fast-growing company in the healthcare technology space with a suite of intuitive patient engagement solutions that streamline the responsibilities of hospital staff, increase patient involvement and satisfaction, and positively influence outcomes.

Our team is incredible. We are an award-winning company that strives to do better every day. Besides our fun team activities, company masseuse, and cornucopia of healthy snacks, the work ethic, commitment to core values, and firm knowledge that we help people across the country are really what tie us all together.

As a member of our Data Analytics team, you will be partnering with the Customer Success team to show our clients how using CipherHealth products helps improve patient outcomes. You will be painting stories with data to help our clients use our products according to our best practices, while also proposing new, data-driven, ways to use our technology. We are a highly collaborative team and you'll have the opportunity to interact cross-functionally to use your analytical superpowers to help our company grow.

Responsibilities


Gather requirements, scope, and manage the creation of custom client deliverables 

Create engaging analytical deliverables that highlight how usage of our products impact client outcomes and provide recommendations to help clients reach their goals
Uses data visualization programs, tools, and techniques to generate dashboards, reports and presentations that aid in data storytelling, understanding and interpretation of trends and patterns of business importance.
Ensure data quality through collecting, processing, and cleaning data through Excel, SQL, R, or another scripting tool 

Train internal users on available reporting services 

Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field 

1-2 years of working experience
Strong ability to problem-solve independently and make decisions under minimal supervision
Excellent teamwork and written/verbal communication skills
Comfortable working in a fast-moving environment with dynamic objective
Strong attention to detail
Strong Excel skills (understanding of Excel functions, calculations, pivot tables, formatting etc.)

Nice to haves:


Experience with SQL, R, or another scripting tool 

Experience in a healthcare related field, or healthcare related degree 

Experience with Excel VBA

title: Marketing Communications Data Analyst
desc:
Tracking Code

 4111 

Job DescriptionLatham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Marketing Communications Data Analyst to join our winning team, to be located in either our New York, Boston, or Washington, D.C. office. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

The Marketing Communications Data Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.

As a Marketing Communications Data Analyst at Latham, you will lead the quantitative and qualitative analysis and strategic recommendations of the Firm’s digital communications, social media, content marketing, and thought leadership campaigns.

You will report to the Senior Manager – Digital Media, work closely with the Senior Manager – Global Editorial Services, and support the wider Brand & Communications team collaborating across the Digital & Social Media, Public Relations, Editorial Services, and Internal Communications teams. You will also work closely with the Firm’s Business Intelligence and Data Science team.

The Data Analyst will actively collate, compare, and analyze data and share insights and opportunities gleaned from the collection process. The Data Analyst will deliver creative, data-driven reports and strategic recommendations to support the Firm’s marketing campaigns and thought leadership program across channels as well as the Firm’s internal communications program. The Data Analyst’s responsibilities will include:


Leading on the design, development and implementation of data reports and data mining solutions for Firm leadership across practice and industry, project leads for campaigns, and individual authors of thought leadership content.
Identifying and understanding website KPIs using Google Analytics platform. Optimizing campaigns and measurements in order to enhance our content marketing program. Providing insights to help build more robust analytics platform to align with future CMS platform.
Aggregating data from across social media channels to inform content producers on ROI and best practices for future content development.
Working with the Internal Communications team to collect and analyze data from internal communications channels to improve content and engagement.
Aggregating and analyzing content data from various sources—CMS, social media channels, Google Analytics, e-marketing, and other propriety databases—to inform recommendations and to build custom reports.
Advising on partnering with and subscribing to third party vendors to support distribution of content.
Utilizing data to advise on content creation strategy based on patterns and trends in engagement of content across different media formats. Acting as resource to the Firm regarding martech analytical tools and processes. Staying abreast of developments and trends in these areas, making recommendations as needed.
Conducting industry research and market intelligence, as appropriate.
Assisting with and/or implementing other special projects or research assignment initiatives as assigned.
Promoting effective work practices, working as a team member, and showing respect for co-workers.

As a Data Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Data Analyst must have strong analytical skills needed for all primary duties of the position, including comprehending and communicating data, along with strong experience in marketing and communications as well as digital and business-to-business marketing, preferably in a professional services context. The ideal candidate will be a creative, innovative thinker and problem solver with an ability to conceive of new ways to achieve business-related goals, and will have strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to simultaneously manage multiple, complex projects in an often intense and deadline-driven environment. The Data Analyst will have data profiling skills to identify and understand anomalies and trends, and have familiarity with reporting and visualization technologies such as Tableau, Power BI, Business Objects, etc.

A Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field is required. A minimum of five (5) years of experience in marketing and data analysis is desired.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.

Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.Job Location

New York, New York, United States

Department

Brand & Communications

Position Type

Full-Time/Regular

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc: ABOUT ROWe are Ro, a mission-driven healthcare technology company reinventing the way the healthcare system works. As a Senior Data Analyst you will partner with stakeholders to make high-impact decisions; you will lead data collection and analysis projects across multiple functional groups.Who are you? That's a great question. You have an intuitive grasp of business problems and perspectives across departments and are also highly technical. Your work usually enables meaningful action by the company. You can take an amorphous problem or a vague request, quickly bring structure to it, and coordinate across teams to push it forward. You bring a thorough analytic eye to everything you do.You are a clear communicator. You can present findings effectively and concisely in a variety of formats and to a variety of audiences. You are equally comfortable in business group discussions and technical engineering meetings, and often bridge the two.You are humble, empathetic, and effective.Personal Training and Growth:Ro is high-growth startup and personal growth is a top priority on the Ro Data Team. Everyone is given the support they need to get their work done and grow rapidly as individuals. Several days a quarter are dedicated solely to technical training, either self-guided or through external classes. All positions on the Data team are high ownership positions (see this explanation) - you are your own growth limit.Data at Ro:The Data Team at Ro encompasses Data Analytics, Data Science, and Data Engineering. We do everything from data model design to core ETL/reporting to company-wide data training to complex analytic frameworks to business deep dives to experimentation design to hosting ML model APIs for Ro’s apps to query. Check out our blog: https://medium.com/ro-data-team-blog - it’s young, but the larger data community already uses a lot of our solutions.All data at the company, both first-party and third-party, is centralized in our data warehouse and fully interconnected. The Data Team’s stack is rooted in AWS and Snowflake. We’ve carefully engineered our setup to require minimal ETL and database maintenance.What You'll Do:Own analytic projects/goals that may involve a number of groups at the companyInsightful, actionable analysis that is unquestionably solid and stress-testedManipulate raw data into robust analytic frameworksDefine requirements with business stakeholders and engineers, which often includes translating between groups with different perspectives and vernaculars Raw data discovery and stress testing, often with engineers from across the companyDelivery of analyses to business departments in an effective, ergonomic form What You Bring to the Data Team:SQL, Python (or demonstrated coding ability), Unix dexterityDemonstrated success owning complex analyses that start from low-level data, involve a number of company groups, and drive business decisionsDemonstrated communication skills: visual and writtenETL experience; numerical dexterityBasic practical statistics around significance, experimentation, etc.Bonus Points for:Experience in a high-growth startupDemonstrated experience designing data modelsDemonstrated experience partnering with back-end and infrastructure teamsBasic ML skills (Regressions, Random Forests, etc)Benefits + PerksFull medical, dental, and vision insurance + OneMedical membershipHealthcare and Dependent Care FSACommuter benefits401(k)Unlimited PTOFitness reimbursementPaid maternity/parental leave A never-ending supply of office snacks + coffeeThe cutest office dog you’ve ever seenWe welcome qualified candidates of all races, creeds, genders and sexuality to apply.WE ARE ROWe are Ro, a mission-driven healthcare technology company where doctors, pharmacists and engineers are working together to reinvent the way the healthcare system works. So it works better for everyone–providers and patients alike. We promise to make the complicated straightforward. The expensive affordable. And the frustrating delightful. By tearing down the walls and bringing providers and patients together in one place, we’re making it easier and more affordable for millions of people to get personalized treatment, get healthy and get back to living the lives they dream about.Ro is backed by some of the best investors in the world. Our investors have also backed Warby Parker, Harry’s, Stripe, Oscar, and PillPack.

title: Data Analyst
desc:
Insights Analyst, Marketing Solutions

We are built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world's workforce in ways no other company can. We're much more than a digital resume we transform lives through innovative products and technology.

Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.

As a Marketing Insights Analyst, you will leverage one of the richest proprietary data sets in the world to discover insights that help our advertising sales team serve our clients and agencies. To be successful in this role you need to be highly analytical, be comfortable responding to and structuring ambiguous requests, and be an effective communicator. You will also have a passion for querying databases in SQL/Presto or have comparable technical skills. You must be able to juggle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment and manage expectations on what you can deliver.

Key responsibilities in this role include creating new code, conducting custom analyses, and converting data into final output to be presented to clients and agencies. You will become an expert at using coding languages to extract data from LinkedIn's massive data warehouse and turning that data into compelling stories that help our clients become more successful.

Responsibilities:


• Leverage LinkedIn's unique data to create innovative, custom analyses and tools to address business challenges
• Write SQL/Presto/Hive/Pig/Python queries to extract necessary data, analyze the results to generate actionable insights and present the findings either in Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint
• Collaborate closely with the Insights team to provide analysis, reporting and tool-building capabilities that inform our key stakeholders

Basic Qualifications:


• Bachelor Degree
• 1+ years of experience in an analytics or consulting role
• Experience analyzing data in SQL, Presto, Excel, SAS or other similar software
• Experience building visualizations with data

Preferred Qualifications:


• High performer with demonstrated success and quick impact
• Experience with data analysis and storytelling
• Excellent interpersonal, communication, writing, presentation, statistical and data analysis skills
• Experience turning data into insights 

• Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop
• Expert knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel)

title: Data Analyst
desc:
Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper. We live a culture defined by The Gallagher Way, our set of shared values and guiding tenets. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customized solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures.

Under general direction, provides support for one or more functional groups, including performance of a wide variety of specialized clerical functions involving compiling and arranging data, laying out and preparing reports, processing and coding documents, and maintaining specialized and comprehensive records and filing.

title: Data Analyst (Marketing Analytics)
desc:
Data Analyst (Marketing Analytics)

WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all. To learn more about WW and jobs with a purpose, visit ww.com.

About the Role

We are now looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics group to help drive a data-first culture across WW.

Team members will work closely with both business and technical teams to proactively identify gaps in our knowledge base. The candidate will be charged with providing analytics reporting and data-driven strategic insights, trends, and perspective.

You will work closely with a cross functional team through all development stages, from identifying opportunities, to analyzing the impact of efforts, and discovering areas for improvement.

Key Responsibilities

Transform raw data into actionable and meaningful analyses.Work with a cross-functional team to implement, validate, andimprove external traffic-driver tracking within web analytics platforms: clarifying analytic requirements, developing analysis plans, and building out reporting.Establish and maintain strong business partnerships and cross-functional relationships to provide decision support.Perform ad-hoc reporting and analyses as needed.

Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor or Masters degree in Economics, Statistics, Finance, or Mathematics preferred.1-3 years of analyticsor quantitative experience in which you extracted meaningful insights from web analytics data. Experience working with marketing teams preferred.Advanced experience with Google Analytics. Strong experience with using BI tools to build dynamic/scalable dashboards. Looker experience a plus.Strong Knowledge of SQL, your queries are optimized for readability and performance. Google BigQuery a plus.A track record for producing reproducible analyses, experience with R or python a plus.Proficient in Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, vlookups).

As a company, our purpose is to inspire healthy habits for real life. And as an employer, we inspire the greatest people to do their best work. We provide benefits for real life to help protect your health, finances and overall well being, including:

Competitive compensation and profit sharing planA 401K plan to help you plan for your future, plus company matchHealth care coverage starting on your first dayTuition reimbursement and online courses to help you reach your career aspirationsCommuter benefitsYearly well-being allowance for your physical, financial, social and emotional well-beingFree WW membership for you plus 3 free WW memberships for your friends and 3 for your familyFree fruit, snacks and coffee to get you through your daySummer Fridays, happy hours, and company outingsRobust employee referral bonusesDevelopmental opportunities and assignments to grow your career

WW is an equal opportunity employer. WW does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
desc:
Healthcare Data Analyst
Elite Technical is seeking a Healthcare Data Analyst for our client in New York, NY. The Healthcare Data Analyst will work with analytics, customer support, business development and the clinical teams to update existing and develop new fee schedules and payment rates for State Workers Compensation programs. The individual will serve as a subject matter expert for each of the state based schedules and will be responsible for all associated statistical methodologies to create the reimbursement models. Knowledge of Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Medicare fee schedule and state Workers- Compensation fee schedules is required. This position will be responsible for researching and creating models to help determine reimbursement values based on specified criteria. Responsibilities include the design, development, updating and deployment of multiple state fee schedules.

The Healthcare Data Analyst will write programs to import current fee schedules, perform statistical analyses, including providing comparisons to older fee schedules, Medicare rates and other state fees schedules and to generate new fee schedules. In addition, the Healthcare Data Analyst will export the new fee schedules into a format which can be directly incorporated into regulations and state fee schedule rules and guidelines.

This is a fulltime, direct opportunity with our client, who is offering a generous salary & benefits package allowing for career stability and professional growth. Please contact Elite Technical to learn more about this exciting opportunity.Required Skills- Knowledge of CMS and third-party fee schedules



Understanding of healthcare claims payment methodologies, and claims editing policies
Familiarity with health plan claims adjudication systems and interdependent applications
Strong experience and knowledge of SAS, SAS BASE, SAS SQL, SAS Macros, SAS tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Analytic, problem solving, technical skills and attention to detail are required
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to work in a highly cross-functional, multi-location organization
Comprehensive knowledge of MS Office Suite of Products including Excel and PowerPointApply Now

title: IT Technical Business Analyst - Data Integrations
desc:
IT Technical Business Analyst - Integrations

Peloton's IT organization is seeking a unique individual who understands the business side of retail and also is comfortable with getting hands on in the technical side of data operations. You will work in a fast-paced environment to manage competing priorities, meet agreed upon deadlines, and deliver high quality work.

In this role you will interact with multiple business units at Peloton to understand how their underlying data supports their business functions. You will build, maintain, and analyze dashboards which monitor data fidelity across multiple systems to ensure data completeness. You will follow the data at Peloton to ensure that we have implemented timely and accurate integration pipelines throughout the organization.

This role offers a unique opportunity to be a part of an evolving IT organization, a results oriented and driven global organization with ownership over a portfolio that delivers direct value to these organizational stakeholders and Peloton overall. The ideal profile of this position calls for a flexible and well-rounded individual – someone who is self-motivated, detailed oriented, collaborative, and has strong communication skills.

Job Responsibilities


Be able to assess business needs/priorities and execute on project deliverables 

Document and analyze current business processes and underlying systems/applications
Monitor, troubleshoot, and triage integration errors between systems
Translate business requirements into technical requirements
Collaborate with development team to produce stable and high quality integrations 

Communicate and collaborate effectively with technical peers and business users
Form strong working relationships with your Peloton peers and across the IT organization

Basic Job Requirements


Strong verbal and written communication skills
Software development experience in a programming language (other than SQL) 

Strong SQL skills (comfortable writing stored procedures, advanced queries, and reporting out of SQL)
Experience with at least one business intelligence (BI) tool--Looker preferred
Full stack BI Developer experience: aggregation of data sources, normalization, BI data layer, BI reporting, business insight analysis
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills; detail oriented

Preferred Experience
Functional experience with ERP systems (i.e. NetSuite, SAP)
Functional experience in the retail, supply chain/logistics, and/or inventory industries
Experience with REST and SOAP web services
Hands on experience on Integration Platforms such as Boomi, Mulesoft AnyPoint, Pentaho, and Informatica
Master Data Management (MDM) experience

title: Data Analyst II
desc:
LivePerson is the global leader in digital communication solutions and we aim to make life easier by transforming how people communicate with brands. Our 18,000 customers, including leading brands like Citibank, HSBC, Orange, and The Home Depot, use our conversational commerce solutions to orchestrate humans and AI, at scale, and create a convenient, deeply personal relationship - a conversational relationship - with their millions of consumers.

Join this digital revolution and work on one of the biggest OpenStack cloud services in the world! We invest heavily in artificial intelligence, bots, big data technologies, real-time analytics and messaging solutions, all hosted on our dynamic open platform.

What will you own?


Work with Enterprise brands and local Customer Success team to provide analytical and reporting support for Messaging and Chat programs
Responsible for consulting on, developing and maintaining scalable and effective reporting solutions
Partner with account managers, extracting historical data for analysis and presenting insights and recommendations for program improvement
Design and implement self-service reporting dashboard solutions to drive automation, efficiency and consistency
Transform client feedback into actionable projects and ensure all technical stakeholders are driving toward customers' business needs

What do you need for success?


At least 2 years similar experience in a Data Analytics role
Outstanding proficiency in SQL
Excellent skills in Microsoft Office suite
Experience with Python preferable

Experienced with dashboarding, including tools such as MicroStrategy
Capable of distilling complex analysis into executive level presentations
Strong commercial acumen - preferential experience in business analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical troubleshooting skills
Ability to work under pressure and multi-task
Good interpersonal skills
Strong time management capabilities and ability to prioritize

We care about you.

LivePerson works hard to create a positive employee experience, your life outside of the office is important to us. We support our teams with great benefits, like pension plans, paid maternity and paternity leave, and a competitive paid 28 days vacation program that enables our family to take the time they need to recharge.

We want you to feel part of our LivePerson family.

Frequent team events, daily breakfast and happy hours on occasion (and there are lots of those) will help you settle quickly into your new workplace.. And - our Christmas parties are a blast!

Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us.

We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and are empowered for success — every day. We have also been part of the London Pride parade, an annual LGBT festival, to advocate diversity, and we are sponsors of the "Lesbians who Tech & Allies" Summit in London.

Our company believes equal opportunities for both genders is something that has been overlooked for too long.

To shake up the industry, LivePerson CEO Robert Locascio recently launched the Equal AI initiative - established to focus efforts on eradicating gender bias in AI engineering. We are also keen on getting women enthusiastic about software engineering by sponsoring the "Female's Favor{IT}e Conference" - a great opportunity to inspire women of all professional backgrounds to come together, to learn about technology, and to exchange experiences on various tech-topics. We are always open to new ideas and initiatives, so keen to hear your thoughts if this is an area you feel strongly about.

LivePerson provides equal employment opportunity without regard to an applicant's race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, or marital status.

desc:

Apply Now

Each of our clients is unique. They have their own workflows and very specific data needs. Our endless selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling means our clients are able to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. Without us, they simply cannot operate. Making the right decisions for our customers and services with such varying and complex consumption is a challenge. Extracting intelligence from our datasets is key to our success and that is where you come in.

What is the role?

The Client Data Analytics team drives new business and organic growth in the Enterprise Data department through data driven insights. Whether we are working on the design of products and commercial strategies or uncovering sales opportunities through data analysis, technology, collaboration and understanding of our customers is at the heart of everything we do.

We work closely with both regional and global teams across stakeholder groups such as Sales, CFO Office, Global & Regional Department Heads, Business and Product Development, Global Data, Operational Support and other verticals across the firm. In order to achieve our goals and deliver results we extensively leverage technology for data warehousing, analysis and visualisation (Qliksense, IBM Cognos, Tableau, Excel Powerpivot, VBA, SQL, Python).

We'll trust you to:

Build out an extensive network within the organisation that you will effectively leverage to influence outcomes and achieve results.

Develop commercial models incorporating market feedback, business insight and specific commercial goals.

Drive sales strategies and generate targeted campaigns by leveraging data.

actionable insights with the management team through both ad-hoc reporting and creating dashboards.

Design tools to enable our stakeholders to access self-service analytics & pre-packaged datasets.

Manage major projects in collaboration with the Data Warehouse engineers for data acquisition and report automation.

Explore alternative datasets to enrich & expand existing analytics.

You'll need to be:

Self-Motivated and Independent. You should be independent and proactive, continuously looking for opportunities to make a positive impact on the business. You are able to focus on the solution and deliver results even when faced with setbacks, uncertainty and changing priorities.

Innovative and Creative. You have the ability to think and see different approaches to a problem and to factor in future risk and shortcomings with potential solutions. You can challenge the status-quo with imaginative ideas.

Excellent Collaborator and Resourceful Negotiator. You can build relationships with key stakeholders quickly and negotiate the scope of a project for a win-win outcome where we are efficiently leveraging our resources. You work well in a team environment where global collaboration is essential for success.

Clear Communicator. You can deliver clear, concise and structured presentations where you understand your audience and convey the appropriate amount of information.

Highly Analytical. You are able to think beyond a task, understand the ultimate goal and ask the right questions. You connect the dots.

Technical. You have the experience of BI technology tools and the passion and aptitude to learn more. You are able to quickly adopt new tools and assist in migration and integration throughout the global team and department. You have the ability to shorten time spent on task with your technical background.

Well Organized. Your work is easy to follow and you can provide quick concise updates on all projects you are working on. When faced with an unstructured work environment you create your own structure to achieve goals.

Strong Financial Markets and Market Data Background. You can this knowledge in your reports and projects ing more value to the data itself. You understand the basics of all financial asset types as well as quality, coverage and depth of Bloomberg data sets

The primary role of the Patient Experience Data Analyst is to provide data management and analytic support for projects performed by the Network Performance Group in partnership with other clinical and non-clinical departments. The goal of the projects will be to improve the quality of care, patients' satisfaction with their care, and MMC's performance on the HCACHPS (Hospital Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems) survey. The Patient Experience Data Analyst will be responsible for continuous monitoring of data quality and interact with MMC's MIT department and relevant vendors to identify and resolve all data related issues. The position is hands on and will provide the necessary data and analytic support for various quality improvement and research projects, and as necessary, will provide regular reporting for ongoing performance monitoring activities, prepare sections of IRB applications as they pertain to data source, data quality and management, and will perform literature searches to build understanding of evidence base in the area of patient experience.

Master's Degree required.

-------------------

• 3 - 5 years of experience in data analysis, data mining or analytics in healthcare related fields

• 3 - 5 years of experience working with EMR/Clinical databases and clinical or enterprise data warehouses as data or software analyst

• 3 - 5 years of experience working with and optimizing SQL queries and relational database schemas

OTHER REQUIRED SKILLS:

• Strong analytic skills and experience in basic statistical analyses using a statistical software (Stata preferred)

• Excellent interpersonal and writing skills

• Excellent presentation skills

• Demonstrated ability to take initiative

PREFERRED:

• Experience in clinical informatics and clinical terminologies (ICD9-10, LOINC, CPT, etc)

• Experience working with Epic EMR and associated data repositories

• Some experience supporting quality improvement or research projects

title: Data Analyst
desc:
The Data Analyst supports the Managed Care Department by assisting in the development of quality improvement and validation studies, The Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing data, writing reports for large and small-scale research studies, developing and managing internal databases, and designing and producing plan technical, Access And Availability and other data reports.

QUALIFICATIONS:


 Strong analytical skills, with the ability to prepare cogent analyses using a variety of statistical, spreadsheet and database programs.
Exceptional writing skills, with the ability to clearly and thoroughly present quantitative and qualitative review findings to interested parties with varying technical backgrounds. Ability to write well and quickly.
Excellent communication skills; in particular, able to provide technical assistance to MCO staff and able to actively participate in quality improvement group meetings.
Ability to coordinate workgroups to design quality improvement studies.
Ability to handle all aspects in the full cycle of a research project.
Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.
Ability to manage time effectively and meet client deliverables.
Ability to relate to staff at all levels of familiarity with computers and statistics.
Must have flexibility of work hours and ability to travel when needed.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:


 Bachelor’s degree in an analytical, research or health-related field (required); Master’s degree in public administration, public policy, public health or related social science with course work including both statistical and process analysis (preferred);
One year experience working in a health care field preferred; and
Experience with a variety of software packages, particularly Word, SAS/SPSS, Excel, Access and PowerPoint preferred.

Marketing StatementMetroPlus Health Plan provides the highest quality healthcare services to residents of Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and Staten Island through a comprehensive list of products, including, but not limited to, New York State Medicaid Managed Care, Medicare, Child Health Plus, Exchange, Partnership in Care, MetroPlus Gold, Essential Plan, etc. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest public health system in the United States, MetroPlus’ network includes over 27,000 primary care providers, specialists and participating clinics. Position Overview

The IT Core Systems Data Quality Analyst (DQA) develops and submits provider-focused regulatory and ad hoc reports. The DQA supports and troubleshoots Production processes. title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
WHO'S IN THE KITCHENBlue Apron’s Analytics and Business Insights team develops critical metrics and actionable insights on our rapidly expanding customer base and the broader meal kit marketplace. This team also powers business decisions around complex supply chain and logistical challenges.WHAT'S ON THE MENUThe Senior Data Analyst will drive efforts to iteratively improve Blue Apron’s growth and retention strategies. This will include efforts to size risk and opportunity, diligently test new strategies, understand and improve attribution and payback models, create tools and dashboards for business partners, and work directly with senior management to implement new strategies.

Candidates will be motivated self-starters who are comfortable navigating large datasets, building and/or interpreting predictive models, partnering with technical teams building digital product, and understanding customer demand signals. They will be intimately familiar with survey and A/B testing methodology and interpretation. They will be comfortable presenting findings through both verbal and written formats. Candidates will feel confident in their abilities to influence decision making at the highest levels, understand requirements in working with cross functional teams, and be confident in presenting to individuals of all levels throughout the company.

Key responsibilities include:


A/B testing strategies
Support company executives in understanding, forecasting, and managing demand in an emerging industry
Improving Blue Apron’s testing environment while supporting an aggressive marketing roadmap
Identify, prioritize, structure, and analyze ad hoc analyses about the business’s demand, customers, marketing efficacy, and business operations to answer questions and integrate insights into the forecasting process


NECESSARY INGREDIENTS



Strong analytical, organizational, decision making, and presentation skills with experience communicating on an executive level
A deep understanding of A/B testing methodologies, and forecasting
Interest and experience in communicating advanced analytics concepts to non-technical executives
3+ years of hands-on experience working with very large datasets, including statistical analyses, data visualization, data mining, and data cleansing/transformation
Experience with predictive modeling and demand forecasting, demonstrating knowledge of multiple statistical methodologies as well as an understanding of financial and operational impacts of the forecast

Coding skills, including:





Advanced data manipulation skills in SQL
Analytics tools experience (such as Pandas, R, SQL) a plus
Experience performing analysis with large datasets
Data visualization (such as Tableau, Looker)


Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize diverse tasks with a proven ability to meet hard deadlines
Ability to thrive in an unstructured, fast-moving, and constantly evolving environment

title: Data Analyst
desc:
Job DescriptionWe are seeking a Data Analyst to become an integral part of the Brosnan Team. You will analyze data to understand business and market trends in order to increase company efficiency and effectiveness.

Responsibilities:

Use internal data to understand and identify client's patterns and trendsAnalyze internal and external data through researchCommunicate findings to company through standard and ad hoc reportsPromote best practices in data analysis and reportingCollaborate with cross-functional teams, work with fieldHelp Organize Internal Data

Qualifications:

Previous experience in business intelligence, analysis, or other related fieldKnowledge of statistical tools and business reportingStrong problem solving and critical thinking skillsStrong attention to detailAbility to prioritize and multitaskAbility to critically think, analyticalProactive, takes initiativeProficient in ExcelKnowledge of Security Industry a plus

Company DescriptionFounded in 1996 by Patrick J. Brosnan, Brosnan Risk Consultants (BRC), is a full-service protective, investigative and intelligence firm to a global network of clients. Headquartered in NY with branch locations in multiple states, Brosnan is one of the largest privately held providers of technology-driven security services. Brosnan’s mission is focused on leveraging manpower, data and technology to deploy smarter security for our customers.

Licensed in every state, BRC leverages the operational efficiencies of their 24/7 Global Command Center to ensure seamless Command, Control, Communication and Coordination of every security officer in the field. The unparalleled efficiency and effectiveness of our Command Center, and our fleet of Mobile Command Centers and SmartTrucks, has transformed Brosnan’s service delivery.

For almost 25 years, Brosnan has evolved as risk has evolved by providing security solutions that not only help protect against threats, but identify and mitigate issues before they become a threat.

Brosnan’s shift from the historical delivery of labor-based security to technology-infused risk mitigation solutions has provided a safer and more secure environment for our clients. The unwavering commitment to identify, test, and pilot innovative best-in-class security technologies has redefined our service delivery. Over its history, Brosnan has consistently seized opportunities to meet changing client needs.

title: Master Data Analyst
desc:
The Master Data Analyst role is a support function to Global Merchandising, Retail, Product Development, eCommerce and Logistics. The Master Data Analyst owns the integrity of our Vendor, Customer, and Item Set Up from product inception through liquidation by coordinating the departments that own the data elements, validating the data in our various systems, documenting process and training new hires. A high systems acumen, personal organization and attention to detail are key in this role.	Collaborate with Product Development and Merchandising in the promotion of new styles in Blue Cherry Conduct data cleaning to rid the system of old, unused data, or duplicate data for better management and quicker access - 15%

Support Sales and Production in the set-up of new Customers and Vendors, ensuring that all Terms, Discounts, Sales Offices and EDI flags are accurate - 10%

Support Sales and Merchandising during Market to ensure that Line sheets are timely and accurate, that prices are entered on time, information is uploaded to JOOR and that any changes are updated in the systems - 10%

Support product catalog set up across all channels globally. This includes Outlet, Licensed and 3rd Party. Validate/ QC markdowns and promotional pricing for stores and ecommerce globally - 25%

Partner with IT in documenting item set-up process / procedures and train new staff as necessary - 10%

Support E Commerce attributing and Item Set up process for Demand Ware. Work with site merchandising and buying office to ensure all products are ready to Go Live on web - 25%

Support Production, Merchandising and Operations in tracking progress against milestones on the PDT calendar - 5%

Qualifications:

High Excel Acumen, Systems competency, Data Entry experience, Organization, Ability to work independently, Ability to Multi Task

Preferred: Experience working in Product Development, Experience using Blue Cherry, PLM and AX

title: Talent Acquisition Data Analyst
desc:
Responsibilities

Role Summary

We are actively searching for Talent Acquisition Data Analyst with a strong understanding of recruiting, plus a passion for data and analytics. This person will be part of the Talent Acquisition Operations team and will engage with Talent Acquisition leadership, Employment Branding, Diversity & Inclusion and others to optimize utilization of metrics and analytic data. This person will also develop benchmarking and data-driven insights for enterprise-wide talent acquisition strategies and initiatives. We are looking for someone who can deliver recruiting trend/ROI analysis and recommendations that will enable our leaders to make informed business decisions, drive productivity and efficiencies to reduce or control costs.

Responsibilities



Use tools such as Excel, Powerpoint or infographics to deliver reports and dashboards
Create routine reports and prepare analysis of recruiting trends for existing programs and new initiatives
Assist in the creation of models, templates, and documentation
Design and recommend key metrics for talent acquisition operations to better align resources and drive better decision making
Identify, analyze and forecast trends into meaningful visualizations and develop presentations for leadership as needed
Produce and present ad hoc, monthly and quarterly talent acquisition analysis reports to support business line data activity reporting needs
Work with TA Managers to develop and maintain user dashboards that display real time and on-demand KPIs for the Talent Acquisition and Talent Sourcing and Operations teams
Evaluate trends on process and measuring organizational effectiveness and make recommendations for further optimization
Participate in the analytical approach to special projects or key business initiatives of the organization including developing timeline and objectives, performance standards, and engaging stakeholders from cross functional departments such as Social Media/Employer Marketing, Diversity & Inclusion and Campus Programs
Ensure high integrity and accuracy of recruiting data through audits and governance


Qualifications/Requirements

Qualifications



Demonstrates expert-level abilities interacting with end-users to understand and document business and functional requirements
Proven understanding of trend analysis and other business-related data analysis strategies
Knowledge in the areas of HR analytics and reporting
Experience with data warehousing, data management, modeling, and integration
Understands the design and development of data models and cleansing routines utilizing typical data quality functions, i.e. standardization, transformation, rationalization, linking and matching that leverages data standards, processes and technology management for data, master data, and metadata
Team player, high sense of urgency, desire to learn and grow
Self-directed, independent thinker with strong analytical skills and business acumen
Excellent interpersonal communication skills (oral and written) with proven data visualization and presentation skills


Requirements



Bachelor's Degree with a concentration in quantitative or related field such as marketing, human resources, data analytics, business analytics, computer science, engineering, economics, math, or statistics
3 years of experience developing reports in an enterprise reporting tool with proficient knowledge of databases and business systems
3 years of previous experience using research, data, and external information sources to support decision making
Expert in Excel Reporting
At least 2 years of experience in recruitment ATS and/or HRIS technology
Proven understanding of predictive analytics and other business-related data analysis strategies
Strong technical aptitude; advanced skills with various applications and systems including MS OfficeSDL2017

title: Analyst, Data Engineering
desc:
Job Description:

Job Summary

The main responsibility of the Analyst, Advanced Analytics is to apply sophisticated modeling and other advanced analytic techniques to help guide our clients' media spending plans and make their investments more efficient. This position will be charged with designing/developing the analytic processes and execution ongoing. In addition to the technical aspects required, it will involve cultivating and maintaining effective working relationships with a variety of parties including the clients, internal stakeholders (e.g. Brand and Activation), 3rd-party vendors, external clients, and operational areas within Horizon.

We are looking for someone who is intellectually curious with the drive and experience to identify, frame and solve business problems. They must be a critical thinker who can provide creative strategic solutions and who can follow-through with flawless execution. Critical to the role is the ability to provide thought leadership that can drive our capabilities through analytic innovations.

The ideal candidate will be a clear and persuasive communicator who thrives in a highly collaborative team environment and has the ability to guide solutions for ever-evolving real-time problem sets. Above all, the Analyst / Senior Analyst, Advanced Analytics must be highly driven with an exceptional work ethic, determination to overcome complex challenges, and must have a desire to have huge impact on the business.

50% of the time for this position will be devoted to analytics for a key major client vertical. This part of the position will be charged with aiding in the development of unique analyses and applications targeted against that part of our business. The other half of time will be devoted to direct client analytics, requiring a diverse set of problem-solving capabilities.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

70% Development and Enhancement of data and analytics capabilities



Assist in modeling and analytic efforts to provide insights into media planning and buying.
Constantly look for ways to improve the usage of Horizon's existing data and analytics infrastructure.
Work with stakeholders to improve current analytic processes, and develop new capabilities that set us apart in the marketplace.
Use automation and technology to increase efficiency and to provide the infrastructure to scale.
Bring an "outside in perspective" to analytic development; explore, identify and assess external best practices - and translate to the relevant application internally.


30% Cultivating and maintaining effective working relationships- internally and externally



Establish and maintain excellent working relationship with key functional areas, as well as HMI Analytics and other stakeholders throughout Horizon.
Act as a liaison between the Analytics team and the internal Brand, Activation and Operational areas.
Extensive brand team and client interaction and day-to-day management.


Supervisory Responsibilities

N/A

Knowledge and Skills Required



0-2 years of experience required in the Advanced Analytics realm, preferably in media or an adjacent field.
High-end marketing response modeling expertise (e.g. MMM) mandatory.
Bachelor's degree required.
Excellent problem solving skills and a dogged determination to work an issue through to its satisfying conclusion are both a must.
Ability to generate clear, concise and comprehensive analyses that tell the story behind the data!
Business acumen understands the strategic levers of the business and how analytics is a catalyst for decision making.
Demonstrated ability to be creative; to put structure around vague and unstructured requests/discussions.
Consulting skills can explore business view and work with them to develop mutually owned solution; can solve problems in complex situations using creative and conceptual reasoning.
Persistence: Demonstrate tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get new things done.
Comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and managing change, plus the capacity to move through road-blocks with enthusiasm and alacrity.
Strong verbal communication skills, extremely well-organized.
Analytical mindset with knowledge and passion for media, data and technology.
Creative thinker that is willing to challenge the norm to improve analytic processes.
Proactive individual with strong problem solving skills and an entrepreneurial spirit.
Collaborative, can-do attitude a must.
Pragmatic seeks and develops solutions understanding and communicating the relevance to others.
Ability to translate technical subject matter into relatable business terminology and respond to unexpected questions on the spot.
Proven effectiveness in managing business relationships.
Experience in fast-paced environment, possessing the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
Deep expertise in advertising platforms and/or the ad tech industry preferred.
Programming/scripting experience a plus (R, Python).
General Business Intelligence software expertise.
Exposure to large data sets ("big data") and analysis thereof a major plus.


Certificates, licenses and registrations

N/A

Physical Activity and Work Environment

N/A

Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.SDL2017</br>

title: Data Analyst
desc:
Position Information

 Recruitment/Posting Title Data Analyst Job Category Staff & Executive - Information Technology Department SA-Student Affairs, VP OverviewRutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is a leading national research university and the state of New Jersey’s preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education. Established in 1766 and celebrated a milestone 250th anniversary in 2016, the university is the eighth oldest higher education institution in the United States. More than 67,000 students and 22,000 faculty and staff learn, work, and serve the public at Rutgers locations across New Jersey and around the world.

Rutgers University–New Brunswick took root over 250 years ago. We are the state’s most comprehensive intellectual resource—the flagship campus of Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, as designated by the Association of American Universities. We are the region’s most high-profile public research institution and a leading national research center with a global impact. Posting SummaryRutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Data Analyst for SA NB- Student Affairs Research and Assessment. This office provides direction and assistance to the over 20 departments across the Division of Student Affairs regarding their assessment and evaluation needs. This new position meets the growing demand, value, and complexity around student affairs assessment.

Among the key duties of this position are the following:

• Responsible for developing appropriate statistical models to analyze quantitative and qualitative data, including querying, extracting, and merging a variety of complex data systems.

• Visualizes data, communicates it to relevant stakeholders, and helps facilitate its utility for decision-making, resource allocation and delivery, program development, and strategic planning.

• Provides consultation and advising to members of the Assessment Learning Community in the analysis, interpretation, and action planning related to data on the department/unit level.

• Communicates and interprets data to a diverse audience with varying levels of data acumen, and demonstrates experience with assessment and evaluation in a higher education setting. Position Status Full Time Hours Per Week Daily Work Shift FLSA Exempt Grade 05 Position Salary Annual Minimum Salary 58549.000 Annual Mid Range Salary 74109.000 Annual Maximum Salary 89669.000 Standard Hours 37.50 Union Description Admin Assembly (MPSC) Payroll Designation PeopleSoft BenefitsInformation about the benefits provided to Rutgers employees can be found at: http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview Seniority Unit Terms of Appointment Staff - 12 month Position Pension Eligibility ABP 

 
Qualifications

 Minimum Education and Experience• Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, psychology, sociology, mathematics, computer science, economics, education, or related field.

• A minimum of two years of experience in higher education, research, or assessment. Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities• Relevant professional research experience working in a technical environment, advanced level skills in Microsoft Office Suite.

• Excellent analytical, oral, written and interpersonal communication skills

• Must have knowledge of research methodology and the assessment cycle, educational research design, accountability issues and student learning outcomes

• Must demonstrate knowledge/experience in research design, program evaluation and/or assessment of student learning, and have experience in synthesizing and interpreting complex data and reporting findings to a variety of constituents in both oral and written communication

• Must be detail-oriented, highly organized, proactive, creative thinker and problem-solver, possess the ability to interpret and communicate statistical processes and findings to a diverse audience with varying levels of data acumen

• Strong analytical skills as well as verbal and written communication skills.

• Understanding of student and staff development within the context of Student Affairs work.

• High accountability for research ethics, as he/she/they will be handling of confidential and sensitive information.

• Highly detail-oriented, a skilled problem-solver and analyst, fluent in a variety of platforms used to analyze quantitative and qualitative data, understands and can apply of theories and terminology related to student development and campus climate, has high competence handling complex data management tasks, possesses

• Experience with data management (data gathering or storage) or statistical packages such as SPSS

• Experience with using survey software and reporting platforms such as Campus Labs and Qualtrics Preferred Qualifications• Master’s Degree in college student affairs, higher education administration, social sciences, statistics, or other related field.

• Experience with graphic design and data visualization software such as Microsoft PowerBI and Geospatial mapping technology

• Experience with creating data visualizations

• Knowledge of student development and higher education literature

• Experience with assessment design and evaluation

• An understanding of the issues of higher education and the ability to develop recommendations within a contextual understanding of institutional needs

• Creativity and perception to create meaningful displays of information that communicate complicated data to audiences of diverse backgrounds

• Proficiency in appropriate analysis software and languages such as Excel, SPSS, R, SAS, Python, Atlas, nVivo, and Power BI

• Knowledge of manipulating data sets including querying, integration, and data cleaning

• Knowledge of statistical techniques and methodologies (descriptive, correlational, and inferential)

• Experience working with relational databases and on-line survey and assessment tools (e.g., Campus Labs) Equipment Utilized• The Data Analyst must possess advanced skills in the Microsoft Office suite and operate in other campus database systems.

• Expected to use the Internet to complete work responsibilities

• Expected to use and maintain office equipment including but not limited to phones, copier, fax, and scanner

• Variety of data extraction, manipulation, compilation, and analysis programs

• Statistical software packages (e.g., SPSS, SAS, R), visualization tools (Microsoft PowerBI), and on-line survey tools (e.g., Campus Labs). Physical Demands and Work Environment Special Conditions

title: Data Analyst for Marketing Technology
desc:
One of SGA's Fortune 100 Financial Services Clients is seeking a consultant/contractor for a 12-24 month assignment.


 The ideal work location for this resource will be onsite in Des Moines - Iowa, St. Louis Park - Minnesota and Charlotte - North Carolina. There is a chance of this role to be remote as well, but the first preference is onsite. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills as the team is scattered across the US and there will be daily touch point meetings. Strong Data Analysis with a mix of some Business Analysis work. The tech environment currently is SQL, SAS and Teradata. There is a potential push in the future to move to Hadoop so that is a huge plus. The department is centered around customer data, marketing and campaign management technology. Any experience within the Marketing world within a financial firm is also a huge plus. This role is w2 only.


SGA is a Certified Women's Business Enterprise (WBE) celebrating over thirty years of service to our national client base for both permanent placement and consulting opportunities. For consulting positions, we offer a variety of benefit options including but not limited to health & dental insurance, paid vacation, timely payment via direct deposit. SGA accepts transfers of H1 sponsorship for most contracting roles. We are unable to sponsor for Right-to-Hire, Fulltime, or Government roles. All parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply for all roles. Only those authorized to work for government entities will be considered for government roles. Please inquire about our referral program if you would like to submit a candidate for any of our open or future job opportunities. SGA is an EEO employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status. To view all of our available job postings and/or to learn more about SGA please visit us online at www.sgainc.com.

title: Market Data Analyst
desc:
The incumbent will be responsible for analyzing market data information requirements and developing recommendations to meet specific business needs. Work with other team members to implement the onboarding and continual review of existing market data vendors/suppliers. The incumbent will have direct interaction with internal investment professionals as well third-party market data vendors. The incumbent must have a working knowledge of financial markets; an excellent understanding of the type of business areas supported; previous experience in the market data services business management industry; and vendor governance and due diligence experience.
