title: CIMD - Marcus by Goldman Sachs - Data Product Manager - Analyst
desc:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOBConsumer (Marcus by Goldman Sachs)

Marcus by Goldman Sachs is the firm’s consumer business, combining the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with 150 years of experience. Today, Marcus has $50 billion in deposits, $5 billion in loan balances and 4 million customers across our lending and deposits businesses, as well as the personal financial management app, Clarity Money. Through the use of insights and intuitive design, we provide customers with powerful tools and products that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity. We are backed by our unique team, comprised of individual contributors from leading agile technology companies, fintechs and consumer financial services companies, allowing us to disrupt the industry, while helping consumers take control of their financial lives.RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONSYOUR IMPACT

Marcus by Goldman Sachs is looking for a scrappy, entrepreneurial, technical and creative product manager to help build the future of Marcus with the Platform Product Management team. We are looking for a product manager to join our growing data team focused on platform products with internal and external partners. As a product manager for this initiative, you will have the opportunity to work with world class data engineers, define a roadmap for scaling the business, and be part of a team that solves to create a data platform that ultimately empowers people financially. You will be responsible for a critical part of the Marcus Platform’s long-term growth strategy and our mission to keep the customer at the center of everything we do. The ideal candidate is resourceful and detail-oriented with a penchant for moving fast on an agile team, collaborating closely with partners and engineers to develop a data network that powers both personal financial insights for our customers and Marcus business insights. As a product manager on the Platform team, you will collaborate with a wide range of key stakeholders across the business, Product, Engineering and the Contact Center to execute on a comprehensive Marcus product roadmap. You will have growing ownership and be coached to continually identify ways to hone the development process, shipping new service features and functionality seamlessly. You will join a team of creative and driven product managers to help build the foundation of the Marcus platform. The ideal candidate will be comfortable writing specs, partnering closely with Engineering on requirement refinement, managing project execution, and being laser focused on data quality for core services that power our businesses.

Work on some of the most complex technical and design challenges in technology and finance. Learn from the foremost experts in finance, technology and math who are diverse in their backgrounds. Benefit from ongoing training, development and mentoring to advance in your career.

RESPONSIBILITIES



 Dive deep into data and establish feedback loops with Engineering, Product Management, and customer service for deeper understanding and response to customer needs and product behavior
Define and iterate Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) within mission driven team that align executive key performance indicators (KPIs) and strategic priorities
Write user stories using control-driven design principles with detailed acceptance criteria
Groom user and technical stories with developers and validate that features meet expectations through product testing and user journeys
Create and track success metrics to measure the effectiveness of product features and quantify business impact 

Prioritize a product backlog, using domain expertise, customer insights and market research to make informed trade-offs between new feature development, platform investment and optimizations 

Build consensus with a broad team of internal cross-functional and external stakeholders, ensuring all viewpoints are accounted for and that solutions meet all necessary requirements
Collaborate with other internal and external product managers and diverse cross-functional teams to ensure cohesiveness of the overall product experience
Co-develop a roadmap with Data Engineering to support scalability 

Develop an organized roadmap working closely with the product development team and key stakeholders
Articulate and define both the technical product requirements and the sequencing of a roadmap down to a single sprint
Partner closely with analytics, execute fluidly and measure performance

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS



 1-3 years of project or product based experience with a desire to work in a fast-paced environment
High emotional intelligence, with an innate ability to recognize and understand the emotions and needs of others 

Empathy for your team and the customer
Aptitude for logically breaking down complex problems and communicating solutions with clarity 

Self-motivated and proactive team player who takes ownership of and accountability for initiatives
Strong organizational skills, such as effectively managing evolving priorities and strict deadlines
Preference to work in a highly dynamic and collaborative environment with heavy emphasis on teamwork, consensus and relationships
Proficient in major product management applications (e.g., Jira, Confluence) 

Proven track record of working with large data sets 

Willingness to help your team and roll up your sleeves with a positive attitude
Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently in a team-oriented and fast paced environment
Organized with a penchant for leading with data-driven rationale
Entrepreneurial problem solver and passionate about building solutions

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



 1-2 years of hands-on technical product management, 4+ years of large scale technical project management, or 2+ years of software development
Experience working with enterprise data sets, data transformations and analyzing patterns/trends
Proficient in major analytical tools (e.g., Snowflake SQL queries, Tableau data visualizations) 

Experience working with various data sets using SQL, R, or Python

Consumer and Investment Management (CIMD)

The Consumer and Investment Management Division includes Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM), Private Wealth Management (PWM) and our Consumer business (Marcus by Goldman Sachs). We provide asset management, wealth management and banking expertise to consumers and institutions around the world. CIMD partners with various teams across the firm to help individuals and institutions navigate changing markets and take control of their financial lives.ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHSThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

title: Senior Product Analyst, Data Analytics
desc:
CentralReach is a leading provider of EHR and practice management solutions that enable applied behavioral analysis (ABA) clinicians and educators to produce superior outcomes for people with autism and related disorders. Powered by its acquisition of Chartlytics, the company is revolutionizing the ABA space with cutting-edge solutions including precision teaching, clinical data collection, scheduling, billing, and learning management. Trusted by more than 75,000 clinicians and educators, CentralReach is committed to ongoing product improvement, market-leading industry expertise, world-class client satisfaction and support of the ABA community to propel industry practitioners into a new era of excellence.
We are looking for a methodical and solutions-driven Product Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product, and user experience. This person is responsible for assisting the product team with documentation of requirements, scoping of new product, identification of best practices and quality assurance testing of product before releases. The ideal candidate will be natural collaborator and problem solver who possesses a high intellectual curiosity and thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

This role will report directly to the Analytics Product Owner and be closely aligned with our Product organization to ensure consistent information flow across all areas of the product. In this key position you will:(1) Work with customers to document requirements for new development and enhancements to existing products. (2) Assist the product team with identification of best practices across the industry and help to develop benchmarks.(3) Work with Support to identify and resolve bugs within the reporting product as well as assisting in building out new product.(4) Assist in quality assurance testing of new products before launch.(5) Work with the Product Owner to develop and maintain internal reporting for the Product Department.This role is based out of either our Holmdel, New Jersey HQ or our Pompano Beach, FL office with ongoing travel between the offices. Key Responsibilities:





Drive Insights Through Data: Explore and visualize user data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, and user segmentationExplore Data: Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis that provides meaningful insights and synthesized recommendations to support informed decision-makingSolve Problems: Evaluate business trends and processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.Innovate: Ideate, conceptualize, and design rapid prototypes and forward thinking solutions that answer pressing business needsManage Stakeholders: Clear verbal and written communication of product enhancements and new feature development to stakeholders based on a detailed understanding of analytics needs, requirements and resources.Visualize Data: Develop product analysis advanced metrics and visuals, by collecting and integrating data from various sources, including web analytics tools and internal databasesExperiment: Conduct experiments (e.g., A/B and switchbacks) to evaluate the impact of new product featuresChampion for Data: Work to ensure data and product integrity by assisting in testing and validation of new and existing products.Define Metrics: Develop key benchmarking metrics critical for industry success.




Desired Skills and Experience:







Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or related fieldExperience: 3-5 years relevant experience in data analytics or relevant experienceExpert knowledge of SQL and Excel and advanced knowledge of PowerPoint, Word, Visio and MS Project requiredExperience with advanced data analysis, modeling and visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, R, Python or similarProficient in querying / manipulation of large data sets (SQL, Access or similar)Has experience with Agile methodologies and principles. Preferably Agile/Scrum/Kanban.Excellent communication and organizational skillsExperience gathering business requirements and documenting in an agile environment




Personal Attributes:







Highly motivated, self-starter, organized, independent with an ability to effectively manage through changeFundamental analytical and conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously transparently as well as effectively collaborate across teams and to work in a diverse, fast paced environmentProven ability to work in an ever-changing environment, ability to connect the dots and make decisions on your own feet Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.Exceptional communication skills including ability to take an independent stance when interfacing with cross functional stakeholders, while maintaining their respect and confidence



CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins at an ABA clinic based out of Pompano Beach, Florida. The company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, was drowning in manual management of her clinic from scheduling staff and filing claims to reporting on clinical data. She decided that there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EHR and practice management platform in 2012.
 Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.

title: Regulatory Data Senior Analyst
desc:
At the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, the work we do is consequential and challenging. Our environment encourages growth and diversity. Our employees flourish in a team-oriented atmosphere and are dedicated to the important mission of the New York Fed.

What we do:

The Federal Reserve Bank of NY's Data and Statistics function provides critical data capabilities in support of a safe and sound financial system. Our work promotes Financial Stability, the implementation of domestic and international supervisory policy, and Monetary Policy. The team's mission is to increase utility and ability to leverage financial data through standardization, thoughtful collection design, and increase capacity of the Function in order to scale operations.

In this role, you will be part of an optimized and highly effective delivery team in the Data Collection and Analysis Service (DCAS) Department. DCAS provides data preparation and capture services, quality assurance services, financial analysis, client services, operational excellence, project and change management, and enhanced controls that mitigate risk for data collections for use primarily by the U.S. Treasury, the Board of Governors and the Bank's Research and Market Analysis, Markets and Bank Supervision Groups. These positions support the Bank's key missions of informing and implementing monetary policy and ensuring financial stability.

The role will sit on the Financial Analysis Services Team (FAST) covering Financial and Market Conditions. The FAST team is responsible for performing data analysis, building out and managing analytical products and ongoing stakeholder and respondent management on interpretive reporting topics. FMC provides services focusing on the data quality assurance and analysis of regulatory capital and financial data received from domestic and foreign depository and financial institutions.

Your role as a Regulatory Data Senior Analyst:


 Independently analyzes and researches interpretive inquiries for moderately complex data series and reporters, reporting issues, and data concepts and conduct data analysis and visualization to support client outputs. This includes providing guidance on technical and reporting issues to respondents and stakeholders.
 Performs extended analysis and question respondents on data quality items of note for reporters and reports of higher complexity
 Establishes and leads dialogue with financial institutions to enhance data quality and controls at source and proactively escalate issues as appropriate
 Reviews Analyst's responses to non-interpretative inquiries (including Frequently Asked Questions) and quality assessment for assigned data series and provides appropriate feedback to Manager on Analyst's scope of work
 Independently assesses and responds to ad-hoc requests such as:


 preparing procedure and user guide documents
 providing comments, including to Board staff, on data collection operations
 conducting studies to determine the reporting practices and procedures employed by reporting institutions


 Leads or actively participates in Function and System workgroups as assigned
 Provides training to new employees, analysts, and peers on data collections and reporting concepts
 Leverages expertise to provide horizontal perspective to Department and Function discussions, actively participate in or lead initiatives of broader impact (e.g., working groups and committee meetings at local and national levels, on-site reviews), and reports and escalates to Department and Function items of notes)

title: Marketing Project – Data Analyst
desc:
About Capgemini

A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion (about $15.6 billion USD at 2018 average rate).

Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.



Role: Marketing Project – Data Analyst (383943)

Location: Bridgewater, NJ and Jersey City, NJ

Duration: Permanent

Job Description


Work with Product Management team for feature refinement.
Analyze the data from various discrete source systems including external marketing websites (e g LinkedIn) of the client and be able to profile the data using Informatica Developer then determine various data patterns and data quality observations.
Understand the target Data Model for the Data Store and Data Marts.
Work with Data Modelers to ensure the model is complete and works for the current client requirements.
Develop the data mapping documents for each of target tables from the source data and work with the clients Business Analysts or Product Management team.
Drive architecture of the project and assist offshore team on the development activities based on data mapping documents share results of the data analysis to ensure that the build teams understand the mapping rules.
Setup and drive the meetings and discussions with various teams on the client as well as Cap side to ensure a smooth flow of information.






Skill Sets:



8 years of Data Analysis, Data Mapping and Data Modeling experience.
Strong hands on experience or knowledge with ETL tools like Informatica, Datastage, SSIS etc. 

Experience working with offshore teams and be flexible to work early or late to ensure the teams understand all the data mapping documents being built Insurance industry and agile experience will be a big plus.






What we offer:



Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. This approach builds notably on our comprehensive competency framework, our personal development, training and career management programs, and our University innovative and business-focused learning curriculums. 

We promote a culture of diversity. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients. 

With the digital tech sector growing at a rapid pace and women significantly underrepresented in the industry, we are determined to inspire and recruit more women into technology and build diverse teams that reflect the clients we serve.
Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships. 

Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences. We strongly encourage women, veterans and active military service personnel to apply.

title: Salesforce Data Analyst
desc:
At M & T Tech

, were a team of makers, doers, and builders, working to create the most advanced technology solutions in banking. Were not your stereotypical suit and tie bankers: were an innovative team of leading tech experts, pushing boundaries, and taking risks. Were building an agile team of the most skilled and creative workers to solve complex problems, architect solutions, write high-performance software, and chart our new path, all to make the lives of our customers, and the communities that we serve, better. Join us and be part of something new as we build tomorrows bank, today.

OPPORTUNITY

:

As a Salesforce Data Analyst, the candidate would ideally possess Data Analysis experience in the Salesforce space. Additionally, the candidate should have experience in writing Gap Analysis and data mapping documents. Prior Agile experience, including participating in Sprints, tracking burn down rates, etc., is preferred. The candidate will work with our business partners and others in Technology and ancillary groups to manage master data to drive successful project outcomes. The individual will also need experience in developing data validation queries and have a strong understanding of data analysis tools and databases.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES

:



Identify patterns and trends in data sets
Support data mapping between legacy systems and CLM
Work alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish data requirements
Define new data collection and analysis processes
Support initiatives for data integrity, warehousing and normalization.
Manage requirements for master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Assist organization with the creation and documentation of reference data normalization and support the knowledge transfer to EDO.
Execute data profiling and validation for various data loads between Inbound and nCino
Monitor changes within toolkit to ensure data dictionary is maintained
Ensure tasks for assigned projects are completed in a timely basis and meet established milestones.
Prepare written artifacts such as data mapping documents and validation reports
Schedule and facilitate project team meetings, and document and distribute meeting minutes as applicable to ensure all team members are informed and issues are addressed.
Follow the Agile methodology by participating in daily stand ups, Sprints, demos, ceremonies, etc.
Complete other related duties as assigned.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED

:



Minimum of a Bachelors degree and 5 years operational/business analytics experience
In lieu of a degree, a combined minimum of 9 years higher education and/or work experience, including a minimum of 5 years operational/business analytics experience.
Ability to understand business(es) supported and its terminology.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to coordinate between Applications and business units.
Ability to drive project milestones and delivery dates.
Ability to recommend and implement systems solutions.


IDEAL QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED:



Experience in data models and reporting packages
Ability to analyze large datasets
Ability to write comprehensive reports
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Strong Microsoft Office skills required, particularly MS Excel
Sequel, BI and/or database skills helpful


We encourage candidates with relevant military experience to apply.

About M & T

M & T Bank is a Top 20 US bank holding company and one of the best performing and financial stable regional banks in the country, we offer our technology employees a wide range of performance-based career development opportunities. We have a strong commitment to our customers and the communities we serve, and we continue to grow with a focus on the future. So, when looking to advance your career, look to M & T. Grow with us.

Location

Buffalo, New York, United States of America

title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth
desc:
MongoDB is one of the fastest growing technologies of all time, and our ability to uncover deeper insights across our Product and Marketing initiatives will fuel our next phase of growth. You have familiarity with B2B and B2C SaaS products and a demonstrated ability to use data to conduct rigorous, insightful analyses throughout the funnel, from acquisition through retention, all while feeling at home in a fast-paced and challenging environment. You are a driven self-starter that can work proactively and collaboratively across all levels of the organization.

The Senior Data Analyst, Growth will work closely with stakeholders across our Growth Product and Marketing organizations. This role will be heavily involved in analyzing user engagement with the product, assessing the impact of experiments run by Marketing and Product teams and communicating insights to Growth leadership to help inform and prioritize future initiatives.

Responsibilities


Partner with cross functional stakeholders to develop insights about our self-serve funnel, with a specific focus on measuring user activation, monetization and retention
Work with Product and Marketing Leads to maintain a view of all Growth initiatives and how those initiatives drive changes to the business
Develop and maintain consistent reporting on Growth KPIs to give visibility to leadership on metrics trends on a daily basis
Conduct in-depth analysis of experiments, including but not limited to A/B and significance testing, to understand how various tests impact the entire funnel
Work with key stakeholders to devise and implement experiments intended to drive customer acquisition, engagement, retention, and growth
Perform ad-hoc analyses to help Product Managers and Marketers answer key questions about the business

Skills and Attributes


3-5 years of experience performing quantitative analysis for a software company, ideally with a focus on product and marketing analyses
Proficiency in at least one scripting language (Python, R) and SQL
Strong communications skills; able to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Ability to act as a thought partner with Product and Marketing leads, helping team members understand the business implications of your analyses
Experience with Tableau and Amplitude preferred but not required

Success Measures


Within 3 months you have an in-depth understanding of our Marketing and Product analytics stack and have built out the initial frameworks for regular Growth reporting
Within 6 months you have taken ownership of recurring reporting and have started to deliver more complex analyses, specifically focused on product usage and retention
Within your first year, you have become a trusted partner with key business stakeholders, are the subject-matter expert on Growth Analytics and performance, and continue to produce analyses that inform future Growth initiatives

*MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws*

title: Data Platforms Senior Systems Business Analyst
desc:
At Brown Brothers Harriman, we believe no job is too big or small for any of us to handle if it helps our clients. We value passionate, committed people who enjoy collaborating with others to find new solutions to complex business challenges. We are looking for the type of person who speaks their mind, truly listens and steps outside their role to add value wherever they can. Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all, we seek someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in protecting and enhancing our client’s financial well-being.

If you are looking for an entrepreneurial environment where you can learn and thrive, Brown Brothers Harriman is the right place for you

Join us as a Data Platforms Senior Systems Business Analyst

We are seeking a Senior Systems Business Analyst to join its Data Platforms Systems group. S/he will work as part of a dynamic and growing team responsible for delivering all IT project services for a major new technical product initiative. The individual will take part in the identification and definition of the change, design, development, testing and deployment of solutions as well as runs communication to both business and technical audiences. The Systems Analyst participates in all phases of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) from project scoping, planning and requirements definition to issues resolution, testing, training and implementation.

The BBH Data Platforms Systems team is responsible for creating a next generation platform providing our clients with commercial data services. The platform will consist of both a traditional Data Warehouse and new HDFS oriented data storage. It will incorporate new technologies and techniques in the areas of data ingestion, data transformation, data aggregation, and data access.

Some of your key responsibilities include:

• Facilitating communication between business users and technical teams

• Gathering requirements of proposed changes or issues to be fixed and helping set scope definition

• Conducting analysis of applications and systems

• Writing and/or reviewing technical specification documentation which may include data modelling, dataflow diagramming, screen design, workflow analysis etc.

• Involvement in design and development process as well as in system and UAT testing

• Release communication (providing demonstrations to the users, writing release documentation, taking part in release meetings)

• Involvement in deployments and checkout of the solution

• Working with project managers, developers, testers and other specialists across multiple teams and locations to make sure that projects meet business needs

• Mentoring/guiding more junior team members

Qualifications:

• Undergraduate Degree (Accounting, Banking, Economics, Finance, Computer Science or Management Information Systems preferred).

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

• 5+ years of analysis experience in software development projects

• Positive, can do attitude, open to change.

• Previous experience of working in an international corporate environment.

• Experience in one or more software methodologies such as Waterfall or Agile

• Demonstrates ability to take ownership and initiative

• Ability to work in and lead teams across multiple geographical locations

• Basic technical knowledge (e.g. programming skills, database design / SQL, application architecture)

• Highly organized and able to manage priorities and multiple work streams

What We Offer:

· A collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can

· Direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world

· Opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm

· A culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective

· High-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind

· Rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage

· Volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others

#LI-POSTWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.Full timeJersey City

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
Senior Data Analyst

25-Nov-2019

Role/Responsibilities

The individual will be an integral part of Moody’s Corporate Finance Group providing business data and internal process support for CFG management. The individual will be responsible for sourcing, organizing and reporting data related to core rating/research activities and personnel. The successful candidate will also be the owner of several key business processes, and will need to understand information and process flows.

The role includes a broad range of tasks including data extraction and analysis, generation and maintenance of data related documentation, and troubleshooting process issues which affect data quality. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to prioritize are critical to success. The role will require developing partnerships with internal business partners, and communication with senior managers.

title: Data Analyst
desc:
The Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining the integrity of the MMIS/ERP system(s) and other applications with respect to vendor data. The Data Analyst works with Supply Chain and Accounts Payable departments to ensure accurate and complete new vendor records in the system. The analyst will also manage vendor changes and maintain vendor names, physical and remit to addresses, Tax ID, among other key vendor information. The Data Analyst provides reports and is a resource for other staff members.
1. Functions as Supply Chain’s primary point of contact for managing vendor information, which includes setting up new vendors in the systems and managing all vendor changes, resulting from company mergers and other restructurings.
2. Collect, compile, sort and verify the data’s accuracy or completeness before it is entered.
3. Performs data integrity tasks by locating and correcting data entry errors, or reporting them to supervisors.
4. Maintains logs of activities, completed work, and/or overall status updates. File completed documents in appropriate locations or distribute them.
5. May create or modify data bases according to the needs of the department.
6. Provides direction or assistance to users of information regarding data requirements and status of paperwork. May train other data entry employees.
7. Makes recommendations and assists in data capture, data extraction and analysis and provides reports relates to vendors.
8. Develops, maintains, or implements procedures for data entry, data cleaning, documentation and other administrative tasks.
9. May be involved in vendor credentialing processes Identifies and recommends solutions to vendor data management issues and maintains a continuous improvement outlook

title: Client Manager - triReduce (Trade Data Analyst/Grad - 3 years experience)
desc:
DescriptionCME Group is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We’re small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

To learn more about what a career at CME Group can offer you, visit us at www.wherefuturesaremade.com .We are looking for a Client Manager to join our New York based triReduce Service Management team.The candidate will be technical, have a meticulous attention to detail and a broad understanding of OTC derivatives (rates, CDS, FX an commodities, for example) and risk. Good written and verbal communication skills in English are a must.

The New York triReduce Service Management team is the first line of contact for our clients with regard to the delivery of the triReduce OTC derivative trade compression service. He or she will provide support to our clients in front, middle and back office and work closely with the production, business and sales teams globally.

Service Management is responsible for the smooth running of the triReduce service. This team of dedicated staff is in continuous dialogue with major financial institutions worldwide, as well as other internal departments, in regards to upcoming cycles, trade data uploads, market and credit risk issues as well as any changes or developments to any aspects of the service, such as new assets classes and products, or changes to the service. Similarly, Service Management must continually stay abreast of any market or client events, activities or changes that potentially affect our service or our clients’ use of our offering or ability to participate in cycle

KEY SPECIFICATIONS:

Trade data normalization / handling

_ Liaising with subscribers on all issues relating to the service (via email, phone and face-to-face)

_ Working with clients on market and credit risk tolerances and issues

_ Promoting comprehensive and more effective usage of the service

_ Raising internal request for new functionalities and assisting in UAT testing

_ Client training (current and new functionalities, new client on-boarding

SKILLS:

Technical:

o Ability to interpret trade data

o Proficiency in using text editors and advanced spreadsheet functions

o Understanding of programming would be beneficial (e.g. VBA or Python)

o Basic understanding of database structures, as well as interrogation using SQL would be

highly beneficial

_ Customer relationship skills

_ Communication skills: verbal and written. The ability to understand complex process financial concepts, as well as the ability to explain these accurately and concisely to our clients

_ Knowledge of OTC Derivatives. Thorough understanding of the trade data fields of these

instruments as well as awareness of the OTC Derivative trade processing life-cycle

_ Basic understanding of market and credit risk management of OTC Derivatives, such as yield curves and valuation

KNOWLEDGE:

A technical background or technical interest, ideally in combination with financial knowledge or interest. For example:

_ Engineering degree

_ Mathematical degree

_ Business degree in combination with technical skills acquired after finishing the studies

EXPERIENCE:

Minimum 0- 3 years

SALARY:

Competitive]]>

title: Orion - Media Data Analyst
desc:
Position Summary

We are looking for a detail oriented professional to join ID Media team as a Media Data Analyst. In this role one will assist in the media and results analysis process, help inform client deliverables as well as report results. As a Media Data Analyst one will become a subject expert in DRTV touching a range of analysis from audience research to the measurement of media outcomes (reach, impression, frequency, verification and validation) to the data that shapes client optimization recommendation. One will help drive the development and use of various decision tools.

Essential Functions


Manage multiple data sources to analyze and assess client businesses across multiple DRTV dimensions
Data extraction, transformation & loading (ETL)
Monitor media campaign results for portfolio of clients
Analyze and analyze data sets to uncover media insights
Deliver quality, timely and client-friendly reporting through a variety of visualization tools
Oversee the necessary functions in the media system as required including inputting and issuing Estimate
Contribute to team’s overall capabilities and understanding of media and communications ecosystem
Remain informed on the day-to-day activities of clients
Understand and utilize syndicated media tools such as Kantar, as required

Qualifications/Work Experience


Must have experience working with large data sets to uncover insights that are essential to business optimizations
1-2 years of experience in data analytics, relational database work or relevant academic experience

Skills


Highly proficient in MS Office suite, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint
Strong mathematical skills: comfortable with numbers and analyzing data
Experience using Media Systems. For example, Mediaocean, CORE, TVSquared and other DRTV analytical tools
Experience using data visualization tools such as: Tableau or Dataroma preferred
Familiarity with relational databases and programming in any of the following: JAVA, Python, R or JavaScript

Education


Bachelor's Degree required, ideally in related field


About Us

ID Media is an Interpublic Group media agency known for identifying and delivering accountable media solutions that create better business outcomes for marketers. Backed by a culture that's deeply accountable for results, our people drive costs down and engagement up across broadcast, digital and print channels. We work with many leading brands, including Johnson & Johnson, Liberty Mutual, Quicken Loans and Zillow. ID Media is an eight-time winner of "Best Places to Work" awards in New York and Los Angeles as well as a ten-time recipient of IPG awards for diversity and inclusion.

title: Senior Data Analyst M/WBE, Enterprise Data Services
desc:
Job Description
  The Mayor’s Office of Contract Services (MOCS) oversees and supports the procurement activities of City agencies, with a goal to ensure fairness, transparency, efficiency and cost effectiveness. The Director is the City Chief Procurement Officer. Annually, agencies procure billions in products and services from a diverse pool of vendors that represent various industries. MOCS partners with industry groups to implement policies and tools that streamline and modernize procurement, resulting in the delivery of quality services to New Yorkers. Team members operate in a fast-paced, collaborative, service-oriented environment, where flexibility and ability to achieve results are valued.

The incumbent will report to the Senior Data Lead of the Data Analytic Services (DAS) unit at MOCS. With wide latitude for independent judgment, the Senior Data Analyst will perform the following job responsibilities, which include and are not limited to:

•	Managing data-related projects focused on the City’s Minority and Women Business Enterprise (M/WBE) program and policy directives related to the City’s M/WBE program.

•	Manipulating and analyzing contracting data from city agencies in order interpret M/WBE utilization rates.

•	Managing data-related projects which may include the Annual Procurement Indicators report, including agency Minority and Women Business Enterprise (M/WBE) utilization, local food purchasing, contract retroactivity, environmentally preferable procurement, apprenticeship, procurement cycle time, and compliance with other laws, executive orders, and policy directives.

•	Collaborating with team members to develop novel strategies for data and technical analysis.

•	Developing detailed methodologies in order to allow successful projects to be transferred and automated by client agencies. This includes the ability to translate data into insight.

•	Partnering with units within MOCS and other City agencies to create data solutions to streamline the procurement process, broadening competition and increasing vendors’ ability and capacity to do business with New York City. This includes, but is not limited to, creating and presenting compelling reports to stakeholders based upon project findings and methods.

•	Assisting in the documentation and standardization of current database environments and technical analysis.
  Minimum Qual Requirements
  1.	Graduation from an accredited college with a baccalaureate degree; or



Graduation from an accredited community college plus two years of experience with administrative, analytic, coordinative, supervisory or liaison responsibilities; or
A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent plus four years of experience as described in “2” above; or
A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience.


  Preferred Skills
  •	A master's degree from an accredited college in economics, business or public administration, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, sociology, political science, mathematics, public policy, computer science or a closely related field; with at least one (1) years of related work experience, or

•	A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and demonstrated equivalent expertise in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization, with at least three (3) years of related work experience.

•	Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills; experience with empirical methods and data analytics including working with large, complex micro - data sets, building applied statistics or econometrics models, and/or conducting research.

•	Strong technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques desired. Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business objects etc.), database (SQL etc), programming (XML, javascript, or El frameworks) preferred.

•	Demonstrated ability to produce System documentation, End-user documentation, ERDs, and workflows.

•	Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amount of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

•	Ability to take initiative, prioritize duties, problem solve, work independently and within a team environment, pay close attention to detail, meet deadlines, do appropriate follow-up, work well under pressure and maintain an enthusiastic work ethic. This includes maintaining a positive and helpful attitude and a proven capacity in project management skills, including organizing and strategic planning.

•	Ability to think outside of the box and develop novel strategies for analysis. This includes the ability to distill complex material into actionable recommendations.

•	Excellent written and oral communication skills. Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.

•	Ability to interface with all supervisory and frontline staff, including senior management and other respective stakeholders both in and outside government. Communicates effectively to non-technical teams and thrives in a dynamic environment.

•	Proficiency in SAS, STATA, SQL, R, SPSS (and/or other statistical software), Python or other programming languages with associated documentation.

•	Proficiency in MS Excel (Pivot, Advanced functions: INDEX/MATCH, VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, etc.), MS Access, MS Project, Visio and other products in MS Suite

•	Critical and proactive thinker with capacity to learn programming languages will be strongly considered.

•	Interest in New York City policy and operations, a plus.
  Additional Information
  Mayor’s Office of Contract Services is an equal opportunity employer.

Special accommodations provided for applicants with disabilities.

Mayor’s Office of Contract Services recognizes the unique skills and strengths gained through military service. Veterans and service members of the U.S. Armed Forces are strongly encouraged to apply.

STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS PROGRAM:

The U.S. Department of Education provides student loan forgiveness through the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLFP) to qualifying public service employees. As an employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for loan forgiveness should you meet the program’s eligibility requirements. For additional information on the PSLFP, please visit https://studentaid.ed.gov/sa/repay-loans/forgiveness-cancellation/public-service.
  To Apply
  External Applicants, please go to www.nyc.gov/jobs and search for Job ID#: 417280.

Current City Employees, please go to www.nyc.gov/ess and search for Job ID#: 417280.

Applicants may apply for jobs via NYCAPS with Apple products if they use the appropriate browser, such as Firefox, Chrome and/or Safari.

No phone calls, faxes or personal inquiries permitted.

Only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.
  Work Location
  22 Reade St. New York, NY 10007
  Residency Requirement

However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

title: Data Analyst
desc:
For more than a decade, Asembia has been working with specialty pharmacies, manufacturers, prescribers, payers and other industry stakeholders to develop solutions for the high-touch specialty pharmaceutical service model. Through collaborative programs, contracting initiatives, patient support hub services and innovative technology platforms, Asembia is committed to positively impacting the patient journey. Asembia focuses on the specialty pharmacy segment and offers comprehensive hub services, pharmacy network management, group purchasing (GPO) services, innovative technology platforms and more. As a leading industry voice and advocate, Asembia is committed to bringing strategic channel management solutions, leading-edge products and high-touch services to the specialty pharmacy industry that help our customers optimize patient care and outcomes.

Primary Function:

Responsible for assisting in the data and analysis projects to support client programs within Operations and Hub Services. Will collaborate closely with Account Management, Manufacturer Relations, Trade Relations, Data, Finance, IT, and Distribution Teams.

Job Scope and Major Responsibilities:

· Conduct data analysis of Hub Services programs to support Operations and the business

· Update, Improve, and Maintain existing reporting and dashboard requirements in support of Operations and the business

· Manage multiple data request

· Work cross functionally to understand data base structure and how to query it based upon requested data analysis

· After conducting data analysis, be able to utilize MS Office Tools to present findings in a consumable format

· Execute periodic reviews of program performance and performance of pharmacy network based upon contract requirements

· Support Business Reviews

· Monitor exception reports and report deficiencies/failures to the appropriate team/department to correct issues

· Be able to interface with client/business as required during day-to-day operations

· Assist with operational management of the end to end procedures of assigned projects

· Perform any administrative and other duties assigned

· Compliance with the provisions of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 and its implementing regulations, as amended (“HIPAA”)

Performance Criteria:

Helps Operations team develop and run reports and conducts data analysis for client facing programs. Ensures that data and analysis request are executed in a timely manner to support the client and the program(s). Supports existing dashboards and scorecards for the pharmacy network in support of the hub services team.

Minimum Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree (preferred accounting, science, or math focus)

· Advanced MS Excel knowledge (being able to pull in data and conduct analysis with large data sets), Proficiency in MS Word and PowerPoint

· Basic knowledge in SQL (advanced knowledge preferred) to conduct queries or run analysis

· Experience and comfortability working with large sets of data and being able to interpret the results

· Strong attention to detail

· Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of team

· Must be able to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

· Minimal travel required (less than 10%)

AsembiaiscommittedtoEqualEmploymentOpportunity{EEO)andtocompliance withallFederal,Stateandlocallawsthatprohibitemploymentdiscriminationonthebasisofrace,color,age,naturalorigin,ethnicity,religion,gender,pregnancy,maritalstatus,sexualorientation,genderidentityandexpression,citizenship,geneticdisposition,disabilityorveteran'sstatusoranyotherclassificationprotectedbyState/Federallaws.

title: Data Analyst
desc:
The Oneida ESC Group is a family of companies owned by the Oneida Nation of Wisconsin that delivers customer-focused engineering, science, and construction services worldwide.

Our family of companies include: Oneida ESC Group (OESC), Oneida Total Integrated Enterprises (OTIE), Mission Support Services (MS2), Sustainment & Restoration Services (SRS) and Oneida Engineering Solutions (OES). We integrate our staff for dedicated, cooperative, and business-like delivery of services to enhance our customers missions.

Sustainment & Restoration Services (SRS) is an 8(a) firm that provides engineering, science, construction, munitions, and specialized professional services solutions for customers nationwide.

SRS has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst the United States Military Academy, West Point.

The Office of Economic and Manpower Analysis (OEMA) and the Economics Department at The United States Military Academy, West Point welcomes applications for one open Data Analyst position in direct support of our mission of conducting policy analysis for senior leaders in the Department of Defense. Data Analysts in OEMA work alongside PhD economists conducting empirical research on topics in labor and public economic fields using administrative data from government, non-profit and private sources. These include, for example, data from the Army, Department of Defense, Veterans Affairs, Social Security Administration, credit bureaus, and the National Student Clearinghouse. Successful analysts are those who have demonstrated the ability to work with large datasets, have an appreciation for and experience with genuine empirical research, and have an interest in pursuing economics or policy research at the graduate level in the future. A completed B.S. in Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related degree is required at the time of appointment.

EOE- Minorities/Females/Disabled/VeteransSDL2017

title: Analyst, Advanced Data Modeler
desc:
Media Storm (A Division of Water Cooler Group) New York, NY (SOHO)

Analyst, Advanced Data Modeler

The Analyst, Advanced Data Modeler will leverage technology and advanced analytical methods to organize, analyze, evaluate and discover new insights hidden in large scales of data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building automating data collecting and reporting system integrated with our products.

Responsibilities:


Statistical modeling and data mining on both structured and unstructured data to extract insights in a timely manner

Work with Market Analysts to refine the methodology, data collection and modelling

Investigate and evaluate new datasets

Design and build robust and scalable solutions for structured and unstructured data conducive for business insights, reporting and analytics

Use business intelligence tools and applications to deliver research findings to market teams

Develop software and websites to deliberate our analytic products 

Requirements:


Hold an advanced degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering or Economic degrees 

1-3 years of relevant hands-on work experience

Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research utilizing large data sets

Solid understanding of data structures and databases in structured & unstructured environments

Extensive knowledge with machine learning, statistical models and data mining tools.

Strong programming skills in statistical software: Python or R is preferred

About Us:

Media Storm has deep roots in the entertainment industry, having helped 60 + network, cable and theatrical companies achieve unprecedented ratings, box office and brand awareness successes throughout our 18-year history. As entertainment media specialists we understand the environmental and cultural factors that drive awareness, develop preference and create action and apply the expertise to help iconic brands in hospitality, tourism, packaged goods, beverage, fashion retail, healthcare and the non-profit sector exceed sales, bookings and awareness goals every day.

title: Data Lineage Analyst - Data Governance
desc:
Your RoleAre you a problem solver who is passionate about data? Can you connect the dots and quickly turn the un-known into the Governed? We’re looking for someone like you to:

• manage the planning, coordination & delivery of regulatory data lineage demand

• analyze & document data flows; publishing data definition, lineage & controls in divisional Data Governance platform (Collibra)

• track delivery against Data Governance Domain Enablement plans/ roadmap, effectively communicating status and progress to senior stakeholders

• support Data Governance artefact creation & attestation; providing Data Governance on-boarding/ training to business subject matter experts

• organize Data Governance Committees & create ‘Scorecards’ to report on Data Governance maturity, effectiveness and overall health of key data elements (KDEs)Join usWe're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.Disclaimer / Policy StatementsUBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.Your teamYou’ll be working within the Data Governance function of the UBS Asset Management Chief Data Office (AM CDO). We’re an innovative data management organization focused on re-defining the Division’s data strategy and supporting the management & governance of core data-sets used across Asset Management. Our business value aligned Data Governance approach provides ample opportunity for a passionate self-starter to collaborate with senior stakeholders throughout the Division to establish trust & transparency in data life-cycles

Working in the AM Chief Data Office, you’ll deliver cutting edge solutions that supply high quality, governed data across Domains; helping transform the organization & establish a data driven culture!Your expertiseYou have:

• a bachelor’s degree and 4+ years work experience, with a minimum of 2 years working directly on Data Governance/ Data Management initiatives

• knowledge of Regulatory Data Management & Reporting, with familiarity of core regulatory drivers (BCBS, CCAR, MiFID II, DFAST, Volcker, Solvency II, etc.)

• proven ability to execute/ deliver within large-scale data focused change programs

• an understanding of, and experience creating, Data Governance artefacts (such as Business Glossaries, Data Dictionaries, Business & Data Quality Rules, and Lineage)

• data analysis skills with experience in data profiling & discovery; hands-on SQL experience strongly preferred

• strong documentation abilities, including strong Excel & PowerPoint skills, Visio flows, and mock-up creation

You are:

• data driven and familiar with Data Governance principles

• well organized & detail oriented

• highly motivated & self-starting (independently lead tasks to conclusion)

• a critical thinker with an analytical mindset

• an effective communicator with the ability to interact with people at all levels of the organization

title: Product Analyst, Data
desc:
Reonomy leverages big data, partnerships and machine learning to connect the fragmented, disparate world of commercial real estate. By providing unparalleled access to property intelligence, Reonomy products empower individuals, teams, and companies to unlock insights and discover new opportunities.

Headquartered in New York, Reonomy has raised $128 million from top investors, including Sapphire Ventures, Bain Capital, Softbank, Primary Ventures, Georgian Partners, Wells Fargo Strategic Capital, Citi Ventures, and Untitled Investments. Our clients represent the biggest names in CRE, including Newmark Knight Frank, Cushman & Wakefield, Tishman Speyer and WeWork.

If you're excited by growth, innovation and the ability to shape one of the biggest markets, join us as our journey is just beginning!

ABOUT THE ROLE:

Our growing Product team is looking for a Product Analyst to join Reonomy! You should be someone who is passionate about data with an investigative mindset and a knack for connecting the dots! As our Product Analyst focused on data, you'll investigate new data sources and design the process to be followed by other researchers. As the first person in this role, you will play a vital part in defining our analytics strategy and methodology. You will partner with Engineers and Product Managers to surface insights about our data, formulate a product roadmap, and assist team members cross-functionally with all data related inquiries.

Would you describe yourself as an inquisitive self-starter, energized by the possibility of joining a growth stage tech company? Then this Product Analyst role is for you!

Responsibilities Include:



Partner with engineers and product managers to surface insights from our data and help formulate our product roadmap
Conduct investigations into our underlying data sources and assist other members of the organization with data-related inquiries
Evaluate new data partners and government data sources to identify product development opportunities
Help design and build data prototypes to form the backbone of new products
Dive into the world of commercial real estate and the related datasets, including geospatial data, business data, government data, and client data
Help procure or create test sets to evaluate machine learning algorithms
Become an expert on our product suite and the way people use them
Define and analyze metrics and communicate insights to the rest of the organization
Collaborate with designers and engineers to create a best-in-class user experience
Engage with customers to understand feedback from our users and communicate findings


ABOUT YOU:



1+ years of experience in a role that involves data analysis
Commercial Real Estate knowledge, preferred but not required
Experience with SQL and coding, or at least a strong desire to learn
Excellent analytical skills, with a desire to tackle complex problems
Strong interpersonal skills, with a desire to work on a highly collaborative team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A detail oriented mind with inclination for investigative data work
Proactive and persistent


Benefits:



Competitive salary
Company stock options
100% coverage on medical, vision and dental health plans
Unlimited Vacation
401k plan and commuter benefits
Office perks: catered lunches 3x/week, catered breakfast 2x/week, unlimited snacks, team happy hours, free Citi Bike membership, fitness discounts, free Spotify membership


We do not accept unsolicited resumes from outside recruiters/placement agencies. Reonomy will not pay fees associated with resumes presented through unsolicited means.SDL2017

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
At Greater Than One, we proudly call ourselves the “Imagination Agency.” Far from being a simple slogan, it is an organizational creed, a way of life. In every department reside the innately curious—imagineers who believe our many minds are greater than one, and that, through the power of our collective imagination, we illuminate our thinking, trigger emotions, and enliven every single action we make. This allows us to transform paralyzing problems into paradigm-changing world-class solutions.

Greater Than One (GTO) is seeking a skilled Senior Data Analyst to assist with the measurement, reporting, and optimization of marketing efforts to achieve our client’s business objectives. The Senior Data Analyst couples strong consulting skills with rigorous analytic capabilities to develop meaningful insights for our clients. The Senior Data Analyst will present learnings and intelligence to our clients and answer questions about measurement methodology.

The role is in the Analytics and Strategy Department and will partner closely with the teams such as Display Media, Social, SEM/SEO, and Account.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Work with clients and GTO teams to identify business needs and analytics opportunities.  Delve into brand marketing plans to create a measurement framework that aligns with client’s objectives and KPIs. Design analytics reporting to showcase the most important series of actionable business metrics.  Discuss Market Mix modelling solutions to optimize channel performance  Outline the benefits and tradeoffs of Digital Attribution, Market Mix Modeling and other measurement and optimization techniques. Develop workflows and processes to improve efficiency and accuracy in reporting. Work closely with internal teams to develop estimates for analytics projects to our clients.

Requirements

 Bachelor’s Degree Minimum of 3-4 years’ experience within business/marketing data analytics Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to interface with clients Strong oral and written communication, including demonstrated ability to synthesize complex analysis into clear and succinct insights Strong proficiency across the following platforms: Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, Google Analytics, Campaign Manager  Ability to aggregate information and data from different sources Exposure to various measurement approaches as well as an understanding of Market Mix Modeling Working knowledge of reading online and offline Social, Media Web and Search channel metrics reports.  Ability to manage junior staff and cross functional teams in the development of reports and other analytics deliverables Excellent organizational, time management, and multitasking capabilities a must Healthcare/Pharma/Agency experience preferred Demonstrated understanding of analytical techniques including regression, trend analysis, forecasting, predictive modeling a plus

desc:
ACA Compliance Group (“ACA”) is a leading provider of risk management and technology solutions that focus on regulatory compliance, performance, financial crime, and cybersecurity. We partner with our clients to help them mitigate the regulatory, operational, and reputational risks inherent in their business functions. Our clients include leading investment advisers, private fund managers, commodity trading advisors, investment companies, broker-dealers, and domestic and international banks

Data Analyst

Board reportingInternal reportingKPI trackingForecasting

Role won’t just be focused on reporting and generating reports – the successful candidate will have to own the data and be able to carry out analysis and present findings and their own recommendations

Translate business questions into specific quantitative questions that can be answered with available data using sound methodologies.Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answering specific questions. ·Conduct written and verbal presentations to share insights and recommendations to varying audiences.Define and align KPIs across multiple functional groups (marketing, product, technology) and business objectives (acquisition, sales, engagement, retention)Compile and reconcile data from multiple sourcesUtilize analyses to design and develop tools, techniques, metrics and dashboards for insights and data visualizationsIdentify gaps in data collectionDevelop a vision to extend/improve existing analyticsCommunicate effectively and translate business requirements into data reporting solutions
