Employees may only maintain securities accounts that must be disclosed to FINRA at one or more securities firms that provide an electronic feed (e-feed) of data to FINRA, and must move securities accounts from other securities firms to a firm that provides an e-feed within three months of beginning employment.

As standard practice, employees must also execute FINRA’s Employee Confidentiality and Invention Assignment Agreement without qualification or modification and comply with the company’s policy on nepotism.

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
What You'll Be Doing:


Working on problems that affect the lives of real people. Our users depend on us to make positive changes to their health and their lives.
Basing your work on scientifically-proven, peer-reviewed methodologies that are designed by medical professionals
Collaborating with a team both onsite and offsite -- about 50% of our engineering team is fully remote; we worry about results, not time spent in seats.

What We're Looking For:


You have at least 4 years of experience, and have held a similar role in a team of 5-10 data analysts with broad, cross-team responsibility
You possess excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience, especially when it comes to scenarios in which the data can't give you the right answers
You're passionate about establishing and following best practices for data analysis and advocating for them to all of Noom
You look forward to working alongside our Data Engineering team to ensure that we collect and catalogue all the data that our business generates, both internally and through third-party services, and use if effectively to help drive business decisions
You have a deep understanding of practical statistical analysis, and have a track record of successfully applying it to real-world problems
You are deeply familiar with the SQL language, advanced spreadsheet solutions, and a BI reporting tool (we use Looker, but experience in others like Tableau and Periscope is fine)
Some scripting experience (Python, R, or similar) is a definite plus
You take your job very seriously, but you don't take yourself too seriously!

What Makes This Job Amazing:


You'll be helping millions of people lead healthier lives every day
You'll be a part of Noom's rocketship-- revenue has grown 20x in the last 2 years and our team is growing fast.
You'll have wonderful benefits including healthcare/dental, wellness budget, daily gourmet meals prepared by our onsite chefs, and onsite yoga
You'll experience huge learning & professional growth opportunities. Noom believes in supporting your professional and personal growth: we'll cover the cost of books, courses, conferences… you name it!
You'll add to our transparent, high-performing, and close-knit culture

Noom Inc. is a leader in mobile health coaching. We combine the power of technology with the empathy of real human coaches to deliver successful behavior change. Our direct-to-consumer mobile applications have reached more than 45 million users worldwide-- and counting. We've leveraged our behavior change platform to incorporate the CDC's Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP), and have expanded to programs for diabetes management, pre-hypertension, and hypertension. Our Engineering team is at the forefront of this challenge, solving complex technical problems that center around habits, behavior, and lifestyle.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to work cross-functionally in our New York office with all our departments and help them use data to ask great questions and make successful business decisions.

This position is based at our New York City headquarters -- local applicants only.

title: Office of the CAO | Reference Data, Technical Operations Analyst
desc:
Job Description

 The Team:

We are looking for leaders and problem solvers who are passionate about data and data management.

The purpose of the Reference Data Product Management group is to manage daily operations of enterprise reference data systems and associated businesses processes. The role requires effective management of tactical, BAU activity, as well as longer term, more strategic projects to introduce product and process improvements.

A successful candidate will be an analyst with a strong technical and operations background who communicates and collaborates effectively, taking ownership and accountability for a wide range of projects. Scope of projects will range from data design and analysis, to workflow design and automated report generation, to leveraging self-service tools and scripting in support of daily production operations. The candidate will demonstrate a track record of success in a technical operations role, with the ability to contribute meaningfully to superior analysis, tooling, and data-driven process improvements over time. The ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders; front office customers, project managers, business analysts, and technologists is highly valued.

Primary Responsibilities:



Reporting to the Project Management and Business Analysis (PM/BA) Lead, the Technical Operations Analyst will be responsible for supporting robust reference data operations, with a focus on instrument master data, but also including other types of reference data such as party and end of day pricing data.



Design and help implement process automation and workflow tools (e.g. Jira).
Support data design, collection, analysis, and automated report generation for change and incident management, as well as global operations.
Design and configure functions within reference data (e.g. data quality checks), via GUI or SQL / scripting.
Perform ad hoc data analysis, using a variety of tools as well as scripting. 

Work with technologists, project managers, and business analysts to deliver reference data system upgrades. 


Required Skills

 Qualifications:



3 or more years of professional experience in financial services, with working knowledge of financial products and instruments.
Proficient in SQL and at least one language (e.g. Python).
Experience with workflow tools (e.g. Jira) and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau) preferred.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with multiple stakeholders.
Very strong attention to detail, with an interest in process design and automation.
Strong analytical skills.



Education: BA/BS Bachelor’s Degree (STEM degree preferred)

 About CitadelCitadel is a global investment firm built around world-class talent, sound risk management, and innovative leading-edge technology. For a quarter of a century, Citadel’s hedge funds have delivered meaningful and measurable results to top-tier investors around the world, including sovereign wealth funds, public institutions, corporate pensions, endowments and foundations.

With an unparalleled ability to identify and execute on great ideas, Citadel’s team of more than 675 investment professionals, operating from offices including Chicago, New York, San Francisco, London, Hong Kong and Shanghai, deploy capital across all major asset classes, in all major financial markets.

title: Product Data Analyst - Equinox Media
desc:
Job DescriptionCompany DescriptionOUR STORY:

Equinox Group is a high-growth collective of the world’s most influential lifestyle brands, that are disruptive leaders in the convergence of fitness, experiences and community. Its mission is to restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and

experiences that define it. In 2019, Equinox unveiled its new on-demand fitness streaming platform, Equinox Media. This venture blends digital and in-real life experiences across hardware and personalized content representing its portfolio of brands. In addition to the new digital venture, Equinox Group’s ecosystem of brands currently includes Equinox, Equinox Hotels, SoulCycle, Precision Run, Blink Fitness, Furthermore, PROJECT by Equinox, E by Equinox, Pure Yoga and Equinox Explore. Its creative vision and strategic growth are led by Executive Chairman and Managing Partner Harvey Spevak.Job DescriptionIt is an exciting yet critical time for our teams at Equinox Media and we're looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our Data team to help us invent new ways of connecting people to the communities and fitness that they love. If you're someone who is passionate about developing strategies based on insights from real people and data, and can turn those insights into opportunities for the business and product teams to grow, then this is the team for you. There will also be significant exposure to modern data processing and analytic tools as your work spans across the broader technology groups as well. Our team embraces a true entrepreneurial spirit; operating with a sense of pride, perseverance and care for one another. We strive to continually deliver the best results and focus on how every action taken helps push our mission forward.

What you'll do:

Providing data reporting functions to the business and technical community using SQLqueryingWorking with business and technology partners to build insightful analytical solutionsTroubleshooting data discrepancies along with resolving and clarifying themIdentifying areas where operational efficiency can be improved through enhancedautomation along with implementing those enhancementsHelp engineering team with profiling and onboarding new datasets.Develop automated data profiling and quality checks


Qualifications


Bachelor’s Degree Required. MIS / Computer Science / Engineering / Data SciencedisciplineExpertise in SQL Server/ Redshift; SQL analytic capabilities (with 4+Years hands on experience in SQL)4+ Years working as a Data Analyst with a strong ability to analyze data and performroot cause analysisAbility to extract information from multiple databases using complex query statementsand advanced database toolsOrganize, analyze and disseminate medium to large amount of information with greatattention to detail and accuracyKnowledge of analytic tools like TableauGood exposure to Data Warehouse principles and basic understanding of data modelingconcepts and methodologiesExperience working with structured and semi-structured data (xml, json)Experience working with ticketing and project management systems (Zendesk, Jira)Strong documentation and communication skillsCreative, flexible, eager to learn, and able to work successfully in a multi-project,deadline driven environment within Agile frameworkExcellent written and verbal communication skills requiredAny marketing tools (Adobe, Braze, CDP, ExactTarget) experience a plus


Additional InformationEquinox Media is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate unique points of views & experiences across age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability & ethnicity in building the future of our digital business. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company. We want to inspire a workplace where individuals embrace their differences and similarities, where we are building products and experiences that inspire and improve people's lives.

See what we're up to: https://www.fastcompany.com/90386259/soulcycle-at-home-equinox-announces-streaming-fitness-platform-equipment

title: Data Classification Program, Business Analyst
desc:
Position Summary:

The Data Classification Program, Business Analyst, works with technical and business groups to provide an enterprise-level focus to data protection. The Analyst has responsibilities related to the evolution and maintenance of the Data Classification and Inventory Program. The Data Classification and Inventory Program is vital to the overall effectiveness of the firms data protection strategy and control environment. The Analyst will utilize data classification and data discovery technologies to implement and analyze data protection controls. Further, the Analyst will work with key stakeholders to understand data protection use cases and work with the Program manager to develop metrics/reporting on the data inventory and control effectiveness. The Data Classification Analyst supports the Program Manager in the areas of project planning and project execution.

Principle Responsibilities include:

Planning, Organization and Maintenance



Help develop clear, concise methodology documents, which require proficiency in interviewing skills, workflow analysis and risk analysis
Help develop, measure and report on Data Classification and Data Inventory metrics
Help identify opportunities to expand Data Classification Program capabilities and put plans in place to achieve objectives
Help plan and participate in Data Classification Program awareness activities including: preparation of meeting agenda materials, presentations and written communications
Help develop, maintain and promote adherence to best practices that support continued Program maturity


Project Management



Develop and review business case documentation, project plans and project workflows as requested by Project Manager.
Help collect project status updates (both within and outside of Data Protection) for integration into overall Program tracking and reporting
Maintain adherence to SDLC and Change Management processes for assigned projects and initiatives


Analysis/Execution



Define and document functional and technical integration requirements for Data Classification and Data Inventory capabilities/tools
Interview SMEs within Risk, Compliance, business and systems groups and conduct independent research to maintain an accurate current state analysis of the Data Inventory
Develop, document and implement BAU activities related to data classification validation; the review/maintenance of data classification processes and standards; configuration updates within data classification tools
Assist in the Data Classification technology roll-outs across the enterprise including the coordination of training/awareness for the user community
Support Data Protection technology implementations and the Engineering Team by documenting business systems requirements and participating in testing and tuning activities
Assist in Program prioritization activities by analyzing and documenting risk drivers and analysis of current controls


Candidate Requirements include:



BA/BS degree and/or related work experience.
4+ years of Business Analyst experience including writing business systems requirements, preferably at a financial services company.
2+ years of project administration work and project planning/management
Data Classification subject matter expertise and experience
Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies experience a plus
Proficiency with project methodologies and project administration practices
Ability to analyze current workflows and identify opportunities for improvement
Knowledge of all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle
Familiarity with Systems Infrastructure
Strong written and oral communications skills
Skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to create presentations using software such as Microsoft PowerPoint.
Ability to use standard desktop tools effectively (Lotus Notes, Microsoft Office).


We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.

Full time

New York

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:

Location : Princeton,NJ

Duration: 12+Months

· Should be having very strong SQL knowledge, capable of writing complex analytical SQLs

· Advanced knowledge and experience working with relational databases

Role Description

· Maintain, cleanse and update records within the Client Relationship Management (CRM) systems utilized by BlackRock's Retail and Institutional sales channels. This will include researching information across a variety of internal and external data sources.

· Work in partnership with our team members to ensure all data exceptions and service requests are completed accurately and within our agreed upon SLA

· Identify trends in data quality anomolies and suggest process and techonology improvements

· Organized and detail oriented with strong time management skills

· Strong control/risk mitigation mentality with ability to know when to escalate issues

· Capacity for critical and independent thought, especially around process improvement

title: BI Analyst, Media Technology & Data - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
desc:

You will use your talent for data focused development to support data visualization and reporting solutions. This may include ETL procedures for data sources, development of dashboards, data flows, training internal users.

Tableau Server management Manage Tableau Server sites, projects and user access.

title: Senior Metrics and Reporting Analyst - Data Governance and Management
desc:
A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It’s a career journey you can be proud of, and you’ll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation. It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses “Be Good At Life.” To learn more, please visit LinkedIn, our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com.

The New York Life Security Organization is looking for an individual to provide data management and governance functions in support of the services we deliver. We are looking for a skilled professional to work with the data owners across numerous sources to facilitate ingestion for our reporting programs. This person will also be responsible for building processes to ensure that the data is complete and accurate. Data accuracy is a critical function for our organization as it will support multiple programs and reporting thereof that will be delivered to oversight committees, audit teams, regulatory requests, and management up to and possibly including the Board of Trustees.

Role and Responsibilities

Work with data owners to develop and improve delivery methods to support our metrics and reporting needsDevelop and improve data accuracy and assurance processes Ensure providing complete, accurate, and timely metrics information to stakeholdersEnsure a standard process is used throughout the security organization for data collection, preparation and qualityWork with the dashboarding team to ensure data preparation meets the metric requirementsActively solicit input from stakeholders and provide feedback to the leadership and program managersAssist periodic refinement of standards-based and best practices compliant security metricsMeet with area managers and governance teams to understand their metric and reporting needsProvide project estimations for build and run of new and updated dashboardsWork with system owners to improve data ingestion (automation, direct connectors, etc)Manage any 3rd party consultants employed to support data management and governanceEnsure the security of the data within the databases/data-hubs/and other storage locations used thereinFollow best practices for secure code developmentFollow NYL TDLC and other process and standards

Qualifications

Experience in managing/developing data preparation workflows (e.g., Alteryx, Trifacta, Tableau Prep)Experience in developing and executing change management around data-sources, including training and awareness, stakeholder communication, issue resolution and escalation protocolsUnderstanding and experience in data management, including ETL processes, database principles, data security and stewardshipExperience in software development life-cycle and methodologies (e.g., Agile development)Preferred Experience in supporting programming/ development tools (such as R, Python, VBA) for ad-hoc advanced insights and reportingExcellent written and oral communication skillsAbility to tailor communication style to audience at hand and to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical resources.Self-directed, works with minimal guidance, and recognizes when guidance needed.Ability to manage multiple tasksAbility to gather and document requirements and translate to technical plansTechnical background, with an ability to think outside the box and propose original solutions.Prefer an understanding of the following technologies is required:


TableauTrifactaSQL Integration ServicesSQL Management StudioSQL Reporting ServicesRPython
Possess a willingness to learn innovative approaches and tools in a fast-paced environment.

General Experience, Education and Professional Certifications:

Minimum 3-5 years of experience in data management and governance related rolesBA/BS Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience in technology roles

SF: LI-CC1

EOE M/F/D/V

title: Master Data Analyst
desc:
Site Name: USA - New Jersey - Warren

Posted Date: Oct 24 2019Master Data Analyst

This role is responsible for master data set up and maintenance in the North America Supply and Demand Planning Department, ensuring that end to end new SKU set up and ongoing parameter maintenance is performed timely and accurately in relevant planning systems for both supply and demand planning.

The job holder will be the primary point of contact for all data related queries from both internal and external customers and will have a leading role into driving the importance of data quality and system integrity. The role has a process and system dimension, participating in process improvement capability initiatives and new system implementation.

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following:

Data Management


Collect from key stakeholders, create and Maintain Master data and key parameters in Supply planning and demand forecasting systems in line with systems role profile under the responsibility of Supply and Demand Planning function (e.g. GMM/ECC/SNP APO/APO DP)Review reports on data quality as per monthly standard work (in terms of completeness, Integrity, Accuracy, Consistency). Correct or co-ordinate correction of data and issue resolution as a part of Data Quality Review.Participate and support the NPI process ensuring that all data is entered prior to launch date to maximise customer service levels. Complete any other NPI activities linked to SKU set up as appropriate (e.g. PIR, Source list, SID form, CVC setup)Ensure appropriate life cycle management of SKUsResponsible for UPC Creation, One World Sync and Integration between DCS and CERPS, as applicable to North America




Processes, Failure Free and Improvement


Perform Root Cause Analysis on any issues identified on master data quality and process and drive continuous improvement on process, systems and people capabilityRaise process improvement opportunities, standardise and simplify Ways of working, in collaboration with capability and operational planning teams and key stakeholders (e.g. Customer Service, Sites, other regional planning teams) ensuring a consistent approach to data management.




Systems & Projects support


Participate and support the Master data process development and data verification in the hub, as a result of CERPS / MERPS Implementation.Support system developments (e.g. GMM) by identifying and raising opportunities for process improvementLiaise with the wider business and keep up to date with latest developments that impact Master Data systems and processes and ensure integration of new ways of working in the Supply planning Hub




Documentation


Responsible to keep the Planning Teams SOPs on Master Data up to date 


Why you?Basic Qualifications:We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:

Graduate with a degree in science, IT, engineering or business3+ years of experience in supply chain preferable in a master data maintenance roleGood technical knowledge of the IT systems (GMM, SAP ECC and APO)Good knowledge of master data relevant to supply and demand planning systems and their impact on planning processesExperience on process improvement and system developmentGood analytical skillsGood problem-solving skillsGood process documentation skillsDisciplined in approach to tasks and good attention to detail.Interpersonal skills


Preferred Qualifications:If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:

MBA in science, IT, engineering or business


Why GSK?Our values and expectationsare at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.

These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:

Operating at pace and agile decision-making using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning.Sustaining energy and well-being.Building strong relationships and collaboration, honest and open conversations.Budgeting and cost-consciousness.

If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).

All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Technical Data Analyst
desc: At Crestron Electronics, Inc we build the technology that integrates technology. We are proud to be the largest and most recognized brand in automation and control solutions, and the premier technology partner for fortune 500 businesses globally. Our products’ are integrated into new high-tech commercial buildings’ to include some of the most exciting real estate throughout the world. Our clients include Google, Microsoft, Amazon, LinkedIn and many others. We are the leaders in the most exciting industry in the world! Our automation and control solutions for homes and buildings allow our clients to control entire environments with the push of a button, integrating systems such as Audio Visual, Lighting, Shading, Security, Building Management Systems and HVAC to provide greater comfort, convenience and security.The role of Data Analyst is to support a vast array of continuous improvement projects centered around Crestron’s manufacturing processes. The Data Analyst will maintain and generate all necessary reports and reporting tools while helping to assist in ensuring the data used is recorded accurately. They will use these reports to identify trends, draw conclusions, and then provide clear direction for pursuing corrective action to the various organizations supporting manufacturing. Job Description:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 125 years and today has one of the worlds largest news gathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, Americas largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barrons, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.

The Wall Street Journal is Americas largest newspaper by paid circulation with more than 2.2 million customers. In recent years, the Journal has expanded its core content offering to include coverage of the arts, culture, lifestyle, sports, and personal health, building on its heritage as the leading source of business and financial news. Published by Dow Jones, one of the worlds largest news gathering operations with nearly 2,000 journalists in more than 80 bureaus, The Wall Street Journal now spans 12 editions in nine languages, engaging readers across newspapers, websites, magazines, social media, and video. The Journal holds 35 Pulitzer Prizes for outstanding journalism.

figures

Self-starter

Based in our New York office, this role will be global in nature, servicing domestic and international markets.

title: Senior Healthcare Data Analyst
desc:
The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst directly supports High

Line Health’s employer and Accountable Care Organization client’s needs by

developing and designing complex and customized analytics that support value

based financial contracts, population health management, quality outcomes

focused initiatives and performance targets, and identification of potential

areas for medical cost improvements.

The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst will deliver results to

clients by producing and interpreting custom and routine data analytics and

reporting using membership, claims, provider, prescription drug and quality

data from a variety of health insurance carriers contained with the High Line

Health business intelligence data platform.

Senior Healthcare Data Analyst

Description:

The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst directly supports High Line Health’s employer and Accountable Care Organization client’s needs by developing and designing complex and customized analytics that support value based financial contracts, population health management, quality outcomes focused initiatives and performance targets, and identification of potential areas for medical cost improvements.

The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst will deliver results to clients by producing and interpreting custom and routine data analytics and reporting using membership, claims, provider, prescription drug and quality data from a variety of health insurance carriers contained with the High Line Health business intelligence data platform.

Specific Responsibilities:

· Analyze, understand, interpret and explain sometimes complex medical and pharmacy claims, trends, membership, clinical, quality outcomes and performance, provider network utilization and risk adjusted predictive modeling data in support of client needs

· Complete assigned client analytic projects by evaluating data requirements, designing analytics studies and delivering reports and results to clients and management

· Effectively identify, understand and communicate client analytics and reporting business requirements

· Effectively communicate analytic findings with clients and management

· Support client Analytic Platform training and day to day support needs

· Perform routine monthly client Analytic Platform data quality review and continuous quality improvement initiatives

· Proactively mine client-specific utilization, financial and clinical quality performance data trends to identify opportunities for enhanced analytics, clinical quality improvements and/or cost savings

· Provide recommendations for cost and clinical performance improvement to internal management and clients

· Be a subject matter expert on functionality and content of High Line Health’s Analytics Platform products and tools

· Participate in continuous product improvement initiatives by identifying opportunities to improve client analytics, dashboards and data platforms

Qualifications

Required:

· Bachelor’s degree required in health care related, informatics, statistics or mathematics related disciplines

· Minimum of 5 years of direct experience in health care analytics field

· In-depth knowledge of health insurance based provider billing, medical and pharmacy coding schemes, claims payment process, and claims, clinical, quality and eligibility data characteristics

· Working knowledge of relational database structures, data quality issues and health care and pharmacy payer data elements

· Experience using business intelligence reporting and analytics tools such as Tableau

· Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills

· Strong analytic and problem solving skills

· Intermediate skill using Microsoft Office software such as Excel (including formulas, calculations, charts, graphs, pivot tables, etc.), PowerPoint, Word, Outlook

· Ability to work on and organize multiple tasks and projects simultaneously

· Ability to work independently and effectively in a team

· Ability to successfully time manage and self-direct projects / work load

· Self-motivated, intellectually curious, open learner

· Partial telecommute environment considered

Preferred:

· Master degree in healthcare or informatics

· SQL query design experience and skills

· Primary work location in High Line Health New York City office (Financial District, Manhattan)

EEO Employer

32 Old Slip

New York, New York, 10005

title: Senior Analyst, Claims Data Engineering
desc:
How will this role have an impact?

This individual will be an integral part of developing and improving the Analytics team’s Claims Data Engineering systems. This role will require a strong familiarity with analytical techniques, data programming and claims data engineering experience to help the team implement and maintain claims data engineering systems and bundled payment models that support the needs for all Analytics downstream stakeholders; as well as, when needed, conduct detailed analyses of data from our payor and provider partners. These efforts will play a crucial role in helping us to improve healthcare quality, and ultimately enhance the patient experience, and reduce Medicare spending.

This role will report to our Director of Claims Data Engineering.

What will you do?

Working closely with the Manager of Claims Data Engineering you will:

Maintain and improve currently implemented claims data engineering systems and processes


Implement new bundled payment programs and update current programs where applicable Communicate clearly to a non technical audience about changes that have been made in systems and bundled payment program implementationsProduce ad-hoc data engineering solutions for new business needs that may have a quick turnaround time

As a Claims Data Engineering Senior Analyst you will make individual contributions supporting multiple projects while continuing to enhance your technical skills and work towards learning project leadership.

We are looking for someone with:

B.S. or higher in a quantitative, healthcare or economic discipline1-2 years experience in Python (and Pandas) or R preferred (Python is ideal). Strong experience in other Data languages (e.g., SAS or Stata) will be consideredA Basic understanding of SQL is a plusExperience working with very large, diverse DatasetsExperience using multi processing systems is a plus (e.g Spark, or even simply the Python multiprocessing library)Experience using AWS tools such as S3 is a plusAbility to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiencesPrior experience with Value-Based Payments analytics a plus

Our benefits include but are not limited to:

 Paid Time Off 401(k) Savings Plan with match Medical, Vision & Dental Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Parental Leave Gym Reimbursement  Tuition Reimbursement

About Us

Remedy Partners delivers software and services that enable payers, employers and at-risk providers to organize and finance healthcare delivery around a patient's episode of care. For healthcare providers, Remedy Partners’ software, analytics and administrative services support bundled payment contracts with Medicare and Commercial Insurers, often through shared-risk partnerships. For payers, Remedy Partners empowers the development of bundled payment contracting programs and guides development of bundled payment networks. Remedy Partners presently delivers its services to partners at more than 1,000 healthcare locations nationwide.

title: Senior Reporting & Data Analyst
desc:
Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. Chubb is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally.

The Senior Reporting & Data Analyst is part of the team responsible for Personal Risk Services (PRS) data governance, complex ad hoc reporting or analysis, and management of larger data projects. This position will focus on downstream reporting of data as well as other major PRS data projects. This role will represent PRS business for end to end processing of data.

Primary responsibilities include:


Support PRS in managing and maintaining downstream reporting of data including coverages, risk attributes, premiums and losses
Effectively manage PRS data projects by setting expectations and milestones and by leading cross-functional teams within the project consisting of both business and IT
Support strategic and functional initiatives within the PRS by providing insightful reporting, analysis and subject matter expertise
Responsible for analysis of the data, identify opportunities for continuous improvement and support the decision-making process
Execute special projects that have a wide variety of complexity that impact Chubb’s strategies and results
Collaborate closely with Finance, Product, Actuarial, Statistical and State Compliance, Claims, and owners of downstream systems to design data flows that meet business requirements while conforming to model standards
Ensure resultant metrics follow corporate best practices and champion PRS interests when changes to corporate models are needed
Exhibit organizational skills to effectively manage competing priorities and larger multistage, cross-functional projects that are managed through the Agile process
Design pre-release testing requirements and perform post-launch analysis and testing on projects to clearly demonstrate the accuracy and success of results in order to provide sign-off

Requirements:


Bachelor degree or equivalent business experience in math, actuarial science, or data management 

Strong analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently as well as lead cross-functional teams when necessary
Ability to determine accuracy of data and reasonableness of results and identify and resolve errors
Ability to solve complex issues with and understanding of the implication of those decisions. 

Ability to translate data mappings into actionable requirements
Must be technically savvy and be able to work with technical team/s (data warehouse, reporting, etc.) and business SMEs (corporate finance, etc.) on various data projects
Strong understanding of insurance business operations, coverages, and insurance metrics
Knowledge and proficiency with various reporting tools and technologies i.e. Aginity, SAS, SQL, and Qlik are preferred
Must know how to handle multiple concurrent work streams of business analysis 

Work experience in an Agile environment is a plus


Chubb offers a competitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits package including life, health and dental, vision, a generous retirement savings plan, disability coverage, stock purchase plan, flexible spending accounts, tuition reimbursement, and business casual dress. At Chubb, we are committed to equal employment opportunity and compliance with all laws and regulations pertaining to it. Our policy is to provide employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other conditions or opportunities of employment, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, transgender, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Clinical Data Analyst

How have you impacted someone's life today? At Hackensack Meridian Health our healthcare teams are focused on changing the lives of our patients by providing the highest level of care each and every day. title: Senior Analyst, Enterprise Data Services
desc:
The Mayor s Office of Contract Services (MOCS) oversees and supports the procurement activities of City agencies, with a goal to ensure fairness, transparency, efficiency and cost effectiveness. The Director is the City Chief Procurement Officer. Annually, agencies procure billions in products and services from a diverse pool of vendors that represent various industries. MOCS partners with industry groups to implement policies and tools that streamline and modernize procurement, resulting in the delivery of quality services to New Yorkers. Team members operate in a fast-paced, collaborative, service-oriented environment, where flexibility and ability to achieve results are valued.

The incumbent will report to the Assistant Director of Enterprise Data Services at MOCS and with wide latitude for independent judgment will perform the following job responsibilities, which include and are not limited to:

Configure and develop SaaS products (PASSPort and IBM Cognos) to align with project specifications and documentation. Will include work to build out workflows, UI enhancements, etc. in PASSPort as well as dashboards, storyboards and reports in Cognos.Develop reports and dashboards around procurement and contracting in the City.Create efficiencies in automating reporting and analysis tasksDevelop and maintain documentation around releases (both project and maintenance).Proactively communicate with management around progress of tasks and risks.Collaborate with representatives from change management, business and integrations teams to represent the capabilities of the SaaS tools and provide input around solutions.Contribute to the presentations for management, stakeholders and executives around projects.Provide perspective and analysis of capabilities and functionality of SaaS tools he/she will be working in. He/she should have the technical knowledge to provide guidance on the feasibility and LOE of requests. Be willing to learn the business of MOCS procurement and contracting and provide ad hoc analysis as requested.

Minimum Qualification Requirements:

Graduation from an accredited college with a baccalaureate degree; orGraduation from an accredited community college plus two years of experience with administrative, analytic, coordinative, supervisory or liaison responsibilities; orA four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent plus four years of experience as described in 2 above; orA satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience.

Preferred Skills:

A master's degree from an accredited college in economics, business or public administration, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, sociology, political science, mathematics, public policy, computer science or a closely related field; with at least one (1) years of related work experience preferred but not required, orA baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and demonstrated equivalent expertise in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization, with at least three (3) years of related work experience.Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills; experience with empirical methods and data analytics including working with large, complex micro - data sets, building applied statistics or econometrics models, and/or conducting research.Strong knowledge of and experience with SQL and programming and markup languages (XML, javascript, python etc.) required.Experience working in configurable SaaS products strongly preferred.Demonstrated experience with IBM Cognos strongly preferred; familiarity with other BI tools such as PowerBI or Tableau valuable.Familiarity with data models, database design, ETL development, data mining and segmentation techniques desired.Demonstrated ability to produce and edit documentation: e.g. Report Design Documents, mockups and prototypes etc.Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amount of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to take initiative, prioritize duties, problem solve, work independently and within a team environment, pay close attention to detail, meet deadlines, do appropriate follow-up, work well under pressure and maintain an enthusiastic work ethic. This includes maintaining a positive and helpful attitude and a proven capacity in project management skills, including organizing and strategic planning.Excellent written and oral communication skills. Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings for business audience. Communicates effectively to non-technical teams and thrives in a dynamic environment.Proficiency in SQL Server, MS Excel (Pivot, Advanced functions: INDEX/MATCH, VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, etc.), MS Access, MS Project, Visio and other products in MS Suite.Critical and proactive thinker willing to work in dynamic environment strongly considered.

Residency Requirement:

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Additional Information:

Mayor s Office of Contract Services is an equal opportunity employer.

Special accommodations provided for applicants with disabilities.

Mayor s Office of Contract Services recognizes the unique skills and strengths gained through military service. Veterans and service members of the U.S. Armed Forces are strongly encouraged to apply.

STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS PROGRAM

As an employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for loan forgiveness should you meet the program s eligibility requirements. For additional information on the PSLFP, please visit .

Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we’ve been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.

Acacia Network is searching for a Data Quality Analyst (DQA) that will have an understanding of clinical quality measures.

Responsibilities consist of but not limited to:

Enter and manage all data related to our HIV Care Coordination Program
Ensure the quality and accuracy of data, the process, design and present it in QI meetings
Maintain all data organized and error proof for CQM and other quality measures


Education/ License:

Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or college in computer science or related field required


Qualifications:

3+ years’ work experience as a data analyst or in a related field and experience working with quality measures preferred
Ability to deal with sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion
Strong organization sills
Commitment to cultural diversity and sensitivity
Knowledgeable of Microsoft Office, Nextgen, and PHS systems, etc.
Ability to maintain a professional demeanor under pressure and operate with a keen sense of urgency and commitment to quality
Ability to organize and maintain detailed records; complete necessary paperwork and meet deadlines
Bilingual is a plus

We offer to the chosen candidate a generous compensation package!

title: Data Governance Analyst
desc:
Come Build Your Career Under OUR Roof

Job Description:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

The MDM team is responsible for governing the information of product/item, customer and vendor domains within multiple ERPs including GAF, SGI, and Siplast.

We are seeking an analyst to manage the Customer, Product/Item, and Vendor, domains with the expectation of becoming an SME for those areas. They will be responsible for knowing and understanding the data rules and policies for compliance. Mainly responsible for reviewing all of the above domain requests submitted by the business and following up with business users in the workflow to expedite creation. This will include new Customer, Product/Item, and Vendor (manual and using scripts), modification, and hierarchy management. The selected individual will also be responsible via cross training for Vendor setup/modification and ACH activities as well as account creation and modification.

This role is responsible for ensuring minimal operational interruptions due to master data within the multiple ERPs. The person in this role develops relationships with business users that are impacted when changes are made including Pricing, Sourcing, Logistics, IT, Procurement and Billing. Must have knowledge of analytical tools to find inconsistencies in data and developing plans to resolve them. The incumbent will work closely with the Sr Analyst on special projects which involve data cleanup and documentation.

40 % Responsible for managing the new customer, vendor and item change request workflows

30% Ad-hoc projects assigned by Sr Analysts including data cleanup and policy definition.

20%



Issue resolution and data profiling
Monitor exception reports and follow up with business as needed. Act as backup for all domains.


10% Perform other duties as assigned.

Level Based Competencies are to be designated based on job level and content.



Adaptability
Building Strategic Working Relationships
Technical/Professional Knowledge & Skills
Decision Making
Communication


Technical knowledge/skills



Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of product/item master and hierarchies
Intermediate to Advanced Excel
Intermediate knowledge of PeopleSoft, PeopleSoft Query Tool, SQL


General knowledge/skills



3-5 years experience
Excellent interpersonal skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously


Education/Experience



Bachelor Degree
Experience in manufacturing, especially roofing, is preferred


We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. title: Senior Analyst, Research DATA SCIENCES
desc:
Job Description

As the Senior Analyst, Research you will be an integral part of our cross-platform research efforts for Publicis Media, supporting all affiliated clients and agency brands. You will work across research disciplines to deliver strategic and actionable analysis for a diverse set of stakeholders. Based in our New York office, this role will be global in nature, servicing domestic and international markets.

Your core responsibilities:



Collaborate with senior team members and other groups within the organization to address emerging trends in media and aid in the evaluation of new media channels
Develop and maintain relevant reports around platform adoption, viewership and consumption through syndicated and proprietary tools
Build and maintain deep relationships with agency partners and collaborate with them in designing/testing/analyzing quantitative research studies
Prepare customized client presentations, evaluating and presenting insights on the current media landscape, emerging trends, and media/product usage metrics
Develop and write topical POVs (Points of View) to address the agency's position on media and client-related issues.
Become an expert in go-to media tools and a resource for cross-agency client teams

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
Who We Are

At Cross River, we’re building the best banking and technology products for fintechs, all through APIs. As venture-backed pioneers of the platform-based financial services model known as the sponsor, or partner, bank, we work closely with our partners to offer products such as payments rails and loan origination services to the latest in regulatory and compliance solutions. What drives us every day? A desire to innovate in the service of financial inclusion. Giving access to consumers, whether they are looking for credit or for a better way to pay has been in our DNA from day one. Our nimble, adaptive, one-step ahead culture is powered by our people, and as a result of their creativity, tech-forward thinking and collaborative spirit, we are experiencing explosive growth.

What we’re looking for

Cross River’s Data Science team is made up of problem solvers hungry to perfect new products and systems. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role. At Cross River, our Data team has an open and transparent environment around process, architecture and development, and everyone’s work is impactful. From building our data platform deploying new systems or supporting it all, we work together in a cohesive and nimble team that gets things done.

In this role you will report directly to the Director of Data, Analytics and Data Science. You will focus on being the bridge between the Data team and Operations team to ensure data consistency and accuracy.

Responsibilities:

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports Monitor data collection systems to ensure accuracy and efficiency Maintain ETL jobs as well as create new ones as the need arises Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Locate and define new process improvement opportunities 

Qualifications:

Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (SSRS, SSIS, Tableau, Domo), databases (SQL server, Oracle) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Bachelor’s Degree inMathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics or related field 3+ years experience with SQL server Experience in a banking organization is preferred. 

Cross River is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Cross River does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Lead Marketing Data Analyst
desc:
The Client Analytics Services Department connects patient health data to generate actionable insights. We measure the effectiveness of marketing tactics both on sales and on patients' health choices in order to help our clients reach consumers and patients most in need of their products.

What You'll Do


Use cutting-edge technology, analytics capabilities, and connected data to drive client success
Interact with health data from 300 million US households in a privacy-centric environment
Develop sophisticated data visualizations to uncover storylines and themes from analysis
Collaborate with senior team members to make actionable recommendations to healthcare clients for how to optimize their marketing tactics
Work directly with major players in the healthcare marketing business, including healthcare providers, media agencies, and digital and broadcast media publishers
Contribute to ongoing process re-engineering efforts
Be the first line of technical support and mentorship to junior analysts

What You've Done


1-3 years of relevant experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with and/or academic background in marketing analytical methodologies (i.e., segmentation, predictive response models, etc.) and/or other quantitative analytics
Experience in a marketing analytics and/or strategic analytics role; experience in online media industry at an agency a plus
Handled multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with the ability to learn and apply new concepts and tools quickly
MS Office fluency, especially MS Excel; experience with VBA/Excel Macros, SQL, SAS, R or other data manipulation tools a plus
Bachelor's' degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics or Marketing. Masters' degree or equivalent experience a plus


About the Team – Crossix provides a collaborative work environment, with a supportive culture to help you achieve your professional goals, while making a meaningful impact on the Company's future success. Our work enables healthcare marketers to plan, measure, and optimize their marketing campaigns with confidence. Using our own proprietary technology and network of health and non-health data, Crossix pinpoints the tactics, programs, and channels that improve performance and boost sales, enabling better healthcare communications. And we do it all while protecting consumer privacy.

Leadership – With decades of combined experience and an unrivaled track record of healthcare innovation, our leadership team sets the standard for us. Because we work in an emerging market, the leadership team fosters an environment where everyone can contribute and make a real difference to push the company and industry forward.

Culture – Our employees set us apart. Along with competitive salaries and benefits, we invest in creating compelling opportunities for professional development and career growth. We know that diverse teams create better ideas, which is why we foster an inclusive environment where employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, leverage their strengths, and be their authentic selves at work.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, ancestry, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or veteran status.

Princeton, NJ

The Bloomberg Law (BLAW) division of Global Data supports best-in-class tools, search and analytics for products in the areas of Law, Government and Tax. title: Senior Data Management Analyst
desc:
Senior Data Management Analyst

Look for more than answers. Patients and Physicians rely on our diagnostic testing, information and services to help them make better healthcare decisions. These are often serious decisions with far reaching consequences, and require sensitivity, tact and a clear dedication to service. It’s about providing clarity and hope.

You will work for the world leader in the industry, with a career where you can expand your skills and knowledge. You’ll have a role where you can act with professionalism, you can inspire colleagues, and you can care about the work we do and the people we serve.

At Quest, we are on a continuous journey of discovery and development. It’s this attitude that has made us an industry leader and the #1 Diagnostic Lab in the US. For those joining us, we offer exciting and fast moving career opportunities where you can affect change at a rate unheard of in many organizations of our size and scope. While we invest in and develop technology to drive our innovations, our ongoing success relies on our people.

The Senior Data Management Analyst position is responsible for updating

and maintaining the laboratory testing database, and writing SAS programs to collect,

analyze and report insights critical to the Employer Solutions drug testing

business. Primary tools used are SAS, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Access. This

role will work closely with various functions in the business including the

analytics, marketing, sales, account management, and finance teams. As the

Employer Solutions business works to ensure greater quality control, data

integrity, consistency and speed in reporting, succession plans for key

resources, and capabilities for the analysis and interpretation of information,

we have identified the need for a dedicated resource to work on a variety of

critical data analysis tasks. The candidate must be able to quickly gain a deep

working knowledge of our systems and data, they must be data and detail-driven,

able to work both independently and under direction, and must also be able to

successfully prioritize their efforts to meet tight deadlines. This position

offers a challenging work environment that will stretch and develop analytical,

research, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Update and maintain laboratory testing database as needs for modifications and additions arise

Write and modify SAS programs to accurately pull and report data and metrics

Grow to understand laboratory and business operations deeply to accurately modify laboratory testing database and create meaningful, actionable reports

Take on and prioritize the execution of new projects. These projects will vary in length, scope, complexity, priority, audience, and input

Demonstrate ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects and to produce required deliverables by the established deadlines and with the appropriate level of detail, accuracy, and quality control

Ability to communicate effectively

Strong, consistent attention to detail is critical

Ability to identify and investigate patterns and irregularities in data

Must be inquisitive, able and willing to ask clarifying questions

Partner with key inputs to ensure that outputs are accurate, appropriate to the audience, and well-delivered

Consistently work to ensure accuracy of the data by conducting monthly verifications and other research as needed

Promote a positive work environment and collaborate with cross-functional team members to support the business

Willingness and ability to learn new things and cross-train while managing several projects and inputs simultaneously

Supervision Exercised:

N/A

Qualifications:

Education Required:

Bachelor’s degree in business, analytics, information technology, information systems, computer programming, or a related field is preferred

Work Experience:

Work experience or coursework in SAS programming is

preferred, but experience with other programming language(s) and a willingness

to learn SAS will be considered

Physical and Mental:

Able to sit or stand for long periods

Other:

Understanding of relational databases; SQL experience is valuable

Demonstrated knowledge in utilizing the Microsoft Office suite of products

Laboratory experience is a plus

Strong willingness to learn and understand our current data to improve the insights we use to better our business

Excellent analytical, time management, and organizational skills. Must be able to prioritize multiple simultaneous projects, while ensuring that deadlines are met

As a member of the data team, the expectation is that the candidate will have strong written and verbal communication skills, the ability to creatively solve complex problems, excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills, and strong attention to detail

A self-directed, self-motivated, detail and deadline-oriented individual will excel in this role.

Occasional travel – up to 10% - may be required at times

All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity or Citizenship

title: Data Manager (Health Program Analyst)
desc:
Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey is seeking a motivated Data Manager for the department of Medicine-Infectious Diseases within the New Jersey Medical School. Under the direction of the Data Coordinating Center (DCC) Director, the Data Manager is responsible for off-site study coordination and data management oversight of protocols positioned at international sites. The Data Manager will provide study coordination of specific protocols, and will develop case report forms consistent with clinical protocols and investigator input. The Data Manager sets up SOPs for data collection sites to provide data capture, and performs quality assurance audits to validate data in preparation for analysis by biostatisticians.

Among the key duties of this position are the following:



Works with investigators and Data Coordinating Center staff to develop REDCap case reportforms (CRFs) consistent with the approved protocol to capture clinical and laboratory data.
Facilitates, coordinates orientation and trains volunteer/staff on instruments administration, datagathering software and data collection.
Maintains and manages research databases using Access and SAS software. Works withstatisticians in creating the appropriate databases from collected data for analyses.
Monitors data quality per standard operating procedures for each protocol. Coordinate QA/QC with international on-site staff and Rutgers Study Coordinators.
Summarizes and analyzes data.
Assists in composing progress reports.
Presents progress reports.
Completes all documentation and paperwork in a timely and efficient manner.SDL2017

title: Data Governance Analysts
desc:
Knowledgent Description Knowledgent is a data intelligence company that enables enterprises to become digital and intelligent by innovating in and through data. We combine our data and analytics expertise with business specific domain knowledge. We are Informationists that are passionate about data.

With offices in New York City, Boston, Toronto, and Warren, NJ, Knowledgent works with organizations in the Life Sciences, Healthcare, Financial Services, Products, and Services industries.

Knowledgent was recently recognized in Gartner's "Market Guide for MDM External Service Providers" for 2017, named a "Top 50 Innovative Company to Watch" by Silicon Review Magazine, and awarded the "2017 Excellence in Social & Community Investment Award" by Consulting Magazine. A business value and use case-driven approach to data governance that leads to adoption of scalable, beneficial, best practices.

 Excellent communication skills in order to interact with stakeholders
