Must have excellent time management and organizational skills
Thrive in a complex, dynamic environment while adapting to dynamically changing priorities
Subject matter expertise as it relates to PII (Personable Identifiable Information), PHI (Personal Health Information), HIPAA, Safe Harbor, and other global regulatory requirements, preferred

title: CIB Digital & Platform Services Resolution & Recovery - Sr. Data/Business Analyst
desc:
About J.P. Morgan Corporate & Investment Bank

J.P. Morgans Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The worlds most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

Recognizing the need to strengthen management and coordination of regulatory initiatives across the firm, the CIB D&PS Resolution & Recovery team was established. This team is responsible for providing interpretative guidance and expertise relating to global regulatory commitments and planning. Originally mandated as part of Dodd-Frank, Recovery & Resolution (a.k.a. Living Wills) requires bank holding companies to describe the companys strategy for rapid & orderly recovery and resolution in the event of a material financial distress or failure. Since the initiation of the regulation in the US regulators globally have adapted similar regulations.

Scope of the team is based around supporting established regulatory initiatives; establishing technology solutions and operating models to effectively drive responses to emerging regulatory requirements; and maintaining effective global and regional governance structures.

The Role:

Role within the CIB Digital& Platform Services Resolution & Recovery team will require understanding of the end-to-end business model at sub-Line of Business level, knowledge of the functional groups involved with supporting delivery and the key stakeholders associated with regulatory requirements. Candidates should be able to demonstrate leadership and strong analytical skills. Candidates should demonstrate the ability to work independently, as well as contributing more broadly across the global team, helping to support the vision and agenda for the team as a whole.

Scope of Responsibility:

Role will have responsibility to support the lead BA in driving requirements gathering and ensuring execution delivery of requirements in a strategic technology solution (RAPIDS) which will support regulatory commitments and implementation of the operating models required to support in an on-going evolution of requirements and completion of future deliverables.

R&R Appendix Automation Program and the system RAPIDS is a large scale technology transformation program to support Recovery & Resolution submissions and regulatory inquiries globally.

Scope of requirements will be based on externally defined regulations, evolving as they move through consultation, technical standards and into implementation. They will be part of a global team, with emphasis on various regional requirements, driven by each location.

This role will provide high profile visibility across the CIB Digital & Platform Services and Firmwide Resolution & Recovery PMO organizations, with broad cross-functional and cross-LoB involvement, and the opportunity for extensive exposure to senior management.

Required Skills and Preferred Experience:

Requirements:


Excellent analytical and logical thinking to understand and analyze complex business processes, identifying risks and defining possible solutions
The candidate should demonstrate ability to develop relationships across all levels of an organization and work on project teams and multiple work streams in a changing environment.
Ensure project initiatives meet desired business results
Conduct assessments of current state processes, systems and controls and document analyses in process maps and gap assessments
Participate in strategy discussions to define future state operating models
Conduct research to determine if solutions to business needs currently exist within the firm, and/or within the market
Author business requirements documents, monitor system development activities and document user acceptance testing plans and scripts for technology implementations
Contribute expertise to designing processes and implementing innovative business solutions
Liaise with technology partners to ensure implementation is consistent with business requirements by leading UAT planning, test case documentation and defect tracking
Responsible for driving business and corporate initiatives from concept to delivery, ensuring execution of business requirements, training, procedures, workflow redesigns and implementation schedules




Develop, review, and execute test plans and scripts
Willingness to work in a location flexible/dynamic environment
Ability to consistently deliver results with little direct supervision and knows when to seek assistance or escalate; strong sense of ownership and accountability for work




A minimum of 2 years working in a corporate environment preferably at a financial institution
Experience at an investment bank; working knowledge of Equity and Fixed Income products and trade flow required
Experience working with/in Technology, Compliance, Risk or Control functions
1+ years experience in Project Management
Intermediate knowledge of agile development
Bachelor degree required
Solid analytical skills and writing skills, to include solid experience in writing specification
Solid understanding of project management methodologies and tools
Independent and self-motivated
Strong interpersonal, communication, negotiation, and leadership skills
Ability to handle multiple tasks and to work independently; agility in a fast-paced environment
Excellent presentation, formula compilation and data analytics skills
Proven ability to collaborate and build strong partnerships with technology and operations as well as across regions and lines of business
Proven results and experience with achieving goals, developing and implementing new strategies
Excellent analytical skills and ability to think strategically about global solutions
Keen attention to detail
Ability to clearly articulate issues during analysis, build, testing and post implementation phases, including ability to liaise with senior management and communicate at an appropriate level
Strong sense of ownership and accountability for work
Strong knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Tableau and SharePoint is required

title: Senior Data Analyst - Air
desc: ABOUT HOPPERAt Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app -- one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015. Take off with us!Hopper was built on the premise that the combination of big data and machine learning could make a difference. At Hopper, every dataset tells a story. Do you have what it takes to decipher the clues? bit.ly/2q6U8dqWe’re looking for a data-savvy individual to join our Data Science team as a Data Analyst. They will help create consumer-focused research, as well as a user-centric product development and growth based on our real-time along with an archive of several trillion data points. If you are interested in this topic, you may be interested in the subject of data gathering and finding effective ways to simplify and communicate to a non-technical audience.IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:Lead analytical projects to support our Product and Growth teams. Deliver quantitative results, business understanding and strategic insights to help make better data-driven decisions.Support our PR team by transforming complex information analyzes into short, compelling, and easy to understand studies.Design and implement ad hoc and automated analysis scripts, develop and deliver your tables, charts and interactive tools to present your results.Work with key stakeholders across a fast-paced, collaborative environment.A QUALIFIED CANDIDATE HAS:A degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative disciplineStrong analytical and creative problem-solving skillsProven ability to communicate complex technical work to a non-technical audienceEnthusiasm and curiosity for conducting research and answering hard questions with dataExposure to scripting with Pandas, R, SAS or other data preparation and analysis toolsExperience with relational databases and SQL would be an assetBENEFITS• Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options• Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business• 100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans• Access to a 401k (Boston) or Retirement Savings Plan (Montreal)• Easy commute with a paid-for public transportation or parking pass• IATA Travel Agent Card for discounts in the travel industry• Fully stocked kitchen with: coffee/tea, beer, bagels and snacks (both healthy and not-healthy)• Team lunches, offsite activities and much more!

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
The ChallengeWe work with thousands of partners, hundreds of thousands of paying customers, millions of resumes, and billions of data points. We're profitable and have scaled fast on our current architecture, but need someone smart to read between the lines and use data to take us to 10x and beyond.The RoleWe have a rapidly growing cloud-based infrastructure, and you'll work closely and liaise with all departments: Engineering, Marketing, Business Development, Ops, and Finance, and most importantly, Product. You'll be a part of the Product team because we want you to help dictate what and how we should be building. It'll be a critical role on a critical team. We're looking for someone who thrives on looking at multiple disparate sets of data and diving in to tell us something we don't know. You should want to tell us what would help the business, and spec out resources and requirements to do so. You will be encouraged to "hack" a lot of one-off reports and visualizations. We expect a great candidate to have a lot of upward mobility in our burgeoning business intelligence unit.Skills & Requirements


You have a passionate relationship with big data and/or data mining.You have data manipulation skills and the ability to navigate relational databases via SQL, NoSQL architectures, and flat log files alike.You have expert knowledge of data presentation and visualization and experience in one or more of Excel, Tableau, Periscope Data, Looker, D3, Highcharts, or other data viz platforms.Your "tool of choice" is actually a hybrid of tools, anything from R to command line scripting to something analog and offline. You're interested in what have data achieves.You're authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.


You, If We're Lucky


You have an advanced degree in a quantitative field.You're conflicted about wanting to be a Product Manager or a Data Engineer.You have exposure to scripting or MVC languages in a team environment.We're a team full of tech polyglots and that excites you instead of terrifying you.You've scaled something weird and strange before.You've had quant and data analysts as direct reports.You have a great one-week-of-work-saved-my-company-millions story.You have startup experience!


What Makes Us Different


We operate with the agility of a startup, but have the stability of a well-established organizationWe value work-life balanceWe offer competitive pay + optionsEmployees can pick the computer setup of their choosing. Whatever helps you work better, it's yours

At Talent, Inc. we believe culture and thought diversity lead to better teams and stronger companies. We seek talented, qualified employees regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Talent, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Come join our team. Together we'll help others tell their career stories and land their dream jobs.

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
Purolator International is a leading U.S. based supply chain logistics solutions provider specializing in the air and ground forwarding of express, freight and parcel shipments, customs brokerage, and fulfillment and delivery services to, from and within North America. We are a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., a leading integrated freight, package and logistics solutions provider in Canada.

Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. Honored as a “Great Supply Chain Partner” by SupplyChainBrain Magazine and named to Supply & Demand Chain Executive “100 Great Supply Chain Projects,” Purolator International is rapidly expanding throughout the United States and seeking talented individuals to join our team.

Purolator International depends on our communities for public and business services that are critical to our success. We strive to always give back to the communities we belong to. A key component of the Purolator International’s culture is making valuable and charitable contributions as a company, regionally and as individuals.

Job Summary:

The Data Analyst collects, tracks, analyses and disseminates information that provides support to a variety of stakeholders i.e. corporate, sales representatives etc. This position will be supporting the Sales Effectiveness reporting, client analysis and reporting and other functions.

The role of the Analyst has become increasingly important as Purolator International accumulates rapidly growing collections of sensitive enterprise data, information that must be used across all sectors of the corporate environment. The incumbent will interact with managers and employees across all segments of the company’s operations. This is essential to determine the sometimes conflicting needs of various departments and to develop a data management strategy that works for everyone

Benefits:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription Drugs (80%+ paid by Employer)401k with up to 6% Employer Company MatchEmployer Funded Life InsuranceAnnual Bonus Incentive PlanDisability/Income ProtectionTuition AssistanceEmployer Funded Health Savings Account (H.S.A)Paid Time Off (Total of 29 days)

Responsibilities:

Ops Finance

Focus on determining Purolator International’s organizational data warehouse content, defining common definitions, assuring data quality and managing appropriate access especially with customer reporting.Responsible for ensuring data consistency and integrity throughout the company's databasesIdentify the needs of the business and its users, as well as determining the extent of database access.Coordinate and collaborate with the third party application companies to provide needed enhancements and updates to improve sales effectivenessPerforms a variety of ratings analysis using built models. Makes logical decisions on how to present findings that would best suit sales representatives and sales managers; gains a solid understanding of sales reps. requests in order to provide accurate and useful information.Performs shipping profile analysis and provide accurate measurements of client/potential client volumes per lane, per weight bracket, product mix etc.Supports internal corporate requests i.e. client profitability analysis, variances for branches; collect and consolidate the information required to support branch and/or corporate decision-making.Assists with the yearly budget planning process by uploading templates and verifying data accuracy to avoid potential errors in the planning process.Contributes to the innovation and customization of current financial models.

Decision Support

Follows logical steps when analyzing any data set and identify missing data points that are critical to providing accurate information.Works with a large variety of stakeholders i.e. sales teams, corporate clients; monitor and track all incoming request for the purposes of developing standardized reports.Compiles shipping profiles with respect to contracts, line haul examinations and CARR reviews.Assists with re-alignment requests and the re-alignment processes i.e. account coding.Supports the automation of tasks using VBA or SQL.

Sales Support

Provide reporting, analysis and trending on all of our sales performance including but not limited to sales activity, sales management activity, pipeline growth, pipeline conversion, lead management, weekly trader performance, and channel and customer growth metrics.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or college diploma in finance, economics, accounting, or related field with an inclination towards quantitative studies (math or statistics)3+ years’ on-the-job related experienceProficient in MS ExcelHighly proficient in SQLHighly proficient in SalesForce.comPython, VBA, Alteryx, Tableau are a plus

What are we looking for?

Detail-oriented, self-motivated, tolerant of stress, dependable and analytical. The ability to think critically and solve multifaceted problems.Use reasoning skills to solve these problems within organizational time and cost constraints. Able to prioritize workloadExcellent communication skills (written & verbal) and demonstrated ability to work with all levels of an organizationThe ability to work well with others, objectively, creatively, diplomatically, with excellent communication skillsWork well with network administrators/technicians in determining their security measures and policiesStrong team orientation, with a proven record of building team relationships with staff, clients and other stakeholdersStrong personal motivation and enthusiasm, interest in and commitment to making a difference in the organizationExcellent technical writing skillsHighly organized and detail oriented

Indeed Hire and Purolator International are working together to find the best candidate for this job.

By applying, you agree to be contacted by our agent, Indeed Hire, and receive updates via text and phone about your application.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $90,000.00 to $95,000.00 /year

Experience:

Data Analyst: 3 years (Required)Excel: 3 years (Required)SQL: 3 years (Required)

Work authorization:

United States (Required)

title: Sr HR Data & Reporting Analyst
desc:
SR HR Data & Reporting Analyst

At a Glance

A Sr HR Data & Reporting Analyst who has experience in both data collection and analysis, and managing projects related to various aspects of HR (compensation, performance management, talent acquisition, etc.)



You have experience managing large to small scale projects from beginning to end.
You have been involved in HR Analytics/ Projects through data collection, analysis, distribution, making recommendations to the business as it relates to HR operations, and implementing process improvements.
You have experience utilizing Excel to answer questions for the business, perform audits on different datasets, and identify anomalies found within the data to share with the HR Business Partners.


Who are you?



The Sr HR Data and Reporting Analyst will be able to think critically and make suggestions for process improvements, presenting and tracking data, etc.
Demonstrate a consultative and client-oriented approach to HR data analysis and interpretation to be able to tell a story.
Strong PowerPoint and reporting skills to be able to define story context.
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Has experience managing HR projects from begging to the end.
Produce ad hoc reports to answer business questions quickly and thoroughly.
Investigate and perform root cause analysis.
The Sr HR Data and Reporting Analyst will define, document, implement and track process flows for processes, procedures, and policies for the department.
Interact with internal teams to ensure systems/tools are in accordance with business processes and rules; adjust systems/documentation accordingly.
Perform a cross-functional role to facilitate business process changes with stakeholders in other departments; work with stakeholders to support the integration of new processes, into existing operations.
The Sr HR Data and Reporting Analyst will audit and recommend updates to existing methods, procedures and process documentation on an as needed basis.
Participate in process requirements, planning and validation through operational testing to ensure plan changes meet business sponsor needs.
Manage the process review and sign-off of new methods and procedures.
Support testing and roll out of all projects/process improvements that impact the department.
Understand policies, procedures and practices for analysis of business performance and impact.
The Sr HR Data and Reporting Analyst will identify trends and occurrences in data and translate findings into various mediums including text, charts, graphs, displays and tables.
Perform other duties as requested by management.


What does it take?

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge



Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Maintain working knowledge of all HR areas (i.e., Talent Acquisition, Training, Compensation)
Knowledge of HR database/reporting systems
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Ability to self-train and pick up new skills quickly
Advanced skills using PC software applications (Access, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to create and maintain spreadsheets
Commitment to quality service through appropriate follow through, urgency and persistence
Strong analytical skills and the ability to present information in an understandable format
Ability to effectively consult with department managers and leaders
Strong attention to detail and ability to problem solve
Ability to prioritize and organize effectively
Knowledge of local, state and federal laws regarding employment
Working knowledge of HRMS database systems


Education

Bachelor's degree in Business or related field or equivalent experience

Related Work Experience

5+ years of Business Analyst/Data Analyst experience

2+ years of HRIS and Applicant Tracking System experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Related Work Experience

1+ years of experience with PeopleSoft and BrassRing

1+ years of experience with data collection and database design experience

1+ years of experience in managing HR related projects

WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment

title: Sr. Data and Reporting Analyst
desc:
JOB SUMMARY 

This position leads development and analysis of new Credit Services strategies, partnering with Credit Services subject matter experts, as well as operations partners to create new approaches and improve risk mitigation performance. The successful candidate will be responsible for generating the quantitative analysis necessary for data-driven business recommendations.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Create conceptual frameworks enabling the analysis of varied business problems

Gather business requirements. This individual will need to be able to quickly assimilate and organze large amounts of new information and produce professional products (using Microsfot Office tools)

Develop/select methodologies to derive answers to business problems.

Design and implement tests to determine strategy effectiveness, and analyze the results to develop recommendations on future strategy.

Use statistical techniques to build various predictive/explanatory models for such initiatives as: acquisition/risk management, customer retention, timeline events, and customer segmentation

Analyze data to provide meaningful insights. This individual must have strong data manipulation and interpretation skills, and be able to quantitatively assess business problems.

Create and maintain dashboards to periodically report on key risks and performance metrics

Professional present and articulate the business value of complicated analysis to a diverse group of stakeholders

Create presentations to help illustrate data in ways that are appropriate and easy for stakeholders to understand.

Clearly communicate analysis and complex concepts to non-subject matter experts orally and in writing.

Conduct interactions with a high degree of professionalism, using an interpersonal communication style that promotes progress through teamwork in a collaborative manner.

Provide leadership as a mentor to team analysts and cross-functional resources.

Perform other duties as may be requested by manager

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Skills / Abilities and Knowledge

Advance skills in Excel, PowerPoint and AccessExcellent quantitative analysis skillsDetail oriented, self-motivated, proactive and results drivenKnowledge of ICOMS Billing SystemCustomer behavior modeling and scoring, especially in payment services or collectionsData visualization such as Micro Strategy and/or TableauKnowledge of basic ETL concepts and systems (SSIS, Informatica)Ability to create conceptual frameworks enabling the analysis of varied business problemsExcellent communication skills, both written and verbalAbility to plan, prioritize and organize effectivelyAbility to use personal computer and software applications (i.e. word processing, spreadsheet, Cable billing system, etc)Ability to research and analyze data as well as understand and document results, including the use of trend analysisKnowledge of database or data analysis skills in the Telecommunications or related industryRapid data discovery and prototyping skillsIdentify possible exceptions based on key risk factorsAbility to adapt to changeKnowledge of all functions and related tasks in the area of customer relationsKnowledge of cable television products and servicesKnowledge of general accounting and billing procedures

Education

Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Information Systems, Computer Science or Engineering, paired with work experience.

Related Work Experience

5+ years - Analytical and Reporting experience 5+ years - Experience with SAS, SAS Macro, SAS Stat, Python or other analysis software5+ years - Data analytical skills using SQL, T-SQL, or PL/SQL (SQL Server or Oracle), NoSQL, Hadoop 5+ years - Writing queries using SQL language

WORKING CONDITIONS 

Office Environment

desc:
Independently analyzes, reconciles, troubleshoots and reviews incoming and outgoing data/files/reports to ensure accurate performance/output generated by technology solutions and services.

Serves as a mentor or project lead, allocating work to and reviewing the work quality of others.

Interfaces with clients internally and externally to discuss project status, data issues and remediation recommendations. Analyzes and monitors files/data/reports to ensure quality of and accurate transfer, integration, translation, and reporting of data, reacting promptly to data quality metrics and client inquiries.

Based on experiential analysis, execute complex data fixes, resulting in improved performance or accuracy. Contributes to the development of the standard operating procedures for the function.

Interacts with data management and client support teams to identify trending issues and document root cause. Performs data mining and analysis to determine impact assessment.

Employs a proven method for gathering data and model/articulate the proposed solution to complex business problems. Identifies, creates and proposes solutions for complex, large scale data issues which requires in-depth analysis and custom data manipulations to resolve.

Interfaces with clients internally and externally to discuss project status, data issues and remediation recommendations.

No direct reports; provide guidance to less experienced colleagues as needed. Often serves as project lead, allocating work to and monitoring the work quality of others.

Typically requires 7-10 years of total work experience, preferably in securities or financial services. 'Uses SQL for data mining purposes to troubleshoot data conditions in relational databases. title: Senior Financial Data & Business System Analyst
desc:
The Senior Financial Data & Business System Analyst reporting to the Controller with dotted line to Associate Director of Budget oversees the development and delivery of Adaptive budgeting tool, and business intelligence solutions, reporting and data analytics.

The Senior Analyst is responsible for maintaining and improving operational reports (budget requests, dashboards and ad hoc reporting requests) and analytics that inform users on institutional and departmental results. The Senior Analyst will work closely with Institutional Research and IT teams to increase automation and improve reporting. The Senior Analyst is also responsible to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the various other reporting deliverables.

Job Duties:



	Monitor the budget planning process from the start to final budget implementation.
Analyzes business and technical information and provides analytical support to business decisions making.
Collaborates with internal customers to understand business needs and opportunities.
Provides intermediate to complex analysis, supporting the planning and implementation of systems and upgrades, and process changes.
Assist in monitoring department budget requests and produce various ad-hoc reports to help identify budgetary trends and to calculate various projections.
Manage budgeting system tool (Adaptive Planning) including system design, deployment, data integration with legacy systems and providing continuous improvement efforts for enhancements.
Utilize data from variety of sources to develop reusable reports to transform operation data into actionable business intelligence and to assist management in accessing data for content and meaning.
Assist with planning and evaluation of financial information systems including defining Institute specific requirements and accessing their compatibility with daily accounting and budgeting processes.
Maintain user access and controls in Adaptive budgeting and business intelligence tools. 

Manage financial reporting in Business Objects including existing reports maintenance, enhancements and new report development.
Development and deployment of various monthly reports to identify misclassified transactions and overspending to assist department managers in taking timely remedial actions.
Identify pain points within existing financial information systems, provide solutions and establish best practices to minimize redundant workflow and data fragmentation.
Partake in special projects and various Institute initiatives to improve data quality, reduce data processing time and to streamline accounting and budgeting processes.
Work with business users, and enterprise data architect to refine/adapt/maintain data mappings as business user needs change or the data environment changes.
Other special projects as assigned.




Education: Bachelor’s degree required preferribly in computer science or business, MBA a plus.

Experience:



	At least 5 years of experience using SAP Business Objects including both creating and maintaining complex queries, views and stored procedures. Experience in Adaptive budget tool preferred.
Strong business and systems analysis skills, test planning and testing skills, troubleshooting skills and experience with numerous environments and architectures.
Experience in higher education or complex non-profit preferred.
Advanced skills in MS Excel (ability to create and use pivot tables, macros, lookups,etc), Access, and PowerPoint.
The ideal candidate must be highly organized with an attention to details. The ability to adapt to and lead change in a business environment is also critical.
Must be an independent and creative thinker.
Must be able to work with and communicate with individuals at all levels within the Institution.
Must be able to present ideas clearly and concisely to all audiences verbally and in writing.
Proven analytical, problem solving, time management and organizational skills




Please submit your cover letter and resume. If you are selected for an interview, please be prepared to provide at least 5 References via our on-line reference tool system. At least 2 of your References must be, or have been, your direct managers.

title: Madewell Customer Data Science Sr. Analyst
desc:
MADEWELL is seeking a Data Scientist to join a growing Customer Insights and Analytics team that is obsessed with data science, customer insights and digital innovation. Madewell is uniquely positioned to innovate retail marketing. Our digitally-engaged customer base is fanatical about our jeans (and everything she wears with them), our styling and our top-level customer service. She loves browsing on her iPhone, consuming digital content, and shopping stores all with seamless store-to-digital communication and service. Come join our team and help us reinvent retail. As an analyst you’ll report to the Customer Insights & Analytics Manager. You will be a pioneering member of a performance-drive team. You will be the empirical, numbers-driven voice of reason that helps elevate Madewell’s customer strategies. You will have a focus on building data models to deliver insights to drive strategic business decisions.

_

The ideal candidate is:



	Objective and scientifically hypothesis-driven: obsessed with finding the right answer; lets numbers define the story rather than finding numbers to support a hypothesis
Technical and business-savvy: not only able to write code and employ data/statistical methods, but also understands the business
A forward-thinking visionary, keeping up with Data Science/Analytics trends and always on the lookout to improve on the status quo
Organized and able to work on multiple projects at a time
Comfortable working in Tableau (or other Data Visualization/Reporting tools, ie. Excel, Powerpoint)
Able to communicate well with Analysts and Engineers as well as Business Stakeholders

_

Responsibilities include:



	Creating/support Customer Segmentation, Forecasting, CLV, Basket models
Assisting in fostering discipline for statistically sound reporting across analytics teams
Identifying opportunities to streamline analytics processes and reporting efficiencies
Developing standardized adhoc reporting models
Pulling data from Madewell Databases and manipulating large datasets for adhoc analyses

_

Qualifications:



	3-5 years of experience with strong analytical skills; experience with customer analytics or retail industry experience preferredÂ 

BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Management, Economics, Computer Science, or similar quantitative field
Proficiency with either Python or R; Experience with Big Data tools is a plus
Proficiency with SQL and Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Excel, Powerpoint)

We are committed to affirmatively providing equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, legally protected physical or mental disability or any other basis protected under applicable law.

title: Data Systems Analyst (SAP ECC)
desc: Job DescriptionThe Data Systems Analyst role is to model/map and execute all activities related to the integration of data across various sources into an organized and unified view. This individual is also responsible for the monitoring of data flow between databases, servers and Cloud services to identify and implement the most suitable data integration architecture for the organization's needs. Proven communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of integration best practices are critical to successful performance in this role. A person with high attention to detail and a logical mindset with strong motivation and passion for technology and problem solving would be a great candidate.Duties/Responsibilities: -Work with managers, systems users, developers, and business analysts to ensure that data entry, retrieval, and maintenance functions meet business requirements and ensure a high level of data availability and security.-Lead in company data integrations with various systems that are utilized.-Coordinate and work with other technical staff to develop relational databases and secondary databases.-Manage analytics reporting systems including Tableau server.-Identify inefficiencies in current databases and integration processes and leverage solutions.-Install and configure relevant components to ensure database access and overall database security.-Diagnose and resolve database access and performance issues.-Analyze user requirements and, based on findings, design functional specifications for client/server databases and database applications.-Evaluate and select database components, including hardware, relational database management systems, ETL software, metadata management tools, and database design solutions. Job Specifications:-Proven experience in overseeing the linking of cross-functional databases between disparate business units and systems.-Strong experience with SAP ECC database that supports sales orders, inventory, quality management, accounting, etc.-Experience with ETL software, preferably Alteryx, to integrate data between systems.-Experience managing, securing and deploying data in Tableau server.-Maintain high standards of data quality and security through the introduction and enforcement of information handling processes and organization of the data integration processes.-Hands-on experience with business and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping and methodology development, and data mapping.-Working technical knowledge of current database software, protocols, and standards.-Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices.-Working technical experience with designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting database servers, including Microsoft SQL 2016.-Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices methodology.-Hands-on database tuning and troubleshooting experience.-Experience with data processing flowcharting techniques.-Technical Project management experience.-Working technical experience with developing, installing, configuring and supporting database environment.

title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
desc:
About us

ERGO is a marketing technology company that drives the relevance of what’s inside an email with Smart Content. The best way to understand what we do is to imagine that you’re reading your favorite magazine, and with every page you turn, the magazine learns to anticipate your needs and interests and adapts with relevant content.

Our platform leverages big data to drive our Smart Content modules in digital channels. We use our technology platform and professional-services offering to help group Fortune 1000 brands.

About the Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Analytics Manager to join our team. Your primary responsibility will be to analyze data and develop visually appealing easy-to-understand charts, graphs, reports, dashboard views and insight narratives and recommendations. More specifically, you will be responsible for:


Designing and automating reports for specific products, customers and programs using Python, SQL, and Tableau
Developing and presenting reports with insights to help drive customer and internal decisions
Performing ad-hoc analysis of composite data to quantify trends in market/customer behavior
Designing visually compelling dashboard views for our clients
Developing a thorough understanding of email user data flow 

Developing and maintaining internal and external controls to store and retrieve client data, reports, marketing material, and other data

What The Role Requires


Have a deep passion, curiosity, and understanding of advanced data analysis and a strong business sense
Are a self-starter, problem solver, resourceful and are able to work with limited supervision
Are flexible and able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines
Have a strong team spirit
Are a strong verbal and written communicator and excellent collaborator that values building strong relationships with colleagues, clients, and other stakeholders
Have the ability to understand complex topics/processes/problems and explain them to your colleagues in simple terms
Are customer, results, and solutions oriented
Have 3+ years of experience in a role that required advanced analytics, extensive reporting, and abstracting insights/recommendations from large datasets
Have a University Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Operational Research, Business Intelligence or similar quantitative discipline
Have an excellent knowledge of Tableau and Excel (VLookups, Index, Match, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS functions a must)
Have or can quickly develop a working knowledge of email marketing and web analytics



Ability to help us win on Trivia Night

Perks


Choice of Blink Gym or Citibike membership

Total of 23 PTO package that includes things like: company shut down between Christmas and New Years, three 4-day weekends on the summer holidays, and a 4-day Thanksgiving break. This also includes 10 PTO days to use at your convenience.

The best perk? Our people. If you’re ready to join us, apply now!

title: Mental Health Senior Data Analyst
desc:
The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. is seeking one (1) qualified candidate to fill the full-time position of Mental Health Senior Data Analyst.

The Bureau of Mental Health is responsible for mental health service delivery and planning for New York City residents. Through contracting directly with NYC service providers, the Bureau is responsible for procuring and overseeing over 400 treatment, rehabilitation, housing, case management, advocacy, and Assisted Outpatient Treatment programs. Bureau staff are responsible for managing the development, implementation, and oversight of ongoing and newly contracted mental health programs. Through these contracts and through its policy, planning and advocacy work, the Bureau seeks to facilitate access and quality care and recovery for all New York City residents. The Bureau is also responsible for implementing and overseeing a number of the adult mental health focused Thrive NYC initiatives.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Under the direction of the Director of Research and Evaluation the Senior Data Analyst will work in the Program Analytics and Systems Unit of the Office of Research and Evaluation to enhance the bureau's data collection and analysis capacities.

Specifically, the candidate will:


Oversee programmatic data activities including the development and maintenance of data collection systems, reporting, ad hoc data analysis, and report writing.Design and execute analysis projects to inform program oversight and enhance program operations. Using SQL and SAS, clean and analyze program data from multiple sources and generate tables, figures, and reports.Design and implement analysis plans for examining program processes and outcomes; employ methods for predictive and longitudinal data analysis.Work closely with program leadership and staff to develop indicators for program operations and outcomes. Offer ongoing recommendations for data-driven tracking and refinement of Housing and other program outcomes.Effectively present and explain data and findings verbally, in writing and in graphical format to program management, non-technical audiences, and program leadership. Manage data in our Mental Health Maven Data System. Monitor data quality on an ongoing basis. Develop reports and workflows. Complete data checks and documentation for routine and custom data reports.Collaborate with IT staff and vendor to work on the development, enhancement, and implementation of new and existing data systems.Maintain technical written documentation such as data reports, data dictionaries, data access rules, methods and business rules.Research best practices, program models and program performance standards; identify trends and best practices in supportive housing models or other program areas.Supervise and mentor other research staff.


Minimum Requirements:


A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and two years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate filed of specialization; orEducation and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Strong proficiency with SAS coding. Experience in both quantitative and qualitative analytical methods is preferred. Experience in data visualization is desirable.Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to communicate research and informatics at a variety of levels of understanding.Experience with administrative and/or program data.

Preferred Skills:

Excellent interpersonal, analytical, research, presentation, written and oral communication skills.Experience working with relational databases, experience with SQL, and in data visualization is desirable.Knowledge of New York's supportive housing services and mental health recovery is desired. Display the ability to translate business needs into quantifiable data requirements and explicitly communicate the data requirements and limitations of a project. Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment


Work Location: 42-09 28th Street, Queens, New York 11101

Salary: Commensurate with experience

To Apply: Submit a resume and cover letter by April 5, 2019, on our website at http://corporate.rfmh.org click on Employment Opportunities. Only applications submitted through our website will be considered.

The Research Foundation is a private not-for-profit corporation and is not an agency or instrumentality of the State of New York. Employees of the Research Foundation are not state employees, do not participate in any state retirement system, and do not receive state fringe benefits. Excellent Benefits Package. Employer/Minority/Women/Disabled/Veteran Employer. VEVRAA 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) compliant.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Sr Data Analyst
desc:
Business Title

Technical Analyst II

22-Oct-2019

Posting Location

United States - Connecticut - Stamford

Posting Job Description

JOB SUMMARY

The Sr. Data Analyst for Revenue Assurance is responsible for maintaining information systems and provide technical support for all aspects of the revenue assurance department. As part of the role this individual is responsible for collaborating in the identification of leakage across the enterprise and coordinating with cross functional teams to drive incremental revenue/profits and costs reductions. The position reports to the Dir. Revenue Assurance.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Support the RA team in the maintaining and technical preparation of reports/dashboards/trend analysis to inform management how well the company is transforming services into profits.

Serve as a liaison to the Marketing/Billing department and assist/collaborate in efforts related to revenue planning, pricing and packaging, and promotion management.

Partner and collaborate with the Business Intelligence team on automation of reporting and process improvements and other analysis.

Develop and implement revenue assurance applications and processes, including data extraction, creation of data warehouses when required.

Assist with building automated test tools for alerting. Regular review and maintenance of alerting test cases.

Research questions for management and conduct ad-hoc investigations.

Establish and monitor processes and controls to protect revenue and data integrity/synchronization among systems.

Identify and quantify revenue opportunities and coordinate with cross functional teams to realize incremental revenue.

Develop and maintain reporting databases to establish trending to detect leakage.

Perform other duties as requested by supervisor

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge

Investigation: Ability to perform data analysis, statistical analysis, detailed data tracing, raw CDR review

Baseline Reporting: Ability to manage data warehousing, SQLs scripting for investigation and proof of concept purpose

Network/Systems: Knowledge of a particular revenue management system, extremely comfortable with managements of databases, SQLs queries, data conversions, programs and operational disciplines.

Synchronization: Ability to perform complex data matching processes and data diagnosis across multiple systems.

Correction: Experience scoping and troubleshooting systems and sizing organizational problems, has authority to propose changes.

Ability to read, write, speak and understand English.

Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner.

Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure.

Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks, prioritize and organize effectively.

Ability to think outside the box and apply critical thinking skills.

Ability to use personal computer and software applications (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).

Ability to work independently.

High level of curiosity and investigate mind-set with attention to detail.

Cable television products, telecommunications, monthly recurrent services or cable billing systems experience preferred

Experience with CSG or ICOMS billing systems is a plus

Education

Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in computer science or information technology or equivalent experience.

Related Work Experience Number of Years 

Advanced technical data experience 5+

Including two or more years of writing advanced SQL, tuning database/

query performance is strongly preferred.

Cable billing systems, telecommunication 3+

Experience with CSG or ICOMS billing systems is a plus

WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment

Minimal travel may be required

Requisition #

251698BR

Job Code

TAN320 Technical Analyst II Exempt

Position Type

Full Time

Area of Interest

Engineering, Finance and Accounting, Information Technology Services

Business Unit

Corporate

Location

400 Atlantic St

FCC Unit

HQ452

Account Code

C01-21111-809

Controlling Establishment ID

01187 - 400 Atlantic Street

More on Spectrum

The Spectrum brands (including Spectrum Networks, Spectrum Enterprise and Spectrum Reach) are powered and innovated by Charter Communications. Charter Communications reaffirms its commitment to providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement to qualified employees and applicants. Individuals will be considered for positions for which they meet the minimum qualifications and are able to perform without regard to race, color, gender, age, religion, disability, national origin, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.

 Req #: I34821

 2 Crescent Place, Oceanport, NJ 07757
 

Job Summary

The SQL Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assisting the director and management team in monitoring financial data and related processes that contribute to the successful operations of RCS and its respective divisions; Accounts Receivable Services, Managed Care Services, and Professional Services. In addition,he/she will be responsible for translating business requirements into both high-level and detailed functional specifications. Candidates must be able to work at a detailed level while maintaining the big picture of the overall division goals. Other responsibilities include compiling comprehensive reports for clients, designing and supporting internal databases, data mining and analysis, and providing support for the day-to-day operations.

Requirements

Bachelor s degree in Systems Engineering, MIS, Computer Science, Finance, or related field from an accredited 4 year universityIntermediate SQL knowledgeIntermediate understanding of database conceptsKnowledge in capturing, analyzing and communicating measurement results5 years of experience in a business analysis role, with at least 3 in a hospital business office setting or similar settingKnowledge of insurance company practices regarding reimbursementAbility to work well individually and in a team environmentAble to work in a professional, corporate settingExperience working with customer support/client issue resolution managementMust be reliable, responsible, goal oriented and flexibleStrong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including complex formulas, pivot tables, pivot charts, pivot formulasA thorough understanding of best practices for efficiently working with very large data sets in ExcelIntermediate Microsoft Access experience is preferableIntermediate understanding of Tableau or other BI reporting software (Qlikview, Crystal, etc )Excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills

title: Data Support & Solutions Analyst
desc:
Remedy Partners is seeking a Data Support & Solutions Analyst to join our growing Tribe. The Data Support & Solutions Analyst will be part of the Partner Services team tasked with general support of Remedy field operations. Key tasks include ensuring data quality and accuracy to support the utilization of Episode Connect (Remedy’s proprietary EHR software) and Reporting platform, and other administrative support.

Why this role?

This individual will have responsibility for ensuring availability and correctness of underlying data for analytical reports on the performance of physicians, hospitals, and other health care providers, etc. Primarily, this will entail understanding and improving the flow of data through the Episode Connect Care management platform. In that capacity, this individual will have to marry business analytical, and technical expertise to ensure that the appropriate logic is built into EC, and subsequently understood by the analytical and technical staff who need to leverage it.

Are you right for this job?

Bachelor’s degree or higher level of educationPassionate about healthcare and affecting change in the current healthcare environmentExhibits strong critical thinking and creative problem-solving skillsDemonstrates strong proficiency in computer software navigationExhibits fundamental knowledge of MS Office specifically PowerPoint and ExcelStrong verbal and written communication skillsDemonstrates ability to work effectively as a member of an interdisciplinary team, displaying good judgment and decision-making skillsExcellent organizational skills and ability to multi-taskDemonstrates attention to detail and ability to produce accurate and high-quality work product

What will you do?

Create and deliver presentations, reports and other materials to support Account Managers with day to day activitiesEnsure the integrity of data in Remedy’ proprietary EHR Episode Connect and proactively identify and resolve any issuesStreamline communication between Partner Services and other supporting departmentsSupport comprehensive and actionable tracking of program performanceSupport miscellaneous administrative for Partner Services department

title: Senior Data Analyst, Supervised Release Program
desc:
Job DescriptionThe Center for Court Innovation is a non-profit organization that works to create a more effective and humane justice system by performing original research and helping launch reforms by guiding justice innovators, nationally and internationally. The Center creates operating projects that have been documented to reduce the use of jail and prison, assist victims of crime, and strengthen communities.

The Center's Data Analytics and Applied Research (DAAR) team is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to work primarily on the Supervised Release Program (SRP), a pretrial alternative to bail and detention in New York City. This position offers an opportunity to develop and implement data processes and protocols that ensure criminal justice researchers, stakeholders and policymakers are equipped with the valid and reliable data needed to identify trends, measure outcomes, and inform policy.

The Senior Data Analyst will provide critical data support to this innovative, cross-borough initiative by conducting regular data quality audits, coordinating database management tasks, developing comprehensive data documentation and training materials, and collaborating with researchers to generate analyses, reports, visualizations, and interactive dashboards that help monitor and evaluate program indicators and outcomes. The Senior Data Analyst reports directly to the Deputy Director of Data Analytics and Applied Research and is responsible for directly supervising one Data Analyst.

The successful candidate must bring a real interest in this work along with extensive knowledge of relational databases, data visualization software (Tableau), and a demonstrated ability to write complex queries in SQL (or other programming languages used to extract and manipulate data). For more information about the Center’s operating programs, please visit www.courtinnovation.org/programs.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Conduct regular data audits by generating automated reports that effectively and efficiently flag data discrepancies that need to be addressed in the Center’s case management database;Analyze data for common trends in data quality and systematize findings to identify and prioritize specific areas for improvement;Coordinate and manage modifications to the database to ensure standardization across multiple SRP sites;Develop and implement protocols for tracking changes made to the database and/or data collection and reporting processes;Support the management of the organization-wide database more generally (e.g., gather, analyze, and determine data and information needs across multiple initiatives and propose solutions to streamline data collection and reporting practices);Develop and maintain data codebooks and database documentation;Provide technical support to the DAAR team:


Build and maintain interactive dashboards and produce data visualizations using Tableau;Prepare analytical datasets by querying, extracting, merging, cleaning, and re-coding programmatic data from the Center’s case management database;Perform quality assurance checks on queries and data reports;Contribute to/assist with data analyses for special research projects;Identify and facilitate data-related training and development opportunities for the DAAR team.
Collaborate with the Center’s Technology team to improve DAAR-Tech processes and act as liaison to Lead Solutions Architect;Provide direct supervision for, and manage professional development of, one Data Analyst.

Qualifications: The ideal candidate will have a Master’s Degree or a Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative discipline, plus 3-5 years’ of relevant data experience, preferably in the criminal justice field. Qualified applicants must be inherent problem solvers with exceptional attention to detail, strong logical reasoning, analytical, and communication (written and oral) skills. Other qualifications include:

Working knowledge of RDBMS concepts (relational databases), experience with database interface and query software, such as Toad or Oracle SQL Developer, and a demonstrated ability to write complex, highly-optimized SQL queries (or equivalency) to extract and manipulate data are required;____Familiarity with Salesforce platforms is preferred;Statistical software syntax expertise is required (R, Python, SPSS, SAS, Stata et);Professional experience using data visualization software and/or mapping tools such as ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS or equivalency in a professional setting is required (Tableau skills strongly preferred);Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, filters, basic formulas) is required; Access, PowerPoint (or Prezi) skills also preferred;Infographics expertise is required;Experience manipulating and analyzing large datasets is required; familiarity with administrative and government datasets is a plus;Knowledge of basic statistical analysis methods such as regression and ANOVA is a plus;Strong task management skills and a demonstrated ability to meet deliverables in a timely manner are required;Demonstrated ability to work independently and take initiative to solve problems as they arise is a must; Applicants must also be comfortable collaborating with teammates as well as colleagues from various other departments, including technology and operations;Prior management or supervisory experience is a plus;Knowledge of and strong interest in the criminal justice system is a must.

Location: Midtown, NY with occasional travel to one or more of the Center’s three project sites operating the Supervised Release Program in three boroughs: Staten Island Community Justice Center, Brooklyn Justice Initiatives, and Bronx Community Solutions.

Compensation: Salary range starts at $70,000 and is commensurate with experience. Excellent benefits package including comprehensive health, dental and life insurance, four weeks paid vacation, paid sick time, TransitChek, Flexible Spending Account plans for health and dependent care, a 403(b) retirement plan and a 401(k) retirement plan with a generous employer match.

The Fund for the City of New York/Center for Court Innovation is an equal opportunity employer. The Center does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other category protected by law. We strongly encourage and seek applications from women, people of color, members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities as well as individuals with prior contact with the criminal justice system.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete an employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. Only applicants under consideration will be contacted. No phone calls please.

title: Lead Senior Data Visualization Reporting Analyst
desc: Lead Senior Data Visualization Reporting Analyst Job Description The Lead Senior Data Visualization Reporting Analyst will be a key role for APFM Sales Ops. They will provide timely, accurate and easily understood information to APFM’s teams, via the reporting solutions they create. This position knows how to work with large sets of data, create reports in many different tools, harbor excellent project management skills and communicate relevant insights very well. This person can create high-level management dashboards but also project-specific reports to ensure success. We are looking for someone with the right experience who is interested in working at a small company to see the impact of their work almost immediately! Key ResponsibilitiesCreate and manage our reports end-to-end: Build automated, actionable and accurate reporting suites (e.g. Management dashboards, Sales rep dashboards, exception alerting reports, tool adoption tracking report, etc.). To do this, they must be able to work across reporting systems, namely: SSRS, SF reports, Qlikview, and Tableau. Further they will also be modifying/enhancing our existing suite of reports in SSRS and Qlikview, as needed. Analyze current business performance, build models to both explain current trends and create dashboards that accurately reflect the current stateUnderstand top initiatives that the company is focusing on, and then be able to anticipate + create the reporting needs that will ensure project success.Analyze the status quo and present recommendationsBe able to analyze current reports and work with the sales teams to decide which reports are needed, which can be deleted and which need to be modified.Be able to identify discrepancies between reports and resolve.Suggest reporting tools that the company is not using today that would help us scale to the futureRequired Skills and CompetenciesMinimum 5+ years’ experience in analytical environments with emphasis on data analysis and reporting. Highly analytical: Exceptional analytical and problem solving capabilities, including the ability to logically and efficiently structure ambiguous problems, identify sources of data, conduct complicated analysis, identify key insights and recommend actions. Be able to query and analyze data from various and differing systems (both technical and process)Creative problem solver: Skilled at information collection and discovery; demonstrated ability to develop practical, workable solutions. Skilled at learning and applying new technology tools. Demonstrates ownership: Ability to learn quickly, be proactive, and assume ownership for broad tracks of work. This role is intended for somebody who will take meaningful responsibility for scaling and maintaining reporting and analysisHighly collaborative: Able to work across functions, geographies, and organizational levels to develop solutions; engages and involves key stakeholders. Be able to collaborate well with sales leaders (generally the end user of most of our reports)Creates leverage: Able to design efficient, scalable solutions while constantly focusing efforts on the most beneficial activitiesStrong communicator: Able to communicate well to a data-savvy audience but also to less data savvy audiences. Able to translate data insights to sales teams.Project management: Able to manage small to medium sized projects Team player: Builds good relationships with the team and across the organization.Strong “fire fighter” mentality – ready to jump in, respond and help sales teams experiencing issues; Able to track a trend in the issues, come up with a plan and solve Education Requirements + SkillsBachelor’s degree required. Graduate study preferred.  SkillsExceptional SQL experience, requiredExperience in SSRS, preferred Experience in Qlikview, preferredExperience in Tableau, preferred CompensationThe position is a salary, exempt position.

title: Research Data Analyst - Open Rank
desc:
Job Descriptions:

POSITION SUMMARY

Would you like to work in a highly collaborative professional environment, applying data analysis and statistical programming methods to help answer challenging research questions and support the development of new educational assessments? If this sounds intriguing, then we'd like to talk to you about joining our team of dedicated and innovative research data analysts.

ETS is the world's premier educational measurement institution and a leader in educational research. As an innovator in developing achievement and occupational tests for clients in education, business, and government, ETS is determined to advance educational excellence for the communities we serve.

Headquartered in Princeton, NJ, ETS Research & Development has openings for research data analysts at all levels in the Data Analysis and Research Technologies department. Our research data analysts collaborate with ETS research scientists on a wide variety of research initiatives and with ETS psychometricians in developing solutions supporting the analysis of assessment results. This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of a research and development team and have a significant impact on the next generation of assessments.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

+ Implement or plan and manage the implementation of data analysis components of research projects requiring the development of complex data analysis systems.

+ Working knowledge of and experience with FORTRAN, C, Java, Python or similar high-level language.

+ Contribute to the planning of the schedule of tasks required to complete major components of large-scale, complex data analyses.

+ Work effectively in a team setting and take an active role in contributing to or leading team discussion and decisions.

+ Analyze, design, modify, develop, document and implement technologies for executing complex research and development data analyses/methodologies.

+ Contribute to the preparation or analysis and development of data analysis components of proposal and cost/resource estimates.

+ Consult on data analysis procedures and problems and propose solutions using new and emerging technologies. Contribute to the evaluation and/or implementation and support of new hardware/software/data analysis methodologies to support research system development.

+ Maintain continuing awareness of recent advances in numerical analysis, computer science and statistical technologies.

+ Attend staff training and development, or assist with and contribute to staff training and development initiatives through area-wide technical presentations and one-on-one mentoring.

+ Implement components of technical documentation of data analysis systems, solutions and results. Assist with or contribute to final reports, papers, memoranda, and technical sections of ETS proposals.

Required Experience:

REQUIREMENTS FOR AN ASSISTANT RESEARCH DATA ANALYST

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a closely related field is required. Six months of expertise in a related data analysis field are required. Strong programming background and coursework in statistics are essential. Expertise in graphics and spreadsheet software and experience in analyzing data using statistical/psychometric techniques are highly desirable.

REQUIREMENTS FOR AN ASSOCIATE RESEARCH DATA ANALYST

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a closely related field is required. Two years of experience in a related data analysis field are required. Strong programming background and coursework in statistics are essential. Expertise in graphics and spreadsheet software and experience in analyzing data using statistical/psychometric techniques are highly desirable.

REQUIREMENTS FOR A RESEARCH DATA ANALYST

A Master's degree in Computer Science, mathematics, Statistics or a closely related field is required. Four years of diverse experience in data analysis, handling increasingly more complex and diverse research and development data analyses, are required. Strong programming background and coursework in statistics are essential. Expertise in graphics and spreadsheet software and experience in analyzing data using statistical/psychometric techniques are highly desirable.

REQUIREMENTS FOR A SENIOR RESEARCH DATA ANALYST

A Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics, or a closely related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired is necessary. Six years of diverse experience in data analysis, handling increasingly more complex and diverse research and development data analyses is necessary. Strong programming background and coursework in statistics are essential. Expertise in graphics and spreadsheet software and experience in analyzing data using statistical/psychometric techniques are highly desirable.

REQUIREMENTS FOR A PRINCIPAL RESEARCH DATA ANALYST

A Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics, or a closely related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired is necessary. Eight years of experience in positions requiring knowledge and use of data analysis, handling increasingly more complex, innovative and diverse program and research data analyses, including experience in technical project management is necessary. Strong programming background and coursework in statistics are essential. Expertise in graphics and spreadsheet software and experience in analyzing data using statistical/psychometric techniques are required. title: Senior Data Analyst / Scientist
desc:
Senior Data Scientist in the Analytics Team for the digital transformation program within Wholesale Credit Technology. Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for Software developers design, code, test, debug, document programs as well as maintain corporate systems architecture. Employees work closely with business partners in defining requirements for system applications. Employees typically have in-depth knowledge of development tools and languages. Employees are expected to have in-depth global markets and credit product knowledge, and manage a high level of risk. Is clearly recognized as a content expert by peers. I



	The scope of projects include Descriptive, Predictive and Prescriptive Analytics, as well asm NLP activities such as document classification, even detection and data extraction.
Cultivate the team and the infrastructure to support modeling and analyzing both structured and unstructured data for Wholesale Credit Business lines.
Develop value-added analytics and NLP solutions that support revenue generation, business insight, risk management, operational efficiency, regulatory compliance, loan pricing, pre and post-sale loan facility research.
These solutions must overcome issues of complex data (e.g., VLDB, multi-structured, "big data", etc.) as well as deployment of advanced techniques (e.g., machine learning, text mining, statistical analysis, etc.) to deliver insights.
Determine best practices in the areas of NLP, Data Science and Machine Learning.
Facilitate the use of these technologies within the non-retail loan business and loan system applications including Pricing and Credit and other fulfillment and underwriting activities in Wholesale Credit business processes. 

Liaise with Global Banking and Markets and Enterprise Level teams to determine the best practices in the firm and contribute to improving proficiency in these areas for WCBT, and the firm more generally.
Work with the Robotics and Analytics Swat Team during project intake and present new technologies that relate to solutions for high ROI applications of analytics.
Manage projects and mentor other Data Scientists.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:



	MS and/or Ph.D. degree in related field preferred or substantial equivalent experience.
Management experience a plus
Typically requires a minimum of 7-10+ years as a practitioner of machine learning in Financial Markets.

title: Data Analyst Team Lead
desc:
White hat online data detectives with superior analytical skills, strong R skills (or solid Python expertise with the ability to quickly master R) and supervisory or team lead experience: our client is looking for candidates like you to fill an open Data Analyst Team Lead role in their perk-filled New York office.

This client has combined machine learning, behavior analysis and groundbreaking technology in an e-commerce SaaS solution that helps prevent fraud, pinpoints genuine purchasers and guides those legitimate users to checkout in order to drive revenue gains.

In this role, youll join the operations team responsible for real-time online fraud prevention, rapid response troubleshooting and customer performance. You will play a substantial role in identifying and analyzing emerging online fraud trends in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. The successful candidate will gain a deep knowledge of company offerings and utilize strong analytical skills to surface actionable insights to our enterprise customers. The Data Analyst Team lead will supervise a data analyst group while also managing their own assigned clients.

This is a fantastic opportunity for an online fraud expert to shine in a high visibility, high responsibility role at a leading SaaS firm that rewards its staffers hard work with fully-covered medical/dental/vision coverage from day one, employee stock options, 401(k) match, commuter programs, catered lunches and snacks, team events, Pilates/yoga and more!

Primary Responsibilities:

Manage a team of four to five data analysts in a highly technical environment, effectively leveraging top tier analytical tools and advanced analytical methods to identify, surface and address data trends and performance issues; directly analyze live data to gain a strong mastery of online fraud prevention

Communicate findings and conclusions in a clear, concise manner to both non-technical and technical stakeholders

Work consultatively with clients and internal colleagues to answer their business questions and needs through data insights

Design, develop and deliver comprehensive technical fraud prevention solutions

Collaborate with internal teams to optimize processes touching on data analysis

Required Experience, Skills and Traits:

4+ years experience working with R or Python (e.g., creating functions, wrangling data, etc.), including experience leading a team and working in a client-facing role; expert level MySQL skills; if not yet an expert in R, must be willing to quickly gain that knowledge

Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills

Machine learning knowledge or experience is a plus

Bachelor's or Master's degree, ideally in a quantitative area of study (e.g., statistics, computer science, natural science, mathematics, etc.), business administration or economics

Eligibility to work in the U.S. without Visa sponsorship is required

Occasional night and weekend work is required, to serve a global customer and partner base
